story:
Who We Are

We are a Birmingham-based Italian Ice business committed to making the city a little sweeter by serving some of the best frozen treats in town and helping to revitalize our communities through-out the Magic City.


Background

MCSI had an incredible first year, and we can’t believe the overwhelming positive response from the community. It's hard to believe how far we've come in such a short time, thanks to the wonderful support of our amazing customers. We haven't even opened the first store yet, and already we have been approached about opening two more locations in the downtown Birmingham area!!!

 


With the help and support we received from REV Birmingham, we were able to launch our business last June at the Woodlawn Street Market. From there, we operated from our Italian Ice Push-Cart at what became our regular spot, the Norwood Market at the Trolley Stop. We were also at a lot of seasonal events all over the city -- the Sidewalk Film Festival, Trucks by Tracks, and Cask & Drum, just to name a few. We had television interviews on Fox 6 and ABC 33/40, and was also one of the final contestants in REV Birmingham’s Shark Tank-style completion, “The BIG Pitch”, featuring ten of Birmingham’s most promising up-and-coming businesses.

Coming Soon...

Although we ABSOLUTELY will continue to operate from push-carts at local events; we are excited to announce that we have acquired a beautiful location for our first store, and are poised to open this Spring in West Homewood. The store is located right off West Oxmoor Road, on Oak Grove Road, across the street from Patriot Park, -- a perfect family-friendly location to enjoy a frozen treat and spend the afternoon in the park. We are already meeting some of the wonderful families in the neighborhood and are incredibly excited to be part of the beginning phase in the revitalization of West Homewood. Every time we're there at the store, someone stops by to introduce themselves and tells us how happy they are we're coming to the neighborhood.


What We Need & What You Get

We are truly grateful to our loyal and fast growing customer base, and thankful for all the support from our family and friends. At this time, we would highly appreciate more of your support to help transform our first store into your next frozen-treat destination.

We're working to raise $10,000 to assist with the purchasing of the following desperately needed items:

  • Italian Ice Dipping Cabinet - $4,500 
  • A pastry case to serve baked goods from local bakeries - $2,000
  • Furniture for the inside of the store and patio - $1,000
  • State inspection, licensing, and legal fees - $1,500
  • Signage and decor. - $1,000

With this campaign, we have commitment options from $5 -$1,000 with some great perks. We are also looking for a limited number of investors. If you're interested in becoming an investor, please contact David Shaw directly at email@magiccitysweetice.com or 205.235.6658, for further details.


Building Community

Building community is one of the most important aspects of our personal lives, and we've brought this same spirit as a core of our business model. The funds that we're raising in this campaign, will also go towards helping set-up this store to be used as a facility for training future entrepreneurs. We will equip interested employees to start their own Italian Ice business and become small-business-owners themselves through our (BYOB – Be Your Own Boss) training program. Our long-term vision, is to also use this store as the model for future stores as worker-owned locations. We strongly believe that providing more well-paying jobs and keeping more of the neighborhoods where it is earned, makes more business sense, and strengthens our local economy.
Sweets and Treats

Our Italian Ice is an incredibly refreshing frozen treat made from fruits and other natural flavorings blended into it a creamy texture almost like ice cream, but without any dairy product, and only a fraction of the calories.

In addition to serving our hand-scooped Italian Ice, we plan to sell soft-serve ice cream shortly after we open. We will also be serving teas, homemade hot chocolate; and in an effort to help support other local businesses, we plan to serve coffee from local roasters, and baked goods from local bakeries.


Risks & Challenges

We had a crazy successful first season with just a push cart at local events, and looking to build on that momentum, we are poised to open our first store in Spring of 2015. However, without adequate funding, the opening may be delayed. Thou we still need to pass Health Dept. inspection, we do not expect any related state inspection issues since the location was a restaurant in the past.
We will continue to operate our push carts around the city at local events, in addition to the store. Our customers can still find out what events we will be at by liking us on Facebook, or following us on Twitter.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign and spread the word on social media and ask folks to check us out. Your support will help build our local economy.
  • Buy some delicious Italian Ice treat! Whether you come by the store or visit our push-cart at a local event, we guarantee you’ll leave happy. And they say, our Italian Ice tastes even better if you bring your family or a friend.
  • Put a sticker on your car! They come with every level of support and help build our brand.

story:
10th Anniversary of City Fresh

More than 49 million American's live in food desert communities, where grocery stores have closed and left residents without access to fresh, healthy food.  Since 2006, City Fresh has worked in these communities to offer low-income residents local, sustainably-grown fruits and vegetables in weekly share baskets. Your contribution subsidizes shares in these communities and keeps small, local farmers growing.

The campaign video is from our presentation at Social Venture Partner’s 2014 BigBANG! Event. We went on to win the competition, open 18 Fresh Stop locations, deliver more than 11,000 baskets of fresh, local food in our region, and inspire more than 800 students to come to our farm, learn about where their food comes from and to consider sustainable farming as a future career. 


Our price model, which relies on volunteerism and philanthropic support, provides top quality local fruits and vegetables at approximately 1/4 the cost of grocery store prices.  And yet, we can return more than $0.80 of customer dollars to the farmer who grew the food - compared with an average of just $0.10 at box-store grocers.

With 4 full and part-time staff, 20 farmers, more than 100 volunteers, and a box truck that runs on waste vegetable oil, we have delivered more than 100,000 of these baskets in the last 9 years.

Help us continue to build more justice into our regional food systems!


What We Need

We need the funds on hand to start our season, pay farmers, spread the word about our program through community events and social and print media, pay for rent, utilities, communications, get our trucks in tip-top shape, and pay our small team - in short - we need money with no strings attached, or general operating funds.

Our 2015 Budget breaks down as follows:
EXPENSES
153,000  • Food Purchases
130,000  • Staff Wages
 38,000   • Taxes
 15,000   • Fleet Repair and Fuel
 12,500   • Rent, Communications, Utilities
 10,000   • Depreciation
   8,500   • Market & Event Supplies
   7,500   • Insurance
   5,500   • Improvements/Upgrades
380,000 • TOTAL EXPENSES

INCOME
220,000  • Share Sales
 30,000   • Events, Classes, & Tours
 80,000   • Grants and Corporate Contributions
 60,000  • Individual Giving Campaign
390,000 • TOTAL INCOME


2015 is our 10th anniversary season.  Help us grow the low-income share program, reach more neighborhoods, and continue teaching young people about their food, the land on which it grows, and the ideas fueling the local food movement.

What You Get

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • HELP US MAKE SOME NOISE - Share this campaign with folks you know, tell them why you feel our work is important, and help us spread a wider net.
  • Offer to VOLUNTEER at a Fresh Stop or our Farm for all or part of the summer. It's a few hours in the evenings, and a TON of fun - we always need the help and love welcoming fresh faces.
  • SIGN UP FOR A SHARE - our full-price single share and family share rates just cover costs, but they keep us delivering year after after. If you can't make a tax-deductible contribution, consider signing up for a regular-priced share for the 2015 season.

Thank you SO MUCH for your kind support!

story:
Short Summary

Our names are Brian Becker and Daniel Hochman. We are both foreign born immigrants to Israel. Both of us served in the Israeli army and were lone soldiers. We are currently attending IDC Interdisciplinary Center in Herzliya, Israel and are about to launch our brand new startup. 

We are launching a discount card for the center of Israel. People will buy the card from our company and be able to use it to get discounts all around the center of Israel. Our website will be in both Hebrew and English that way non Hebrew speakers will be able to find our deals and also find some information about the stores we work with without going in to the stores and feeling awkward because they don't speak the language. By doing this, we hope to create a way that users can access information online in a language they understand and also save money at stores across the center of Israel. So far, we have already signed over twenty stores in Herzliya and are already expanding to Ra'anana and beyond!

It is important to us that we have an office that we base activities from. We currently do not have the capital to afford an office and feel that this is something crucial to the success of our business. We are currently trying to raise ten thousand dollars to help us achieve this goal. The money that you donate will help us put a down payment for the rent of an office for six months. This will greatly help our business and allow us to be more organized, and also give us a place to store all of the equipment necessary for the business.

We feel that with your help we can create an amazing business and allow people living around the center of Israel to save money, something which is good for everyone!

Please share this campaign with your friends, add our link to your facebook page, and most important of all.... Donate!

We want to thank everyone in advance and say how deeply we appreciate all the support we know that we will get!

story:
A little about Us

My name is Fernando Cortes, I live in Costa Rica. Since i've been small, I have absolutely LOVED baking. Breads, cookies, cakes, you name it, I made it. Recently I have been a little down to the job market here, and decided to jump in the deep end doing something I love for a change, instead of working in an office.
Alongside my wife Carolina, we are trying to jumpstart asmall artisanal bakery. 
To offer the most legitimate product, I would like to build a wood fired clay or mud oven in the yard. We plan on doing as much of the work ourselves, however we need materials and some form of proffessional guidance, which isn't very cheap here in Costa Rica. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to cover costs and materials for the fired oven as well as any land leveling and to hire a pro to at least give us some direction. As we stated earlier we will do as much as we can DIY, but some things are better left to proffessionals. 

A lot of fire resistant bricks are needed as well 

If our goal isn't reached, we will spend ALL funds received on flour, yeast and salt, and we will bake as much loaves of bread as possible, and give them to several homeless shelters.

If we do reach, we will send you our stickers, any bread of your choice, or a selection of different breads. 

The Impact

We want to show people there is more to just plain white sandwich bread, especially here in our country. 
Bread is good, bread can be fun as well. Really, who doesn't like bread?
At the end of the day, any contribution is thanked from the bottom of our heart. You would not only contribute to the oven, but to give the opportunity to someone to support themselves doing something that they love. 
Thanks all!

story:
Short Summary

Spoke N’ Heard is a collective of artists, entrepreneurs and social innovators, united by our passion for social change. This organization was started out of a desire to provide young people with a safe space to share their stories and experiences. Over the past four years, Spoke N Heard has produced 40+ creative arts events and facilitated countless programs and workshops. 

View Spoke N' Heard on CBC:
http://www.cbc.ca/player/News/Canada/Toronto/Our+Toronto/ID/2656275952

Why is this project important to us, and to the community? 
  • Spoke N' Heard is excited to introduce our flagship event series, The Heard. We endeavour to provide a profitable platform and create opportunities for Toronto artists, as well as authentic and genuine cultural experiences for the community.  This event will foster an environment that furthers our vision of "A world where purpose-filled and self-actualized creatives collaborate to shift the culture"
So what exactly will we be happen with this money??? 
To date, Spoke N' Heard has been a self-funded social enterprise, investing over $50,000 of out of our own resources to continue making this movement possible. Currently we have surpassed the threshold of our resources. We have seen a vital need to scale in capacity in order to meet the increasing demands of the community. The Heard will be a sustainable way for Spoke N Heard to advance our social impact. The profit from this event series will be invested into our community programming and operational costs.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal with this campaign is to raise $15,000. This will supplement the cost of producing The Heard events. Proceeds of this event will supplement the costs of Spoke N' Heard's community programming and operational costs.

Event Expenses:
  • Artist Budget (Paid opportunities for Toronto artists)
  • Marketing (Radio tour, TTC Ads, media coverage and print costs)
  • Videography/Photography (Paid opportunities for media personnel)
  • Event Staff (Providing honorariums for our volunteer-based team)
  • Sound/Ambiance (Sound and lighting equipment, and a sound technician)
  • Graphic Design (Paid opportunities for local designers)
PERKY PERKS!!!
  • Spoke N' Heard's "Join The Heard Campaign" features unique incentives for courtesy access at our events: VIP booth seating, bottle service, complimentary drinks and appetizers, free tickets, giveaways, artwork and more! Perks also include free merchandise, website features, creative profiling, access to Spoke N' Heard Masterclasses, and specially curated, tailored experiences.
And if we don't reach out goal? 
  • Anything we raise during this campaign will go exactly where we originally intended. Regardless of how much funds we raise, our initial goal will move forward and we will work on other sources to supplement our expenses.

The Impact

Spoke N' Heard is dedicated to continually providing the city with authentic and genuine cultural experiences. The Heard will be a profitable platform for artists in the city, providing paid opportunities for over 70 artists a year. This initiative provides our community with tangible opportunities to partner with us in creating the experiences they so enjoy and deserve. Our event is a platform for the necessary and urgent messages Toronto artists have to share with the world. We are creating spaces that allow for a tapping into and harnessing of one’s pure creative passion, purpose and power. 
Our Track Record
  • This is the first time Spoke N' Heard has ever initiated crowd-funding or looked to our community for financial support. In the past we have born the burden of funding our initiatives on our own back. We realize, however, that collaboration is a necessary element to community building and social change. We are no island. Spoke N' Heard is at a beautiful place of transparency, and we are inviting you, our community, to Join The Heard. Be apart of the movement, and assist us in shaping the experiences that continue to touch and move you.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

One challenge of every grassroots organization is to expand without compromising the original purpose. An easy way to do so is to let grants or administrative partners have too much of a say in the direction of an organization. Spoke N' Heard has had a long-term commitment to uncompromising growth. Our organization has many stakeholders, including you, all of whom have an appropriate influence on the intention and direction of our organization in order to hold us accountable to our goals for the community. 

Another challenge is being taken seriously as artists, young people, and people of color in a very white corporate Canada.  As we strive for self-determinism and abundance as an organization, one obstacle we are prepared to face is systemic and institutional marginalization. We believe ourselves to be capable of success despite these challenges. 

Spoke N' Heard belongs to a village of diverse and beautiful community members. As we strive to be a trusted organization, we must simultaneously trust on our community of mentors, partners, families and ultimately ourselves to support us in actualizing our potential. 

We will collect feedback through surveys, internal research & audits, consultation & genuine human interactions to help us accomplish this. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out! Tweet, Facebook, Tumblr etc, our project using the hashtag #JoinTheHeard and let your friends and colleagues know about what we're doing - you can do so with the tools right here on this page :) 
  • Join our team, literally. Spoke N' Heard has a constantly expanding network of team members, volunteers, artists & partners. To get in touch with us just email info@spokenheard.ca - we'd love to hear from you! 
  • Join our Mailing List by visiting www.spokenheard.ca

We are creating spaces that allow for a tapping into and harnessing of one’s pure creative passion, purpose and power. 
Our Track Record

This is the first time Spoke N' Heard has ever initiated crowd-funding or looked to our community for financial support. In the past we have born the burden of funding our initiatives on our own back. We realize, however, that collaboration is a necessary element to community building and social change. We are no island. Spoke N' Heard is at a beautiful place of transparency, and we are inviting you, our community, to Join The Heard. Be apart of the movement, and assist us in shaping the experiences that continue to touch and move you.



   Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.
One challenge of every grassroots organization is to expand without compromising the original purpose. An easy way to do so is to let grants or administrative partners have too much of a say in the direction of an organization. Spoke N' Heard has had a long-term commitment to uncompromising growth. Our organization has many stakeholders, including you, all of whom have an appropriate influence on the intention and direction of our organization in order to hold us accountable to our goals for the community. 
Another challenge is being taken seriously as artists, young people, and people of color in a very white corporate Canada.  As we strive for self-determinism and abundance as an organization, one obstacle we are prepared to face is systemic and institutional marginalization. We believe ourselves to be capable of success despite these challenges. 
Spoke N' Heard belongs to a village of diverse and beautiful community members. As we strive to be a trusted organization, we must simultaneously trust on our community of mentors, partners, families and ultimately ourselves to support us in actualizing our potential. 
We will collect feedback through surveys, internal research & audits, consultation & genuine human interactions to help us accomplish this. 
   Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Get the word out! Tweet, Facebook, Tumblr etc, our project using the hashtag #JoinTheHeard and let your friends and colleagues know about what we're doing - you can do so with the tools right here on this page :) 
Join our team, literally. Spoke N' Heard has a constantly expanding network of team members, volunteers, artists & partners. To get in touch with us just email info@spokenheard.ca - we'd love to hear from you! 
Join our Mailing List by visiting www.spokenheard.ca

story:
Short Summary 
 70 earthquake affected victims scrambling for space in a tent that could accommodate no more than 20 individuals. As we spoke to them  we learnt gradually about the tragedy that had befallen this group of villagers..   The swollen eyes of women and choked voice of Tshwang Lama, a preacher and head monk  revealed their horror . In a quivering voice he said, "Nothing remains of our village (Baruwa.), Not a single house stands". His calm and compassionate eyes looked at us non-chalantly,. we  all choked with grief while listening to the whole story. We learnt that a strong  7.8 magnitude Earthquake on  April 26, 2015 had wiped out the 558 houses of Baruwa village in Sindhupalchowk District of central Nepal affected the entire population. We, the (SEEW) team members were overwhelmed to hear about such devastation.  and directly And instead of  continuing to distribute relief to victims in far-flung villages of Sindupalchowk,  we stayed on to help this displaced Tamang community who were taking shelter in  the open fields of Mulpani,suburbs east of the Kathmandu valley..

With tears in his eye, Nima Lama of Baruwa Ward number 8 narrated the devastation with graphic detail to us saying…. "The land sank two feet and all the houses turned into heaps of stone,  mud, and debris all around.  We buried 83 peopleand had no option but at times to bury almost 5-7 bodies in one grave. Wehad to free all the living animals, so they could roam around to find fodder and grasses. However we couldn't bear the stench of the animal Caracas lying all around us,. It was terrible and in order to survive we had to leave the village ".

We learnt that they had walked for 6 hours in one stretch from their village until they arrived at a town called Melamchi and took a bus to arrive at Mulpani. We knew that thefury of the  violent earthquake has destroyed up to 90 per cent of the houses in the two districts of Sindupalchowk and Kavrepalanchowk (UNDP OCHA, may 2015). Sindhupalchowk and neighbouring Kavre districts are endowed with immense natural beauty but the destruction brought by the quake have made them stand in bare stark contrast to their earlier appearances..

The 7.8 -magnitude earthquake with its epicenter in Barpak village in Gorkha district, has claimed more than 8, 000 lives and over  20,000 injuries , ten days after it  struck Nepal.. The most severely affected district called  Sindhupalchowk is about 60 kms from the capital city Kathmandu.

The Mulpani refugee victims are gradually coming to terms with their camp life existence for the interim moment. When we met them they were 70 people including a three month infant Now they are 100 people altogether from two VDC.  Women folks out numbered men in the group. As they explained to us , all of their houses have collapsed. , Dry landslides occur almost everywhere and , their lands have cracked and crops destroyed. They were not sure how many cattle died. Filled with tears, one young man narrated,  “we untied the living animals from where they were, left them in the open and said goodbye”. They were not sure if the cattle will be alive in the future and if they will be able to see their dear animals. They also told us that before leaving their village for Kathmandu, some men went to another village, called Balgaun, (situated above their village) where the disaster and loss was more painful. These people said that it is not sure how many people died in Balgaun. When they reached there, they were able to bury 35 dead bodies before they left for Kathmandu. They were requesting us for a helicopter to rescue the stranded people in Balgaun village.

Currently, the victims from Baruwa are living under worn out tarpaulin tents which will not protect them from strong gust of winds or constant monsoon rain.. Currently, the victim’s  do s not have toilet facilities nor potable drinking water. Anxiety, horror, fear and uncertainty was visible in the faces of the entire community. The rapidly approaching monsoon rain will  further delay their return and they would be stranded here for almost another six months.

We consoled them with kind words and consolidated our emotions with tears and genuine empathy. What they actually need immediately are  proper food, tents, blankets, first-aid-kits and clean clothes. In addition, they also need clean drinking water, medicine and toilet facilities. Furthermore,  in order to come to a normal condition, they need trauma counseling and advice and emotional support as are still horrified with their terrible tragedy back home.. Clearly long term rehabilitation and reintegration will be needed for sustainable peace and prosperity and that will be the true gift to the environment and human condition from which they  have survived the deadly earthquake. A well planned and executed long term intervention activities will ensure better housing and safety while reintegrating within their own communities eventually. Social Empowerment by Empowering Women (SEEW) is tirelessly at times walking many miles to deliver basic amenities to the victims; , we stand strong and commit ourselves to long term rehabilitation and reintegration initiatives of these families  - especially the hardest hit district of Sindupalchowk.  As the all seeing eyes of the  Buddha eyes looks from the Stupa of Boudanath monastery nearby,  showering blessings for well being of these people; we in , SEEW will not sleep until we  have successfully reconstruct the lives of these poor and deserving victims of the earthquake.

What We Need
We need  US $ 10.000 to make a Safe Shelter & Two Toilets(For Men & Women) for them to stay at least for 6 months as the weather will be worse in the coming few months and they cannot return back to their village.

Why Us

The funds we collect will go directly to these people as we have been supporting them now with immediate reliefs and we can reach them directly.

Transparency

A promise to direct the money to local people who need the money the most and a very transparent accounting of the money spent.We will not give the money to the local leaders or local people who can misuse it instead we will buy things and go to the location to provide the earthquake survivors.

About us

For those who are not family or friends and don't know us, we want to assure you that your contributions will be used to help victims of the Nepal earthquake. We realize that sometimes people are reluctant to give because they don't know if their contributions will reach the right people, especially given the mismanagement of funds that occur after large scale natural disaster. That is why we think you should know a little about us so you can contribute knowing that your money will be put to the best use.

Samjhana Phuyal (30), Iam born and brought up in Kathmandu Nepal and have been working from last 8 years as a woman right activist and a development worker.I am Masters in Anthropology from Tribhuvan University,and a post graduate in women's studies. Iam Founder of a NGO called Social Empowerment By Empowering Women(SEEW) which works for women empowerment in Nepal.Iam fully committed to ensure that the money you give goes to the right persons who are the real victims of the Earthquake.This is my promise.

Again, I thank you for your generosity and promise regular updates and transparency in this process.

story:
Fact: In Africa and India combined, 462 million people do not have access to CLEAN and SAFE drinking water =  25% of their population.

HOW YOU CAN HELP: 

  • Donation of $20: provides 1 person water from a borehole (drilled well).
  • Donation of $50-$100: provides water for 5 people.
  • Donation of $100+: provides water for an entire family of 5-6 people!

WHO WE ARE: We are MBA students at The University of Chicago Booth School of Business, working on a project to bring sustainable water solutions to communities in developing countries with water scarcity issues through CHEAP, ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY, and SAFE methods. We want to make communities self-sufficient by giving them access to clean drinking water.

CURRENT SITUATION: NGOs don't receive a consistent flow of funds from donors or charities, which hinders their ability to implement wells and boreholes in communities facing serious water crises. Wells and boreholes are the most common source of water in the world, particularly in India and in many countries in Africa. Whether it's rainwater catchments or above ground wells and boreholes, there is just not enough funding to make an impact where it's most needed.

WHERE DOES THE $ GO?

We will use the funds to work with NGOs to build sustainable water solutions for communities. 

Your donation goes towards:

  • Drilling boreholes for communities working with Water for Africa, one of our partner NGOs.
  • Building our website: connecting the expectations of donors to unique accountability measures for NGOs. Ensuring a more reliable flow of funding to make an impact. Highlights include: project listings, tracking ability, milestone updates, and impact metrics. You will have to wait and see our unique features!

BY DONATING AND/OR SPREADING THE WORD, YOU WILL BE ACTIVELY HELPING TO CURB THE WATER CRISIS FOR MANY IN THE WORLD!

We hope to reach our funding goal, but if we don't, we will keep chugging along to launch our project! Questions? Email us at teaminfinitywater@gmail.com

THANKS!

Pic Credit: Water for Africa

story:
We are attempting to raise money to assist in buying a bulk of our much needed supplies in order to make a large enough quantity of the products we intend to sell. We are both young and finding work has proved near impossible so we thought we would put our individual talents to good use as a team.

Bronagh is from the Republic of Ireland and is based in Sligo. They enjoy making bath products such as the likes you'd see in the popular store Lush. Using combinations of oils and ingredients there is a huge range of products that have been known to help with many different things such as Hayfever Allergies, Anxiety and Insomnia.

Megan is from Northern Ireland and is based in Belfast. She is extremely talented at making realistic floral themed jewelry. From Roses to Pansies. From Pendants to Rings.  Stylish and sophisticated jewelry that doesn't break the bank, What's not to love? 

Our bath products will be made with supplies that are not tested on animals and in most cases will be 100% vegan friendly (Some products may contain milk and/or honey but this will be stated on the ingredients list and there will be plenty more choices that do not have these.). In order to source good quality and safe products, we need to spend a little extra money.

Our jewelry will be made from polymer clay and colour pigment which is very expensive to purchase in large quantities.

We hope to become successful enough in local markets in Belfast, Sligo and surrounding areas that we may be able to open an online market eventually. We have opened up a Facebook page so be sure to give us a Like!

Your help in reaching and possibly soaring past our goal to give us this start would be appreciated greatly! We have many great perks to choose from, but once they're gone or once our goal is reached please don't stop donating! Every single pound counts to us and although this is just for ingredients, there is many more costs to cover. Whether you donate £1 or £100 YOU ARE AMAZING AND THANK YOU!

story:
Mr Letherby sadly passed away on the 17th of April following an attack outside the De Winton pub, Tonypandy. We have set up this fundraising page to raise money for his amazing wife, Linda to support her with the business Wayne has left for his 18 year old son, Jordan. And the money left over will then pay for any funeral costs. We are working with all the family to ensure you every single penny that is being donated by you will go to them. Wayne was a loving husband, father and grandfather. He was a hard-working man who loved all of his family. So please help us by donating and support the Letherby family.

Our sincere condolences,

- Kelly Thomas.

story:
ICONIC Automotive : Coming Soon!
David and Stephanie have a love for each other, a mutual love of cars, and a passion to make the most of what life has to offer. But before we get to that story, we should start from the beginning.
David - Born and raised in Orange County California, David was destined to be an excellent automotive technician and business owner. His parents were not surprised when his first spoken word as a baby was "car". As a child he would use his little fingers to take apart and put back together his toys, as well as repairing them when needed, and all through grade school he was under the hood of many cars, helping his dad repair the family car, or helping neighbors repair theirs. When the opportunity to work at an automotive repair shop for high school credits came up, he jumped on the opportunity and his knowledge and skill blossomed. At the young age of 16 he had the chance to be a partial owner of an automotive shop. While working there and earning more shares in the business, he gained a reputation for being one of the best. When other shops had difficulty working on a vehicle or diagnosing a vehicle, David was the first call they made. Not only is he the best in his trade, he has also learned what it takes to own and properly run an automotive shop. He has always run a very clean shop, with white walls and clean floors, and he treats everyone like family. It was a very tough decision for him when he decided to split from the partnership in order to open his very own shop with his fiancé.
Stephanie - Born near Denver Colorado, Stephanie was raised around cars. Watching Formula 1 every Sunday with her dad, and attending car shows with her brothers helped fuel her passion for cars. While she always had a hobby of modifying her own cars and helping David at his shop, she tried many different careers, including managing two retail locations, and doing merchandising and inventory control. When David brought up the idea of opening their own shop it was a light bulb moment. Once they started talking about ideas they realized that they had a perfect mixture between the two of them to make a very successful automotive repair shop.
ICONIC Automotive - A dream turned reality for two people that were destined to be together and make the most of this beautiful thing called life. After months and months of research, number crunching and idea sharing, ICONIC Automotive was created. All that was needed was a building. David and Stephanie have been approved for a lease and this incredible shop is coming to Garden Grove California! With a dedication for quality work and superb customer service, ICONIC Automotive is the place for thorough automotive repair. Any contributions made will help contribute to all of the startup costs of opening an automotive repair shop, including licensing, lease agreements, equipment, employees, uniforms, programs, and signage. As a thank you for contributing, and as a way to prove our quality to you, any contributions over $50 will receive a complimentary oil change and tire rotation after the grand opening. Please bring a copy of the contribution confirmation whether in paper form or on your cell phone to receive this offer.
We would like to thank you for any contributions and will invite all of you to the grand opening party when it is planned. We wouldn't be here if it weren't for our friends and family and we are grateful to everyone for the support you have all provided throughout our lives. We love you and are so happy to have you all be a part of this next chapter in our lives!
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts,
David and Stephanie

story:
I have gotten the ball rolling now that the lease has been signed for the space to open Pique. My family and I are ecstatic about the location which is right in the center of a small, artsy neighborhood with high foot traffic. 

I have fought tirelessly in this amazing but cruel food business and now I am determined to write my own story and make my dream come true. I'm praying that this project takes off and that I can make a good and humble life for my wife and children. Just recently my partners and I decided to part ways and I was not only left without funds for a new restaurant, but I lost my job in the end making this project even more important than when I started it.

I have a dedicated and talented staff that is just as eager as I am to open Pique waiting in the wings.The money raised will be used to acquire the proper permits, kitchen equipment, and cosmetic improvements.  Your contribution will get the ball rolling to get Pique up and running.

story:
Welcome to the Just Give It A Thought Thinking Face campaign. Have you taken your Thinking Face Selfie yet?

By sharing your thinking face, by nominating your friends, by donating to the campaign or even just by telling us what you think, you are helping the thinking face campaign. 

We want to talk about some of the issues we just don't normally talk about. We have so many hidden victims in our universities and in our high schools. There are so many people who have stories you simply will never hear and neither will the police.

So lets start the conversation, lets talk about some of the issues all around us, lets talk about some of the ways we can make the people around us safer and most of all lets challenge the attitudes that lead to people committing these crimes in the first place.

Your Thinking Face Selfie:

Simply take a picture of yourself doing your best thinking face, be as creative as you like! 

Then share your picture on facebook, twitter or instagram with the hashtag #thinkingface and even the #justgiveitathought if you are feeling extra helpful.

Add the link to this campaign or the youtube campaign video and then nominate three of your friends who haven't taken part yet. 

Any donations are incredibly helpful and as little as a pound will help us get a little closer to our goal.

If you need some inspiration we have loads of thinking faces on our facebook page www.facebook.com/justgiveitathoughtcampaign

Thank you for all your help, 

The Just Give It A Thought Team.

A Little Bit About The Charity:

The purpose of the charity is to change the way that people think about their personal safety and to show them that it doesn’t have to be restricting, it doesn’t have to detract from their experiences and in fact if anything, it can give them a new sense of freedom.

Home office statistics consistently show that young men and women are at more risk of becoming a victim of crime. Whether it is violent crime, sexual assault or theft, the figures show that young people are at consistently and significantly higher risk.

But the statistics don’t paint the whole picture. The home office itself estimates that 57% of all crime goes unreported to the police. This number rises to between 70 and 90 % with sexual assault. The true extent of the problem is revealed with surveys and research. A recent survey revealed that 1 in 7 female students had experienced serious sexual assault. 12% had experience stalking whilst at university and over 8% had experienced attempted assault.

A survey of children aged between 12 and 16 showed that one in four had been a victim of crime in the last 12 months. More than half of those had been victims of violent crime and one in ten had been targeted more than five times in the last year. We have a great deal of hidden victims in our young people and there is a predominate attitude that personal safety is ‘hard work’ and that it will take away from the exciting and important experiences of being young. We believe that doesn’t have to be the case.

Just Give It A Thought works with young people through three main projects that will target different groups within our 13-30 age range. Our university project works with universities to campaign to over 15,000 students at a time. Our Nightlife project works with nightclubs and bars to promote personal safety inside the nightlife experience and our schools project works with high schools and sixth form teachers to campaign to young people within their schools.

Each of the campaigns focuses on the concept of Network Safety. This is the idea that by improving your safety network, directly being your friends and family, you can create a culture of personal safety in your group without changing your lifestyle.

By building a culture of Network Safety, by asking simple questions, such as ‘where are your friends?’ or ‘how are your friends getting home?’, by providing the means to quickly find taxi’s or find out where your friends are, we can start a thought process that will provide a new solution to the personal safety problem.

At the moment, 68% of students have been subjected to verbal or physical harassment, such as groping, flashing or unwanted sexual comments. It is estimated that one third of students will become victims of theft during their time at university. Half of all sexual assaults occur in nightclubs and 63% of all violent crime occurs on weekend nights primarily around pubs and clubs.

The home office themselves published that there are between 430,000 and 517,000 sexual assaults in the uk each year, however there is an average of only 5,620 convictions. There are between 60,000 and 95,000 cases of rape each year and an average of only 1070 convictions.

No one deserves to be a victim of crime and it is time for a new approach.

www.justgiveitathought.com

story:
Short Summary

Click to Donate

Click here to Follow the Movement


My Story: A series of oppressive situations forced Let Her Sing's founder, Jessica Crew, to reckon with pain and suffering. She wanted to find a better path and so began a journey to "clear the noise" that was suffocating her heart. Over time, Jessica saw how her mental beliefs were blocking her from good and abundance in life. Everything changed when she realized that she had agreed to the oppression in her life. In her own words, "I had created my experiences and thus, I could create better ones." 

Let Her Sing is born. This is when the Let Her Sing women's empowerment event concept emerged. Drawing from the founder's own experiences, it was her desire to create a platform for the voice of women to be heard and to support women as they walk that better path. Being a musician herself, Jessica knew she had to incorporate performance art, as music in particular was an important part of her own expression and healing. She believes that the arts can open the heart in a very powerful way. 



What is Let Her Sing? Glad you asked! Let Her Sing is a concert-style event that inspires women to clear the noise. The concert inspires through speaking, song, dance, and spoken word. But what makes the events unique is that they feature local performers and speakers. Visit www.lethersing.com for more information. For now, take a peak! 


 

Our Mission:  Let Her Sing is about helping women dissolve limiting beliefs that block them from what life has to offer. With the powerful slogan "clear the noise to walk in power"™  the Let Her Sing movement encourages women to TAKE BACK THEIR LIFE and OWN IT.

What We Need 

Let Her Sing needs $100,000 and you get goodies! Alright, alright, there might be a little more to it. 

Why give? Let Her Sing requests your help as the movement expands nationally. The events started local, but the response was so great that at the request of several, the organization decided to expand their vision. Align with us and we will take your own name and vision across the nation, eventually reaching across the world.

What will your contributions accomplish? $100,000 will take Let Her Sing to 8 cities around the U.S. $100,000 is the minimum needed to begin the Let Her Sing 2016 national tour. Raising $300,000 is ideal. Even so, $100,000 will allow the organization to do extensive travel and networking in 8 cities, interview hundreds of potential female participants, compensate helpers and take care of legal necessities. This endeavor of 8 cities in a year's time proves credibility to sponsors, attendees, and vendors, thus ensuring financial independence after this campaign is completed. Without initial funding, the national tour will take place, but it may require several years to acquire funds. 

What if you get more than $100,000? If Let Her Sing receives more than $100,000, they will be able to take marketing to a whole new level. This means the event room can be packed and can hire a promotional company to bring in vendors and sponsors.

What You Get

Notes: 
  • Complimentary Tickets- Sorry men, the Let Her Sing events are exclusively for women (with the exception of the VIP silver and VIP gold package owners) Feel free to gift a special lady in your life, however! Tickets are for 1 event in the city of your choice unless stated otherwise. 
  • Gratitude Journal, Personalized- These journals are made from recycled cement bags by empowered women of [correction] Haiti, who provide for their families through creative crafts such as this one!

  • Unisex Soft-style Tshirts

      Above: Limited Edition LHS Signed T * Below: Limited Edition LHS Slogan T 
                                            Choose the one you prefer!



The $100,000 Break Down

This is how the $100,000 will be used:

  • Networking & Scouting in 8 cities: $24,000 including airfare, food, lodging, and transportation
  • IT/New Website/Online Promotion: $15,000
  • Insurance and Accounting Fees: $5,300 (start up & basic fees to run)
  • Event Management: $30,000 for bringing people in, securing venue, servicemen, coordinating details, etc.
  • Legal Fees: $5,700 for copyrighting, contract templates for performers, & other startup fees
  • Campaign Fees: $20,000 for rewards, unforseen expenses and taxes

The Impact

What we love about our local events:  We love that the audience interacts with the performers and speakers. We love that our local participants interact with each other, highlighting meaningful lessons from other participants' stories. We love the passion people leave with and the depth of feeling. The interaction and the safety people felt in order to speak out was an unexpected delight. Some vendors even secured payment for multiple events despite our humble beginnings in size.

An Unforgettable Experience: Let Her Sing is one of the most memorable experiences of a woman's life. How often do human beings get to interact in a meaningful way? Add to that, a magical evening full of fun, music, dancing, and stories by candlelight and you have an unforgettable experience. If even one woman who walks through concert doors  decides that she is done surviving and believes with just a small amount of faith that all she desires is possible, that is enough to move mountains. With just one such person, walls of violence and oppression begin to crumble, the quality of lives around her improves, and eventually even the economy improves. 


Risks & Challenges

So far the founder, Jessica Crew, has absorbed the entirety of the financial burden. Now she requests assistance as Let Her Sing expands. The only thing that has stood in the way up to now is resources (as services require deposits before money is made) and workers. The more contributions received, the faster expansion takes place!

What if we don't reach our goal? Answer: Not an option! But of course, you should know that if such a ridiculous scenario occurred, you would still get your rewards and Let Her Sing would secure sponsorships and investors.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't help financially, but you can still help.

  • Pick up the phone and call 5 people. Ask them how they can contribute. 
  • Stay connected through Facebook, Twitter and the LHS website.
  • Promote through social media: Help Let Her Sing #reach1million by sharing to your friends and family online. Let them know you believe in this. (Some have even begun replacing their profile pictures with our campaign card.)

story:
We are the "ATM" of the "to go" espresso coffee market !

2015 MASS PRODUCTION PROTOTYPE

 We need your help to bring these ABM bars to your part of the world. It's been my life's work and now the time has come to launch, as the quest to build the perfect high end espresso outlet is finally complete .
With over a decade of costly research, development and testing. We now require your support to breath life into this exciting espresso project.

These self- serve espresso kiosks will soon be a reality. Just 16 weeks after total fund raising is complete we will be deploying the first wave of our state of the art automated espresso bars. We are ready to not only compete in Canada, but be a clear leader in the specialty coffees to go market. The “to go” sector is a 28 billion dollar industry world wide and taking our share internationally is the primary goal of Crema Caffe. We plan to partner with high foot traffic retailers first in Vancouver, then across Canada by contracting out space in the busiest locations in major city centres. The business concept is to place corporately- owned, Crema Caffe  Italia ABM’s free of charge to qualified established vendors. Installations are as simple as hooking up to 220 volt power and city water. We then quickly and easily create authentic Italian Espresso Coffee outlets that are open 24/7, fetching the same drink prices as large coffee houses. 

Like an ATM bank machine we offer convenience to our customers this saves them time from driving or walking to find coffee.  

Every gas station and grocery store in North America wants/needs a Crema Caffe  ABM.

  1. Gas stations
  2. Grocery stores
  3. Bakeries
  4. Deli's
  5. C stores
  6. Big box stores
  7. Hospitals
  8. Airports
  9. Universities
  10. Gift stores etc.

We partner with premium locations and major retail chains, offering our espresso bars free of charge.

THE EXPANSION PLAN

A unique opportunity exists as this concept is currently revolutionary. First into the market place is the key to success. It is our goal to place 50 bars in downtown Vancouver. This will create the hype and brand recognition we need to draw the attention of the large premium retailer, so they view us as a chain that’s ready for their business. We will be collecting revenue from our ABMs through our P.O.S. system that accepts credit, debit, and loyalty cards and paying out our location partners on a per cup or % of sales bases. The genius of this business is that the Crema Caffe Italia ABM is able to offer the most desirable, authentic, specialty coffees on the market today, through a system that produces direct cash, no receivables, just in time product delivery and is a nearly labour and rent free daily cash cow. We will start in the most densely populated area of Vancouver and move out from 50 to 100 bars with routes broken into 10 bars per driver/manager. This will not only prove to be a model of efficiency, but response times will be shorter and customer satisfaction will be heightened. We will have a “bigger than we are”appearance in the downtown core combined with a super quality brand reputation.

  

Our ABM is the ultimate whole bean coffee selling system too!


  ATTRIBUTES OF THE ABM

The ABM is simple to use  through  our new touch screen.  The customer easily chooses a drink, then chooses his/her payment of choice. The ABM grinds and packs 14 grams of fresh whole coffee beans, then delivers 208 degree filtered water while applying 150 lbs. of pressure to extract a perfect,  and full bodied espresso coffee, creamy cappuccino or caffe latte. The milk is frothed thick and rich enough to rival the talents of a finely trained barista, while producing 60 cups per hour! Every cup is made from fresh roasted beans and fresh milk which are programmed to your exact specifications for temperature, proportion, and consistency. Innovations such as a large- capacity fridge, housing 8 x 4 liter jugs of fresh 1% milk (128 caffe latte capacity) and 4 liters of fresh cream (128 cup capacity) get pumped into drinks without interruption. Increased size of the 2 whole bean and 1 chocolate powder hoppers extends volumes (270 capacity). Our modular design assists in quick parts changes and on site assembly. Six syrups that include 4 flavors, sugar and sweetener. Fresh half and half cream at the push of a button for coffees. Liquid sugar and cream pours straight into the cup before coffee to mix without stirring and cuts per-cup production to under a minute. We are a whole coffee bar experience in 16 square feet with back ground café music, fan blowing fresh ground coffee aroma, logo rubber mat for leg, feet and back  comfort,  BMW dash board styling with an Italian car body inspired panels and paint. 

OUR BRAND AND STORY  The name Crema came from the fact that the best espresso coffees in the world have a creamy thick brown foam on top called Crema (the Italian word for Cream).  Crema can only be produced by fanatical quality control. Our ABM units produce crema effortlessly on every coffee drink it makes.  Crema on top of our Americano coffees resemble a perfectly poured pint of Guinness, that is why our branded cups look similar, (printed black cup with brown printed layer on top). Our coffees look different and are better with crema. They are smooth and creamy and tastes as good as fresh ground coffee smells, not watery and thin like most coffees that are sold. 


PLAN B  We place our ABMs at 1.5 employees per 10 units and if sales targets are not achieved, we hold the option to remove or relocate them. This is a huge advantage over traditional café chains that  close down a store and lose a massive investment, having to sell everything for pennies on the dollar. Crema Caffe ABMs not only hold their value in a location gone bad, but can be quickly moved to a location that will produce the original desired profits. In the case of customer line ups forming at an ABM we can add an additional ABM to service the high traffic demands. We can produce $500,000.00 per year from a single location with two or more ABMs either side by side or spread out around the same location. 

2010 PROTOTYPE

$32,500.00 each. ABM 

 10 bars $325,000.00 

One traditional coffee house set up $250,000 to $325,000.

 STRATEGY

  Mr. Ratcliffe plans to hire experts in their fields to assist Crema Caffe in achieving its goals. We plan to create a work force of  empowered people that will in some way benefit from the success of the company through cash incentives, profit sharing, and future stock options. We are looking to create an atmosphere of partners, not employees. Crema Caffe will treat their employees with respect and a long term vision in mind and such that Crema Caffe will be treated the same in return. Creating an enjoyable company to work for is key to a healthy organization. Growth is inevitable once these values and incentives are in place.

The milk is frothed thick and rich enough to rival the talents of a finely trained barista, while producing 60 cups per hour! Every cup is made from fresh roasted beans and fresh milk which are programmed to your exact specifications for temperature, proportion, and consistency. Innovations such as a large- capacity fridge, housing 8 x 4 liter jugs of fresh 1% milk (128 caffe latte capacity) and 4 liters of fresh cream (128 cup capacity) get pumped into drinks without interruption. Increased size of the 2 whole bean and 1 chocolate powder hoppers extends volumes (270 capacity). Our modular design assists in quick parts changes and on site assembly. Six syrups that include 4 flavors, sugar and sweetener. Fresh half and half cream at the push of a button for coffees. Liquid sugar and cream pours straight into the cup before coffee to mix without stirring and cuts per-cup production to under a minute. We are a whole coffee bar experience in 16 square feet with back ground café music, fan blowing fresh ground coffee aroma, logo rubber mat for leg, feet and back  comfort,  BMW dash board styling with an Italian car body inspired panels and paint.  
OUR BRAND AND STORY  The name Crema came from the fact that the best espresso coffees in the world have a creamy thick brown foam on top called Crema (the Italian word for Cream).  Crema can only be produced by fanatical quality control. Our ABM units produce crema effortlessly on every coffee drink it makes.  Crema on top of our Americano coffees resemble a perfectly poured pint of Guinness, that is why our branded cups look similar, (printed black cup with brown printed layer on top). Our coffees look different and are better with crema. They are smooth and creamy and tastes as good as fresh ground coffee smells, not watery and thin like most coffees that are sold.  


PLAN B  We place our ABMs at 1.5 employees per 10 units and if sales targets are not achieved, we hold the option to remove or relocate them. This is a huge advantage over traditional café chains that  close down a store and lose a massive investment, having to sell everything for pennies on the dollar. Crema Caffe ABMs not only hold their value in a location gone bad, but can be quickly moved to a location that will produce the original desired profits. In the case of customer line ups forming at an ABM we can add an additional ABM to service the high traffic demands. We can produce $500,000.00 per year from a single location with two or more ABMs either side by side or spread out around the same location.  
2010 PROTOTYPE$32,500.00 each. ABM  10 bars $325,000.00  One traditional coffee house set up $250,000 to $325,000. STRATEGY  Mr. Ratcliffe plans to hire experts in their fields to assist Crema Caffe in achieving its goals. We plan to create a work force of  empowered people that will in some way benefit from the success of the company through cash incentives, profit sharing, and future stock options. We are looking to create an atmosphere of partners, not employees. Crema Caffe will treat their employees with respect and a long term vision in mind and such that Crema Caffe will be treated the same in return. Creating an enjoyable company to work for is key to a healthy organization. Growth is inevitable once these values and incentives are in place.

story:
The Who's Who.

I am a dreamer, a wife, a mother, and a baker.
For as long as I can remember, I have been regularly covered in flour, usually have chocolate on my shirt, own way too many cookie cutters, have an addiction to sprinkles, buy whipping cream 30 litres at a time, have a cookbook addiction that requires an intervention, and my art is baking.
Self-taught and tenacious and with 23 yrs of semi-professional baking experience, I am ready to wrestle with almost any kitchen appliance, I am passionate and I am opening a bakery in Old Walkerville, right near the river and across from the view of the Detroit skyline.
In the winter of 2013 I started a food blog. That was the beginning of The Little White Kitchen.
From food blog to booth at the Downtown Windsor Farmer's Market in 2013, this gal carted a van load of gluten-free baked goods to sell, getting up at the crack of dawn and setting up shop. Soon I began making small-batch artisan ice cream and started selling ice cream sandwiches as well, making my poor hubby lift a freezer into our van at 6:30am every Saturday morning.
Very quickly, my baking business got busier and busier. Some local restaurants took notice of me, and I started supplying them with desserts and gluten-free bread. My two Kitchen Aid mixers were soon in the company of a 20 qt floor mixer. My 3 small ice cream makers were replaced by an 80 lb commercial one. It started to snowball, until suddenly I was storing 800 lbs of flour at a time, going through 10-20 dozen eggs a week, and using over 50 of sugar every couple of weeks (I lost count of the insane amount of butter and chocolate I go through).


My mission statement ? To provide the best possible yumminess, put together with the highest quality ingredients, a love of all things gluten-free and gluten-full, and all wrapped up and made with as much love as I can muster.
I am here. I am crowd funding. I have burst out of my current kitchen space and I'm busting at the seams to expand to help serve you more efficiently.
Our bakeshop was supposed to open in Ford City last fall, but that fell through and I was devastated. I had found the perfect space, in a location that truly needed someone to believe in them and in the rejuvenation of an area that's been too long ignored. I believed in Drouillard Rd and everything it had to offer.
We worked hard and put out a lot of money to build our first space, but our landlord took advantage of us and didn't follow through with his deadlines and promises, and we had to leave the space before we even had a chance to open.
 After 4 mths of dreaming and hard work and lots of money, I was broken and devastated and not sure where to go next.
I have been truly blessed to find a wonderful new space in Walkerville.
The space in Walkerville is larger than the one on Drouillard and will allow for us to have a lovely cafe area as well as a designated bread kitchen.
I'M SO EXCITED!!!!!!


So why is The Little White Kitchen Baking Co. a good thing to have in Windsor????
Well…..
We will be the ONLY bakery in Walkerville.
We will be making everything from scratch, using the best ingredients we can source.
We will continue to bake tons of gluten-free goodness, but will expand to include everything gluten-full as well.
We will be making sourdough-based organic breads, with lovely ancient grains.
We will be a local cafe with super fabulous teas and small batch roasted coffee.
We will be one of the only places in Windsor where you can enjoy homemade artisan ice cream (I will always make ice cream sandwiches as well)
We will be THAT bakery. The kind you remember going to as a child.

Everyone that contributes to this campaign is a partnering up with me, with my vision for a bakery in Walkerville, and with a brand new small business that will grow and create jobs.

One thing……I NEED YOUR HELP!!



The Money Talk
Our goal is to raise $30,000+ in the next month, so that we can finish what we've already started and purchase the rest of the equipment and furniture that we need to be able to open by May 1st.
Throughout the last 5 months, the hubby and I have been working very hard to purchase as much equipment as we can, and we've spent over $30,000 to date. The majority of our equipment has been purchased used,  but we are thrilled with some of the wonderful items we've accumulated.

To get this bakeshop up and running with everything we need to be able to create fabulous breads and pastries for you, we still need at least $30,000 to purchase all of the remaining equipment and items like chairs and countertops. A large commercial mixer for the bread will cost about $4500, and a commercial freezer is around $4000, so you can see how the total adds up quickly.
 I hope you are as excited as I am about the wonderful possibilities and yumminess that will be the Little White Kitchen Baking Co. !!!!!
Every penny donated, will be spent wisely and we will purchase used equipment whenever we can.
Make sure to check out the REWARDS/PERKS offered for different levels of contribution, since no good deed should go unrewarded. Let me BAKE FOR YOU!



The Impact of your Donation.

I truly appreciate every penny donated, since starting this venture with debt over my head will prohibit me from hiring the right amount of fabulous staff, and fabulous staff is what makes the world go around, right?
Windsor has a huge amount of unemployment right now, and small business are going to help bring those numbers down, with your help.
My goal is to immediately employ 3 people right away (with the hopes of being up to 8 or 10 pretty quickly), all with a passion for baking and a enormous sense of adventure. I will need people to be at the shop early so that you can have wonderful bread for breakfast and lunch, someone will be on ice cream duty so that you can always have access to a freezer full of frozen treats, and of course we need someone making coffee and serving soup.

I am also hoping to partner up with some youth initiatives in the community, and one day soon, start training young people to make bread and work in a kitchen environment. 


Risks & Challenges

Of course there are always risks to any venture, but I believe, with 100% of my heart and soul, that The Little White Kitchen Baking Co. needs to exist. It needs to move from the dream of a food blog, to a small booth at the farmer's market, to a brick and mortar home. It's an organic entity and it needs to grow.

I will do everything in my power to make this work, to use my money wisely, to treat my staff with love and respect, to serve the people of Windsor (and whoever else pops in for a visit) with enthusiasm and to help contribute to the revitalization of the beautiful Walkerville area.

Your support, your prayers, your encouragement, your business and your contribution to The Little White Kitchen Baking Co. is your declaration that you believe in me, you support my crazy dreams, you want to see a small business succeed and you just want to help build a place where you can enjoy baked goods and pastries baked with as much love as I can muster.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know more than anyone that sometimes it's not possible to support a project monetarily, but there are so many other ways you can help out!!

Prayers~ please pray for guidance and wisdom as we move forward

Labour ~ we will need as much skilled labour and enthusiastic painters as we can find. We will only have a couple of weeks to build the space once we get in there, and we can't do it alone

Spread the WORD!!!! ~ so YOU can't spare a dime, but you may know someone that is just dying for a fun bakeshop to open and has money to burn!! Maybe they'd like to this gal out? You never know…..

story:
Hello, we are BOXS!

We are a group of friends from Switzerland who spend the vast majority of their time together discussing how to achieve sustainable humanitarian help. Since there is so much passivity everywhere, we decided to stop talking and get involved.

We got down to what matters, combined the properties of houses, tents and other solutions used in real-world crisis cases to create a new room concept aimed at sustainable help from the ground up.

Out of a mixture of entrepreneurial curiosity and humanitarian aspiration, BOXS came to life: being a versatile team with one of the largest panel manufacturers of Switzerland at their back, we proudly present to you an innovative modular room solution for a wide range of applications.


Housing solutions for development areas: Shelter

In a case of any emergency, accommodation must be provided quickly. The logistical advantage of its modular lightweight design makes it easy to deal with BOXS.

Just imagine:

  • On average, people in a disastrous situation have to spend more than 10 years in a camp. 10 years.
  • Tents have a lifecycle of a couple of months, this means people need a new “home” more than twice a year. And calling that a home is somehow offensive.
  • A tall man cannot stand upright in a UNHCR tent. And that is his “home”. He literally cannot stand up in it.
  • Without insulation and without stable walls you can never feel safe and at home. Temperature ranges in current scenarios are challenging to say the least.
  • Privacy is almost inexistent.
  • Tents cannot adapt to accommodating different families sizes, it’s one-size-fits-all but not in a good way.
  • Hygiene problems are rampant, giving way to diseases and increased medical support, which is already a serious issue.

Emergency aid

In case of a flood, earthquake, tsunami or other natural disaster, people need immediate humanitarian aid. Food and shelter must be supplied at short notice, hence flexibility and ready availability are of vital importance.
BOXS aims at providing a modular system that outshines the robustness of tent, the modularity of a container and the cost of real estate.

Refugee camps

Conditions in refugee camps are particularly harsh during winter, and the needs for shelter quickly outgrow the support given by the tents currently in use.
In these camps, indestructible, stable and insulated accommodation must withstand the climatic conditions. The quality materials used in BOXS protect against the cold and may facilitate sanitary conditions.
To have a humane form of accommodation is something essential. To make this a reality for one or two people more is a pillar of BOXS.

Slums

Shanties offer no real quality of life. In contrast, the durability and long service life of BOXS can enable economic empowerment of a community.
With its adjustable floor space, BOXS housing units can adapt to particular needs. Extended families no longer have to live apart but can live under one roof.

Infrastructure development projects: Water supply

Lack of drinking water is a serious problem. Technology nowadays allows for purification of contaminated water making it safe for consumption, however, the sad truth is, developing communities and emerging economies cannot afford such installations. Investments are supported by states or humanitarian organizations, delegating the maintenance of these infrastructures to local businesses that will look after their own profitability first. Furthermore, these systems require supporting infrastructure which is too often of complicated assembly due to a lack of access ways and aggravated by limited logistics support.

BOXS can be transported and fully assembled by three individuals without training or tools.

BOXS can be moved with limited equipment quickly and flexibly. This reduces labor, increases health and safety and consumes fewer resources.
Due to the long life span, the investment is covered and economic development is ensured.

Infrastructure solutions: Industry & private

Aside from projects in the development sector, BOXS is also a perfect suit for a broad specter of private and industrial needs.

Thanks to its properties, BOXS can be used in a multitude of applications, like:
  • stores
  • mobile weather protection
  • events

About BOXS

BOXS combines the flexibility and mobility of a tent with the robustness and durability of a container, creating a new approach to housing challenges in an ever-changing world.

BOXS is easy to erect and simple to rearrange, making it the perfect solution for complex scenarios with a high demand in flexibility and modularity.


Solid yet light with no piece more than 35 kilograms (75 lbs), easy logistics is the nature of BOXS – all the way to its final destination.

Adaptable and flexible, BOXS is fully adjustable to your specific needs, and thanks to its high modularity, existing rooms can be extended on demand.

Featuring high-tech insulation materials, BOXS is the right solution for unsteady climates.


With these characteristics BOXS raises the bar and sets new benchmarks for community development projects, industry solutions and private use.


Our timeline

1st July 2013
Prototype 0.0: The Black BOXS

With a personal contribution of $7,000 from the team members we were able to launch the project and start experimenting with the idea. The goal was to test and verify our basic system, its stability and its handling.

From our "Black BOXS" we could gather precious input for our next stages.


January till December 2014

Prototype 0.5: Modularity comes into being

The development of the prototype 0.5 took one year. Our new monoblock system proved to be a reliable solution and ensures the modular construction capabilities.
With the development of the single-pitch roof we enable the installation of solar panels, water collection systems and air conditioning modules, hence expanding the potential of BOXS.

It wouldn't have been possible to realize this without a sponsoring of $18,000.

Today till end of 2015
Prototype 1.0: Next generation

A big milestone is achieved today!

Nevertheless there is a lot of optimization effort ahead of us and this is the point were we need you.


For the upcoming development we need $50,000

  1.   Floor ($5,000)
  2.   Clamping systems ($5,000)
  3.   Walls ($13,000)
  4.   Roof and truss ($17,000)
  5.   Certification ($10,000)

We count on you!



The Story

Hello, we are BOXS!

Join our Website to learn more about BOXS

We work with a forward-thinking mindset to create
excelling solutions anywhere on earth.

About us

We are good friends and we spend the majority of our time together, thereby we create the perfect conditions for great ideas and a strong team spirit – we are BOXS!

With a qualified and versatile team and the largest panel manufacturer of Switzerland at our back, it was obvious that we should bring the BOXS project to life.

A special THANK YOU to Montana for supporting us!

Help us make BOXS come true!

Be a part of BOXS and support us!

Spread the message, share it with your friends and make the world a better place with your contribution to our project.

story:
Help Find a Cure for Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis

The Lambda-Upsilon Chapter of Alpha Omicron Pi is proud to support children suffering from JRA; a debilitating disease that effects the joints and makes simple movements such as walking a challenge. With your help and generosity, we can help the National Arthritis Foundation be one step closer to finding a cure.

$3,000 Goal!

We are determined to meet our goal set at raising $3,000 for the Arthritis Foundation. Not only will we raise money at the event, but we are also looking for donations using this site! Help us meet our goal and join us in the fight against Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis!

Do it For the Kids!

Juvenile arthritis affects children of all ages and ethnic backgrounds. About 294,000 American children under age 18 have arthritis or other rheumatic conditions. Help our cause to help the kids!

Spread the Word!

Want to make an even bigger difference? Send the donation link to family and friends! Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and any other social media site you use! The more you post the more money we could raise.
story_txt:
Help Find a Cure for Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis The Lambda-Upsilon Chapter of Alpha Omicron Pi is proud to support children suffering from JRA; a debilitating disease that effects the joints and makes simple movements such as walking a challenge. With your help and generosity, we can help the National Arthritis Foundation be one step closer to finding a cure.   $3,000 Goal!
We are determined to meet our goal set at raising $3,000 for the Arthritis Foundation. Not only will we raise money at the event, but we are also looking for donations using this site! Help us meet our goal and join us in the fight against Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis!   Do it For the Kids!
Juvenile arthritis affects children of all ages and ethnic backgrounds. About 294,000 American children under age 18 have arthritis or other rheumatic conditions. Help our cause to help the kids!

    Spread the Word!
Want to make an even bigger difference? Send the donation link to family and friends! Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and any other social media site you use! The more you post the more money we could raise.

story:
Short Summary

 

Kauai's Fire non-profit organization :

Mission is to Give Victim & Community Services to clients who are in need. Our Mission is to give the Highest Degree of victim & community services. With INTEGRITY & Professionalism, we are Devoted to a Hand in Hand Approach for our clients. We are a 501 c 3 organization

Kauai's Fire Non-Profit Organization is a leading public, nonprofit organization dedicated to serving domestic violence victims across the globe. Each year, we help thousands of victims through a range of high quality services. As an advocacy organization, we provide Life Coaching aswell to survivors & victims,

clothing closet ,food  pantry ,Job Placement, Computer Training.and support groups for victims in their community. Find out how you can contribute to the future of someone in need through donations of money and time.

The mission of KAUII’S FIRE NFP nonprofit organization is fivefold:


1. -   To honor & Advocate those who lost their lives to domestic violence and celebrate survivors.

2. -Provide life-coaching  to victims to help process the violence they have experienced and witnessed.   

3. -Strengthen and provide  Victim Services/crisis intervention & advocacy services for victims.

4. -Support groups to promote open forums,  discussions and educate the community regarding the incidents and causes of domestic violence.   

5. -Help provide access to safe and sustainable housing of refuge for victims of domestic violence through our battered women’s shelter building project initiative. 


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are in great need of finding a New location that is inexpensive and easy for us to manage, as we are a Non-profit organization. Our new center will cover the computer lab, food pantry and the pregnancy education center. As well  the G.E.D. tutor program,Homeless cozy socks program

    We are in need of Moving Expenses

The Impact

Victim Services

  • Life Coaching
  • Domestic violence Awarness support groups
  • Self-empowerment workshops
  • Free Pregnancy Testing & Information

  • Victim Services Offered

     Referrals

    saftey Planning

    Food Pantry

    Free Pregancy Testing

    Clothing Closet

    Hygene packs

    Baby Diapers Program

    Teen pregancy Groups

    Employment Search

    G.E.D. Tutoring

    Life Skills

    Court Advocacy

    Casemanagment

    Pet food Program

    Doula Services

    Monitary Funds (When Availible)

    Awarness/Education Groups

    Types of domestic violence

    Support Groups:

    Unhealthy relationship traits

    Characteristics of a abusive partner

    Warning signs of abuse

    Domestic violence in the digital age

    The cycle of violence

    Job placement

    Victim rights

    Victim resources

    • Risks & Challenges

     .

    There will always be risk, But as a community we can stand together , and support these women & children who have and is currently suffering Domestic violence issues.
