story:
The Therapeutic Arts Alliance is where the arts are used to engage and inspire healing in every individual.  Currently offering Homeopathy and Music Therapy, the goal is to ultimately provide a full menu of high-quality healing arts for a wide range of clients. 

Our Indiegogo Campaign is set up to help us put the finishing touches on our space, obtain needed equipment and instruments and finally get our doors open to the public. 

A therapeutic space with multi-disciplinary involvement has been the dream of Homeopath Elizabeth Breadon and Music Therapist Jill Buchanan for many years.  Therapeutic partners for 10 years, both Liz and Jill feel strongly about being in the moment with their clients in a safe, well-lit and energetically healing space.  Working out of client’s living rooms has definite benefits, but both clinicians have decided their energy is now best spent focused in the clinic rather than on the road.  The time for an innovative concept to become reality is here.

Your support of this campaign would enable Liz and Jill to finally develop a centralized space for many people to come together to participate in enriching programs such as:

·  One on one therapeutic support through Homeopathy

·  Individual and group Music Therapy sessions for children with special needs and their families

·  Specialized movement therapy sessions for individuals and groups

·  Professional song shares and networking among Expressive Arts Therapists

·  Supervised clinical space for student Homeopaths

·  Evening relaxation groups for parents of children with special needs

·  Regular lectures on health, wellness and relaxation

·  Lessons in clinical music theory and clinical music improvisation

·  Music lessons for the child with special needs

·  And much, much more!

Liz and Jill both work in fields that insurance currently does not cover, so they have historically only worked with families who can afford the out of pocket fees for these services.  The underlying mission of the Therapeutic Arts Alliance has been to come together in a space where all people can afford to find healing for themselves or their families, with or without insurance coverage.  Whether one is looking for constitutional support through Homeopathy or communication skill development through Music Therapy, the Therapeutic Arts Alliance will be a place where folks from all over the Greater Boston area can find information, support and relief. 

Your funding will help them meet this mission. 

Instruments need to be obtained and in some cases, relocated – all which costs a significant amount of money. Keeping the doors open while the clientele is built is extremely important.  One can only attend to a small number of families while moving from living room to living room.  Once the clinic space is open, opportunities to expand the clientele abound, thereby creating a more financially stable business.  Both clinicians have a waiting list of potential clients, though setting folks into a working schedule is always more of a challenge than expected!  This all takes time.  Your financial support will enable Liz and Jill to focus on this development without the threat of an empty bank account for rent, utilities and insurance.  Much of their own personal financial resources have already been directed toward this endeavor. 

We ask that you join us in shouldering the exciting and life-affirming weight of opening a new and enriching environment for healing through the therapeutic arts!

What if the goal of raising $6000 isn’t met?  That’s OK.  Every single penny raised will work hard to create the therapeutic space Liz and Jill envision.  Sometimes it just takes a little longer than planned. 

Offer support in whatever amount you are comfortable with. 

~ Because you know how beneficial the therapeutic arts can be.

~ Because you have a child with special needs who needs support.

~ Because you need support as a parent or caregiver of a child with special needs.

~ Mostly because you see the need for such a space, too.  For whatever reason.
story_txt:
The Therapeutic Arts
Alliance is where the arts are used to engage and inspire healing in every
individual.  Currently offering
Homeopathy and Music Therapy, the goal is to ultimately provide a full menu of high-quality
healing arts for a wide range of clients. 

Our Indiegogo Campaign is set up to help us put the
finishing touches on our space, obtain needed equipment and instruments and
finally get our doors open to the public. 


A therapeutic space with
multi-disciplinary involvement has been the dream of Homeopath Elizabeth
Breadon and Music Therapist Jill Buchanan for many years.  Therapeutic partners for 10 years, both Liz
and Jill feel strongly about being in the moment with their clients in a safe,
well-lit and energetically healing space. 
Working out of client’s living rooms has definite benefits, but both
clinicians have decided their energy is now best spent focused in the clinic
rather than on the road.  The time for an
innovative concept to become reality is here.
Your support of this
campaign would enable Liz and Jill to finally develop a centralized space for
many people to come together to participate in enriching programs such as:
·  One on one therapeutic
support through Homeopathy
·  Individual and group Music
Therapy sessions for children with special needs and their families
·  Specialized movement
therapy sessions for individuals and groups
·  Professional song shares
and networking among Expressive Arts Therapists
·  Supervised clinical
space for student Homeopaths
·  Evening relaxation
groups for parents of children with special needs
·  Regular lectures on
health, wellness and relaxation
·  Lessons in clinical
music theory and clinical music improvisation
·  Music lessons for the
child with special needs
·  And much, much more!
Liz and Jill both work
in fields that insurance currently does not cover, so they have historically
only worked with families who can afford the out of pocket fees for these
services.  The underlying mission of the
Therapeutic Arts Alliance has been to come together in a space where all people
can afford to find healing for themselves or their families, with or without insurance
coverage.  Whether one is looking for
constitutional support through Homeopathy or communication skill development
through Music Therapy, the Therapeutic Arts Alliance will be a place where folks
from all over the Greater Boston area can find information, support and
relief.  
Your funding will help them meet this mission.  
Instruments need to be
obtained and in some cases, relocated – all which costs a significant amount of
money. Keeping the doors open while the clientele is built is extremely important.  One can only attend to a small number of
families while moving from living room to living room.  Once the clinic space is open, opportunities
to expand the clientele abound, thereby creating a more financially stable
business.  Both clinicians have a waiting
list of potential clients, though setting folks into a working schedule is
always more of a challenge than expected! 
This all takes time.  Your financial
support will enable Liz and Jill to focus on this development without the
threat of an empty bank account for rent, utilities and insurance.  Much of their own personal financial
resources have already been directed toward this endeavor.  
We ask that you join us in shouldering the exciting and
life-affirming weight of opening a new and enriching environment for healing
through the therapeutic arts!
What if the goal of raising
$6000 isn’t met?  That’s OK.  Every single penny raised will work hard to
create the therapeutic space Liz and Jill envision.  Sometimes it just takes a little longer than
planned.  
Offer support in
whatever amount you are comfortable with. 

~ Because you know how
beneficial the therapeutic arts can be.
~ Because you have a
child with special needs who needs support.
~ Because you need support as a parent or
caregiver of a child with special needs. 
~ Mostly because you see the need for such a space, too.  For
whatever reason.

story:
I have always been very concerned with this issue of parking and traffic.

Here's what I wrote on my blog on L.A. Traffic [WHY L.A. traffic sucks: Parking] years ago

[http://la-traffic-sucks-lets-fix-it.blogspot.co...]:

"Here's a city that was designed for the car. Here's a city where, regardless of who you are, diehard biker, radical environmentalist, public transport enthusiast, whatever, for one reason or another, sooner or later, one way or another, you are going to have to use, borrow, rent or buy a car. Here's a city where a car is a necessity but where you are PENALIZED for having a car through these PUNITIVE taxation in the form of parking tickets or DRAINING OF YOUR POCKETBOOK paying for parking to the paid parking racket cartel.

This is what parking is like in L.A. There are just not enough parking spots. The meters don't work well or don't work at all sometimes. Signage is outdated or unbelievably confusing. And you have fascist parking enforcement up the wazoo!

A little nightmare..."

I have since moved to the Bay Area only to find that it's not only "deja vu all over again" but that it's ten times worse up here! And not only that, this time it has really hit home!

For all its Bart system and Muni system and streetcar system and trolley system and bus system and taxi system and now Uber/Lyft system, SOMETIME, sooner or later, one way or another, you're going to need a car in San Francisco, and when you do, good luck finding available, affordable parking on the street or off the street. Parking is more of "a little nightmare" in San Francisco than in L.A.

You still need a PhD. to figure out the signs, especially the ones for street sweeping, and no matter how hard you try and how conscientious you are, you're bound to get parking tickets in San Francisco. I don't know anyone who lives in San Francisco and drives who has never gotten a parking ticket.

As you can see in the video above, the JAWS JUGGERNAUT of the parking racket cartel finally came to devour my car.

They claim I owe $1,600 (!!!) for ten (10) parking tickets. How can that be?

You do the math. Even at $100 (which can't possibly be! The average parking ticket is $60): $100 x 10 - $1000. How can there be $600 or $1,000 in fees?

It's completely outrageous. This is how they destroy people's lives.

Here's what I concluded on my blog on L.A. traffic

[http://la-traffic-sucks-lets-fix-it.blogspot.co...]:

"If there's one thing, the residents of Car City, USA should be up in arms, raving mad about, parking is it!

Whatever happened to the "Proposition 13" tax revolt spirit I've read so much about? In the late 1970's the citizens of California got raving mad about escalating property taxes and drafted and passed "Proposition 13" to limit those taxes. I think it's time for another revolt - this time a revolt against this "taxation without representation"! Did you elect these parking enforcement people? Do they truly represent your interests? Do they add to the quality of life in your city or do they diminish it?

In the spirit of the American Revolution, throw an Embarcadero "tea party" - for lack of a Boston harbor :-) - and overthrow those King George's of Parking. GO!"

The solution is the Santa Monica, Beverly Hills and San Mateo parking model: plenty of parking structures surrounding business areas offering first two hours FREE and $1 per additional hour or, like in San Mateo, $0.50/hr parking.

I want to campaign to bring that parking model to San Francisco.

Before I do, though, I need your help wresting my car back from the JAWS JUGGERNAUT of the fascist parking racket cartel that finally came to devour my car.

Why didn't take care of these tickets sooner you might ask?

This is an unbelievably expensive area getting more expensive by the day. I had to choose: it was EITHER rent, food and gas OR those tickets. I choose the really IMPORTANT stuff.

Oh, and by the way, do you know WHY this happened? Actually, I wasn't driving this car very much and I wasn't staying in the city. When this happened last Friday, Jul 10th, I was carpooling into the city. At the carpool pickup spot there were about eleven people in line including me and NO cars at around 9:20am. Most of them were already late for work. Usually, I would be the one driving and picking people up to carpool into the city. That day I was a passenger waiting in line. I thought, "Should I go get my van and drive some of these people into the city?" We waited and waited. One car came. Finally, I told them I would go get my van and give them a ride. I parked the car where you can see in that video above. And then they came...

So, this happened because I chose to do a GOOD DEED and help people out.

Where's my GOOD KARMA now?!?

Will you help me beat this racket?

[Contributions by PayPal most appreciated!]

UPDATE Mon Jul 13, 2015: I wrote all this last night [Sunday 07/12/15]. Called the company that handles towing for SF Parking, "AutoReturn." It turns out it's actually over $2,200 what they say I owe! WHY? Because the towing and administrative fees alone are  $750 [SEVEN HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS] ON TOP OF all the tickets and fees. It's an unbelievable RACKET!!!

story:
Short Summary


I'm a Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor specializing in the evidence-based methods of Acceptance Commitment Therapy, Dialectic Behavior Therapy, the Gottman Method, and Coherence Therapy. 

People come to me when they are stuck or their relationship is stuck. I help them gain insight for what their pain is trying to tell them, and then give them real, practical tools for coping and thriving. I'm not a smile-and-nod therapist. We'll laugh, cry, be astonished, and stomp the inertia. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • My dream is to create a beautiful and cozy space reminiscent of an apothecary shop and Diagon Alley. I've found a beautiful space in Jefferson Park. Now it's just about furnishing and personalizing it. 
  • Furniture is expensive! I'm estimating $3000 to furnish the office and waiting room. In my old office, many clients would complain the sofa was uncomfortable or too low to the ground.  I want a space that feels genuine and inviting, chairs and sofas that are comfortable. 
  • I'm estimating $1500 for decor, including paint, curtains, "house jewelry" (switch plates etc), etc. $500 for marketing, $350 for a laptop and printer, $400 for supplies, and $1000 for start-up fees like registering the LLC etc. Yes, I'm asking for less than I actually need. If I can hit stretch goals, awesome. 
  • The amazing Chalk Girl is designing a logo for me, as well as a Feelings Wheel painting for the wall of my office, as many people have trouble identifying emotions. Also, because I'm kind of a brat, I've commissioned her to re-create the charcoal drawing "Il Duomo as Seen from Belvedere" for the lobby as well. We'll see who gets it. 
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, we'll start with less and add over time. It's a priority for me to offer perks you're excited about, and to give you something of value for your hard-earned dollar. 

The Impact

  • My husband noticed that, when I come home from work the most satisfied, it's because I helped someone to realize they are not crazy or alone. 
  • Trauma sucks. Shame sucks. It's excruciating when you feel alienated from the person you love best.  
  • I help people recover from situations that feel intolerable. 
  • Real feedback from clients: 
    • "It's the first time I ever left a therapy session feeling like I could change anything." 
    • "It's wonderful to see the kind of freedom I've been able to find over the last year, and I just wanted to circle back with you and thank you for the big impact you had on me." 
    • "Thank you for your wonderful, judgment free, and genuine care you provided over the past few months... it was literally life-saving." 
    • "I'm not exaggerating when I say that Nikki saved my life." 

Risks & Challenges

Starting a business is a huge risk. For the past several years, I've had clients coming in through the roof from a thriving group practice that contracted me. Not only is there the financial risk of a business not succeeding, but there's the emotional risk to clients if their therapist shuts their doors. So what gives me the chutzpah to do it? 

  • I spent 10 years in finance before leaving Corporate America to work as a therapist. 
  • I worked closely with the owners at a thriving yoga studio, and then closely with the owners for my first year at a therapy group practice, learning the best practices for owning and administrating a mind-body business. 
  • I've won two awards for outstanding contribution at my current place of practice, including Therapist of the Year.
  • Over 90% of the people who attend a session with me come back within 10 days, and clients will schedule out their next sessions over 3-4 weeks to make sure they can get into my packed caseload. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tweet, Share, promote, brag, anything using the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Remember the Helping Hips show on January 13th! 

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Cheese Wheels, Inc. is a newly incorporated Washington corporation looking to get on the road to success.  Chef Robb has over 40 years experience in the food industry and has developed a number of recipes to bring in customers as he will have something for everyone.

Cheese Wheels is currently looking for funding to purchase a food truck and wrap, insurance, initial start up costs and initial inventory.  This can be accomplished in a relatively short amount of time once funds become available.

Cheese Wheels is a chance to share our love for food, excellent customer service and to become a part of the community.  We intend to become involved with local organizations to help the homeless and underprivileged by providing food to them free of charge.  It's a chance to better ourselves and our community.

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently seeking up to $75,000 to purchase and outfit the truck, needed insurance and licensing and initial inventory.

While not only becoming a successful food truck, we will offer private catering services to further boost the bottom line.  We also intend to participate in local festivals and events and hope to be on location for Seattle Seahawks, Mariners and Sounders events.

In exchange for an investment, you will be entitled to a share of the business and ultimately a share in the profits.  Sit back and reap the rewards of your investment while we do the hard work.

The Impact

With your help we will be able to become a sought after vendor by lunchtime crowds and special events.  We also intend to make an impact on our community by reaching out to those in need and providing food to those not  as fortunate.

The culture in the Pacific Northwest lends itself to this type of endeavor being a success.  The population is filled with young professional, primarily in the technology field, who are a prime target for our products.  We have researched the food truck industry in detail, as well as visiting a number of local food trucks to evaluate their offerings and price points.

Risks & Challenges

While an investment is always a risk, please know that it is our intention to give 150% effort to make this a success for all of us and our community.

Chef Robb has many years of experience in the industry and knows what the customers want.  He has years of menu planning, budgeting and customer service.  He attended culinary school and served as a cook for 12 years in the U.S. Navy and believes in dedication and work ethic.

We have a number of locations scouted out for the truck and will visit all of them to ensure we have selected the best and most profitable ones to frequent.  Social media will be used to let customers know where to find us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that a financial investment may not be possible for everyone who wants to help.  We would like to invite you to share our campaign with someone you know who may be interested and give the campaign a shout out on social media.

story:
COMMONPLACE BOOKS is about books & people. This is an uncommon place to find common ground - to cultivate & share a lifelong relationship with books.

WE BELIEVE BOOKS ARE OUR MOST MOST MEANINGFUL HUMAN ARTIFACTS.

But this isn't just about selling books. It's about creating a place to be inspired human beings - professionals & professors, poets & parents, wild children & wise neighbors.

We want you to walk in the door & find someone ready to address your "needs of the day" - to answer a question or offer a thoughtful recommendation.

We do so knowing that WORDS MATTER, STORIES TRANSFORM, BOOKS CHANGE LIVES & CREATE NEW WORLDS.

So whether you come to Commonplace Books to solve a life question, to find your next favorite author, to be still with your thoughts or engage in you next great conversation...

OUR HOPE IS THAT ALL THE IDEAS, BEAUTY & HEART YOU FIND WITHIN BOOKS, YOU WILL FIND WITHIN THIS PLACE WITH PEOPLE WHO LOVE BOOKS LIKE YOU DO.

story:
Keycall is simple keychain with a phone number and four digit pin code printed on front of it. If anyone finds a lost set of keys with a Keycall attached to it they will be able to contact the owner, without the owners personal phone number ever being disclosed to whoever found the keys.

The Keycall phone number and pin code is connected to the the owners phone number only in our secure database.

This will protect you from the risk of disclosing your private details like your personal phone number to people with less genuine motives than returning your keys.

 

Use your Keycall keychain with your car keys

We are extremely excited to bring Keycall to the crowdfunding community. It’s time to turn this prototype into a globally marketed product. With your support, we can make sure Keycall stays off any need subscription costs. We want Keycall to utilize a simple, one-time payment that will last for ten years.

 

To setup your Keycall, download the Keycall app on your Android or iPhone and link your pin number to your phone number. You can then add additional Keycall’s to the app or change your phone number simply by using the app.

Get your keys back with a simple phone call

 

Losing your key is not only troublesome it also will cost you a lot of money replacing them. So if you lose your keys you want to have them back as quickly as possible.

We believe in a quick solution where the finder can simply call you directly is the best. Other security key chains on the market make it possible for the finder to leave your keys in a mailbox, but then you would first get your keys back several days later.

There are also these smart key chains with bluetooth support but that requires the finder to download a specific app and they use a lot of batteries.

We believe that keycall is the simplest solution for this problem and there is only a one time fee.

 

Our prototype has already received fantastic feedback. With your support, we will be able to fund our back-end server that will forward calls to Keycall owners.


We will also be using funding to help raise awareness online and on social media. We currently have no commercial budget, and only with your support, we can bring Keycall to the world.

 

How long will Keycall work?

Once we hit our funding goal, we can make sure Keycall will work for ten years – which will give us the time to establish financial stability to empower Keycall’s efficiency long into the future.

 

Is the Keycall guaranteed to get your keys back?

Keycall assures that those who find your keys have the ability to safely get in touch with you. From our blind tests, we have found Keycall to be much more effective than other return methods, although the potential for return depends on the person who finds them.

 

Is keycall a Smart key chain?

Keycall requires no batteries and does not have a GPS or Bluetooth sync. Keycall simply helps the person who finds your keys to call you directly.

 

www.thekeycall.com

info@thekeycall.com
story_txt:
Keycall is simple keychain with a phone number and four digit pin code printed on front of it. If anyone finds a lost set of keys with a Keycall attached to it they will be able to contact the owner, without the owners personal phone number ever being disclosed to whoever found the keys.
The Keycall phone number and pin code is connected to the the owners phone number only in our secure database.
This will protect you from the risk of disclosing your private details like your personal phone number to people with less genuine motives than returning your keys.
 

Use your Keycall keychain with your car keys
We are extremely excited to bring Keycall to the crowdfunding community. It’s time to turn this prototype into a globally marketed product. With your support, we can make sure Keycall stays off any need subscription costs. We want Keycall to utilize a simple, one-time payment that will last for ten years.
 

To setup your Keycall, download the Keycall app on your Android or iPhone and link your pin number to your phone number. You can then add additional Keycall’s to the app or change your phone number simply by using the app.

Get your keys back with a simple phone call
 

Losing your key is not only troublesome it also will cost you a lot of money replacing them. So if you lose your keys you want to have them back as quickly as possible.
We believe in a quick solution where the finder can simply call you directly is the best. Other security key chains on the market make it possible for the finder to leave your keys in a mailbox, but then you would first get your keys back several days later.
There are also these smart key chains with bluetooth support but that requires the finder to download a specific app and they use a lot of batteries.
We believe that keycall is the simplest solution for this problem and there is only a one time fee.
 

Our prototype has already received fantastic feedback. With your support, we will be able to fund our back-end server that will forward calls to Keycall owners.
We will also be using funding to help raise awareness online and on social media. We currently have no commercial budget, and only with your support, we can bring Keycall to the world.
 

How long will Keycall work?
Once we hit our funding goal, we can make sure Keycall will work for ten years – which will give us the time to establish financial stability to empower Keycall’s efficiency long into the future. Is the Keycall guaranteed to get your keys back?
Keycall assures that those who find your keys have the ability to safely get in touch with you. From our blind tests, we have found Keycall to be much more effective than other return methods, although the potential for return depends on the person who finds them. Is keycall a Smart key chain?
Keycall requires no batteries and does not have a GPS or Bluetooth sync. Keycall simply helps the person who finds your keys to call you directly.
 

www.thekeycall.com
info@thekeycall.com

story:
Love Well Delivery

Help us provide immune support for those who are ill throughout the Fall/Winter flu season- and into the New Year ahead!

    Hi there,

    My name is Jennie Hayes, the creator of the Love Well Delivery concept.  The project has been born entirely from compassion and the desire to help those in the SF Bay Area have access to holistic food and medicine while suffering from a variety of different ailments at home.  Although there are many different products that are offered as supplement to our package bundles (see www.lovewelldelivery.com for details), the mainstay for the entire project is a special bone-broth based soup designed by myself and my oldest childhood friend, Dr. Starr Ramson N.D. (Naturopathic Doctor).  While there are many bone-broth soups available on the market, ours differs in many ways; containing super-food ingredients such as medicinal mushrooms and specialized herbs to support the healing of a variety of different immune disruptions, including:

    -common cold

    -influenza

    -inflammatory digestive disorders

    Aptly titled, "Magic Healing Soup," this freshly-made product has been developed carefully with the experience and formulation of a skilled holistic medical practitioner.  As to my own background; I have over a decade of wellness education including Massage Therapy, Ayurveda, Yoga and anatomical studies.  Most importantly, this special soup has been created with the intention to help those who are suffering from illness find their way back to SUPERIOR health.   We want to see our clients find a new standard of higher immunity. I believe if given the opportunity to see this project get off the ground, beginning with our kitchen rental in Berkeley, CA - that we could help MANY in the Bay Area. 

    In addition to our medicinal bone-broth soup, we will be providing hydrating elixirs, immune boosting teas, herbal tinctures provided by Five Flavors Herbs (Oakland, CA) and essential oils provided by Floracopeia.    We also have holistic medicinal packages for women suffering from PMS, pre/post-natal mothers, and those recovering from hangover. 

    All of these products and bundles would be prepared at our kitchen, located in North Berkeley.  We have selected a kitchen sublet shared with Morrell's Bread and are simply waiting to put down the deposit, knowing that the project has enough backing to get started.  This space is absolutely perfect for Love Well; it contains the potential for both production AND retail or pick-up hours, meaning that two days a week, we would have walk-in or pick-up hours available. If you choose to donate your donations would go directly to:

    -The kitchen rental and deposit  (Deposit plus 6 months rent = $4200)

    -Kitchen equipment including large soup pots, cutting boards and industrial blender

    -Jars and storage materials for transport and delivery

    -Wholesale orders of the Herbal Tincture, local Honey,  essential oil, local Organic produce/herbs and beef bones

    -Transportation for delivery

    Quite simply, I know this project can succeed. It is a matter of timing (flu season is ahead!), raising awareness and getting our product in people's hands as soon as possible, so we can immediately begin helping those who are sick and at home return to better health! 

    Thank you for your donations, your support, your belief in our project - we have the opportunity to help many.

     -Jennie Hayes

story:
We here at Boar Products have been avid hunters & gun collectors for years. We have been trying to find the best products to protect & lubricate our guns without leaving the typical chemical residue and smell on yourself as well as your guns. So we decided that we needed to find a better way, and started reading and researching what was used to lubricate and protect weapons over the years, and from this we tested multiple different formulas. After years of trial, error and testing we developed a line of products for gun cleaning, protection & bullet lubrication.

 

 

While working on expanding our line we found that some of our formulas work amazingly well as hand lotion and balm for the driest, cracked & chapped skin on hands & feet!

 

 

 We are continuing to work on refining and expanding  our line of products, as our goal is to always bring you the best line of natural products for your money.

We started Boar Products with all natural ingredients for the sole reason that they have no chemical odor and are less likely for you to have your gun cleaning product ruin your prize shot. Our products have been tested and have low odor , but best of all they lubricate and protect without making your gun slippery. Even though we use natural ingredients  you will see they work better then the harsh chemicals and are safe enough to protect your hands as well after a day in the woods.

We are working toward bringing our complete line into production, but we need your help! To bring our full line of products to market, we have set up this crowd funding site to help make this a reality. For any donations, we have put some awesome samples together to show our thanks for the support!


A portion of our profits will be donated to veterans and their families through various non profits. If you have a non profit you would like us to consider please let us know so we can review.

Short Summary

  • Hey, my name is Tsutomu Gabriel Komori and 

    I was born in Japan

    I care about the state of our minds.

  • By buying this voucher you support the local temples.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are offering you a place where you can clear your mind. 
  • We are offering you the possibility to experience life with a real Monk, morning meditation, peaceful dreams, a Japanese-style bath and nice healthy traditional dinners.
  • The money goes to the temple.


    The Impact
  • If you've had enough of working then you can rest, relax and re-focus.

story:
Short Summary 

As believers, we are taught that nothing can happen unless it is the will of God. We fail to understand that God will not force His will upon us. Many things that occur are the results of man’s contradiction to God’s will.

God told Adam not to touch the tree of knowledge of good and evil. It was His will for Adam to listen and obey. When Adam did not, God allowed Adam the consequences of his own choice. 

Experience Doesn’t Have to Be the BEST Teacher are lessons in the areas of life, love, and human mankind.  Experience will indeed teach us many things, but listening to that still small voice, or obeying that inner gut feeling will help us bypass a lot of unnecessary pitfalls.

What We Need

I need $4500 to publish my book with CreateSpace. The funds will go towards editing (80K+ word count), cover design, book layout, Kindle conversion, and marketing. I am prayerful that I will reach my goal. Nonetheless, every dime raised will go towards publishing. 

The Impact

Experience Doesn’t Have to Be the BEST Teacher is valuable because it reminds us that we were not created to fall into every ditch that tries to entrap us.  We simply need to tap into our inner knowing, and comply. 

How many times have you said, “I knew I should not have done that,” because most often, the end result was not rewarding? Just imagine having complied to that knowing. Imagine how much farther or happier you would have been had you listened. Imagine how much farther and happier you will be once you begin to listen. 

God did not mean for us to experience every aspect of hell on earth before we get a clue. Some people go to their graves still having no clue. Others end up in jail, with even more on heavy medications, in a mental institution, or disconnected spiritually and/or emotionally all because they decided that experience had to be their teacher.

God's plan for us will never change. It is within our power to bring it to life here on earth.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time, then please feel free to mention this project on social media. You can also join us me in a thankful prayer that God will He will do exceedingly, abundantly, and above all that I can ask or think according to the powers that worketh in me [and this book- Ephesians 3:20].

story:
Welcome to We Are ALL SF!  Help us build a fan convention!


Originally, We Are ALL Science Fiction was the brainchild of a couple of authors – Lou J. Berger and Quincy J. Allen --  who wanted to welcome fans of all forms of speculative fiction into the traditional fan community.  They were joined by some other fans who wanted to add a new convention to the already existing list of amazing fan conventions…and be inclusive, accessible, diverse, and affordable – and kid friendly.

We found a venue that was large enough to welcome hundreds or thousands of fans in a place where no fan con had ever happened before…and like the fans of the 30s, 40s, 50s, 60s, and up to the present day, we are willing to travel a bit farther to bring some amazing speakers, artists, musicians, costumers, celebrities and other Guests of Honor to the coast of Washington State.

Put on by an all-fan, all-volunteer, non-profit group made up of fans with decades of experience in con running and attending (from all over the globe), our first annual convention will feature award-winning authors Mike Resnick, Nancy Kress, Elizabeth Ann Scarborough, Jody Lynn Nye, David Gerrold, William F. Nolan, James E. Gunn and many others, including Hugo nominee Jennifer Brozek, Angela Korra’ti, Raven Oak, with other guests such as Scott Hungerford (Games), Marvel comic artist (and fine artist) Jeffrey Veregge, Musical guest Dara Korra’ti of Crime & the Forces of Evil, Tor editor Beth Meacham, and actor Drew Hobson (Voice of Marcus, State of Decay).  We hope to be an international fan destination as we add more speakers and guests in the coming months!

We Are ALL SF Con will include an award ceremony, a banquet, a costume ball, panels and talks for writers, artists, musicians, science, gaming, costumes, anime, comics and more!  Master Class Writers’ Workshop with Nancy Kress! There will be an art show and a dealer room with books, art, jewelry, costumes, collectibles, and other gift items for sale.  Concerts. Dances. Hall costume awards!  We will have separate rooms for kid-friendly programming, board games, a Magic: The Gathering draft tournament, videos, a free movie night, FILK…all aspects of fandom are welcome!

We would love to have your help!

To put on a new con will take registrations, donations, sponsors and crowdfunding.  If you can help, whether as a volunteer or a donor, you can be part of the tribe of fans who are creating a new con!  Your donations will provide funding to rent the venues, bring in Guests of Honor and speakers, buy food for hospitality & the consuite, sound and lights for concerts, and make this the best event it can possibly be!

Our goal is $9,000.  We already have a Facebook event page at We Are ALL SF Con 2016, or you can email us at admin@weareallsf.com so we can let you know when the registration form is live.

Our website is being developed.  We have already received support and funding from generous donors and businesses in the Ocean Shores area. Your help can make this happen-- and make sure it happens again and again, for many years to come. Your generosity will bring the future of SF to the Washington coast…and beyond.

We Are ALL SF Convention - November 4-6, 2016, Ocean Shores, WA
We Are Family

Please write to admin@weareallsf.com  if you have questions or call 425-443-3895.

And even if you are not able to donate, we would love it if you could pass the word, share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media and tell your friends!

story:
Short Summary


  • The Council Media Group is an alternate source of dedicated media. A brand new company for a brand new time.
  • This campaign is highly important to represent for the voiceless and falsely demonized. Trustworthy Media without the corporate agenda & Interest.
  • By Contributing you will help TCMG reach communities across the world with  info and images that aren't watered down. 


What We Need 


  • We have a base goal of 10k which will provide  for content, equipment, and Investments for company growth.
  • We're asking for a contribution of $1 or more, you can contribute more than once. The more contributions we receive the bigger we can make the company!  We believe we can surpass the 10k base goal easily. It will allow us to pay for employees and attract the right talent to make this a strong media house.
  • All funds raised will be used towards The Council Media Group. We give High thanks to anyone who contributes to our cause.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will provide independent News & Images with real accuracy and fairness. Instead of seeing the same story multiple times a day you will make way for everyday stories that should be recognized but never are. It will also provide for:
  • Photographers
  • Videographers
  • App Development
  • Web Series Development
  • Short Films & Feature Films
  • Music
  • Books & Magazines
  • Graphics
  • Video Games
  • Radio Programming

Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest challenge will be competition from already established media.
  • Obtaining new viewers and exclusive stories.
  • Travel

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell family and friends!
  • Share this campaign!
  • If you would like to volunteer please contact us at Tcmgroup3@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Owen, I am 9 years old and I LOVE dogs. My mom and dad have always said that kids learn best by doing.  Last year when I was 8, I found recipes for YUMMY dog biscuits and began to play around with them.  I came up with the idea for my dog treat business by reading a book about the importance of learning how to handle money.  It talked about earning it, saving it, spending it, and giving back to the community. I knew that dogs loved my treats and wanted to build a business that helped animals.  Mom is helping me with my project and I hope you can, too.


We love our pets as we are sure you do, too.  This adventure we are going on as a family is not only about teaching our child how to be a responsible business owner and member of a community, but also about learning healthy alternatives to the modern lifestyle—for people and for pets.

Owen's Yummy Yo's are all natural pet treats that must be refrigerated (or frozen).  That's how fresh they are, and how fresh ideally you want them to be.  

Chicken or Beef Broth, Wheat Germ, All-purpose Flour, Whole Wheat Flour, Oats, Cheese, Bacon, etc.

These are just some of the base ingredients in Owen's Yummy Yo's.  No chemicals or By Products.  These pet treats are easy for your pet to digest and contribute to lasting health.  Owen's Yummy Yo's will freeze up to six months and still be tasty and enjoyable for your pet to eat.  

Why We Need Your Help & What You Get

Owen's Yummy Os's is run out of our home kitchen.  In order to increase our supply and grow our customer base so that more pets have the opportunity to eat healthy snacks we have to raise additional funds for larger ovens, storage and basic marketing.  

We are looking to raise $7,500 and If we achieve funding we will be able to provide products, increase our donations to ErinoakKids, a charitable organization in Ontario treating and providing support services for over 15,000 children with disabilities each year.

Specifically, we need:

  • A double oven
  • Extra freezers
  • Packaging supplies (resealable bags, shipping supplies, etc.)
  • Product displays
  • Signs, flyers and other basic marketing


The 'Perks'

$5 Your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)

$10 Receive a sample bag of our Yummy O's and appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)

$25  Receive a bag of Yummy O's, a dog toy, a $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)

$50 Receive a bag of Yummy O's, a t-shirt, a $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!) As well, you will receive a personal thank you call from Owen.

$100 Receive three bags of Yummy O's, a t-shirt, a personalized mug, $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!) As well, you will receive a personal thank you call from Owen.

The Impact

As a child with Cerebral Palsy (Hemiplegia) and High Functioning Autism, ErinoakKids has been instrumental in my physical and mental development since I was 8 months old. They help so many kids in so many ways, I just want to do what I can to give back. Last year I was able to raise over $200 for them. In 2016 I want to raise more than $2000!!

Risks & Challenges

The challenge will be keeping up with these orders. Mom, Nana and I can only bake so much. I have thought about reaching out to my friends or even the Little Chefs Program at ErinoakKids to see if they want to help with the baking when things get busy. I already have a couple of kids who said they would like to help out. Even one of my customers gave me her resume!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute; however, if you feel this is a good learning experience for me and my peers and a good cause, please use the 'share' tool and help me get the word out. Anything you can do would be greatly appreciated!


A Note from Mom: When Owen came with the idea of starting a small business creating healthy dog treats, all of us did our best to research this topic to the best of our ability.  What we found was alarming.  We found multiple research studies that tie common pet diseases with their diet.  So much of the food given to animals today actually contributes to poor health and shorter lifespans.  A quick journey through Youtube searching on the pet food industry will tell you all you need to know about what goes into those products and why you shouldn't give them to your pets.  

  • Ethoxyquin (an herbicide)
  • Propylene Glycol (chemical in anti-freeze)
  • BHA & BHT (Butylated-hydroxyanisole & butylated hydroxytoluene preservatives known to cause kidney and liver damage in humans)

These are a few common chemicals found in pet food and treats, not to mention the use of “Meat By Products” which can literally mean anything from tumors to entrails to bones.  What animal can be healthy when it is eating things incredibly harmful to their organs?
story_txt:
Short Summary 

My name is Owen, I am 9 years old and I LOVE dogs. My mom and dad have always said that kids learn best by doing.  Last year when I was 8, I found recipes for YUMMY dog biscuits and began to play around with them.  I came up with the idea for my dog treat business by reading a book about the importance of learning how to handle money.  It talked about earning it, saving it, spending it, and giving back to the community. I knew that dogs loved my treats and wanted to build a business that helped animals.  Mom is helping me with my project and I hope you can, too.





We love our pets as we are sure you do, too.  This adventure we are going on as a family is not only about teaching our child how to be a responsible business owner and member of a community, but also about learning healthy alternatives to the modern lifestyle—for people and for pets.


Owen's Yummy Yo's are all natural pet treats that must be refrigerated (or frozen).  That's how fresh they are, and how fresh ideally you want them to be.  


Chicken or Beef Broth, Wheat Germ, All-purpose Flour, Whole Wheat Flour, Oats, Cheese, Bacon, etc.


These are just some of the base ingredients in Owen's Yummy Yo's.  No chemicals or By Products.  These pet treats are easy for your pet to digest and contribute to lasting health.  Owen's Yummy Yo's will freeze up to six months and still be tasty and enjoyable for your pet to eat.     Why We Need Your Help & What You Get 

Owen's Yummy Os's is run out of our home kitchen.  In order to increase our supply and grow our customer base so that more pets have the opportunity to eat healthy snacks we have to raise additional funds for larger ovens, storage and basic marketing.  


We are looking to raise $7,500 and If we achieve funding we will be able to provide products, increase our donations to ErinoakKids, a charitable organization in Ontario treating and providing support services for over 15,000 children with disabilities each year.
Specifically, we need:  A double oven Extra freezers
Packaging supplies (resealable bags, shipping supplies, etc.)
Product displays
Signs, flyers and other basic marketing



The 'Perks'

$5 Your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)$10 Receive a sample bag of our Yummy O's and appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)

$25  Receive a bag of Yummy O's, a dog toy, a $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!)

$50 Receive a bag of Yummy O's, a t-shirt, a $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!) As well, you will receive a personal thank you call from Owen.

$100 Receive three bags of Yummy O's, a t-shirt, a personalized mug, $5 donation to ErinoakKids will be made, and your name will appear on our "With Thanks" page on our website. (If you are a business, we can add a link to your site!) As well, you will receive a personal thank you call from Owen.
The Impact As a child with Cerebral Palsy (Hemiplegia) and High Functioning Autism, ErinoakKids has been instrumental in my physical and mental development since I was 8 months old. They help so many kids in so many ways, I just want to do what I can to give back. Last year I was able to raise over $200 for them. In 2016 I want to raise more than $2000!!
    Risks & Challenges  The challenge will be keeping up with these orders. Mom, Nana and I can only bake so much. I have thought about reaching out to my friends or even the Little Chefs Program at ErinoakKids to see if they want to help with the baking when things get busy. I already have a couple of kids who said they would like to help out. Even one of my customers gave me her resume!
    Other Ways You Can Help We understand if you can't contribute; however, if you feel this is a good learning experience for me and my peers and a good cause, please use the 'share' tool and help me get the word out. Anything you can do would be greatly appreciated!


A Note from Mom: When Owen came with the idea of starting a small business creating healthy dog treats, all of us did our best to research this topic to the best of our ability.  What we found was alarming.  We found multiple research studies that tie common pet diseases with their diet.  So much of the food given to animals today actually contributes to poor health and shorter lifespans.  A quick journey through Youtube searching on the pet food industry will tell you all you need to know about what goes into those products and why you shouldn't give them to your pets.  

Ethoxyquin (an herbicide)
Propylene Glycol (chemical in anti-freeze)
BHA & BHT (Butylated-hydroxyanisole & butylated hydroxytoluene preservatives known to cause kidney and liver damage in humans)

These are a few common chemicals found in pet food and treats, not to mention the use of “Meat By Products” which can literally mean anything from tumors to entrails to bones.  What animal can be healthy when it is eating things incredibly harmful to their organs?

story:
Newport’s beacon for winter family fun could once again be lit up for the holidays as Newport Waterfront Events, a division of Waterfront Productions LLC, in collaboration with Scott’s Wharf LLC and Newport Harbor Corporation, announce that most of the key pieces are in place for the Newport Skating Center to return to its former downtown location at the Newport Yachting Center this upcoming winter season except for the corporate and community support necessary to finance the rink’s operations.  With this in mind, Newport Waterfront Events is seeking corporate sponsorships and direct business and private donations.  

Understanding the importance of the rink to the community, representatives of the three companies have had continuing discussions about a return of the rink since it was put on ice last winter due to the sale of the Newport Yachting Center by Newport Harbor Corporation to Scott’s Wharf.  In the spirit of cooperation, the Newport Harbor Corporation has agreed to donate the skating rink equipment and assets to Newport Waterfront Events while Scott’s Wharf is providing the Newport Skating Center’s former space at the Newport Yachting Center for the coming skating season.  Plans would be to have a full schedule of activities this coming winter, including Family Fun Nights, Skates with Santa, Learn to Skate camp, community partnerships with non-profit groups including the Boys & Girls Club and the Martin Luther King Jr. Community Center and, of course, the grand opening and traditional Tree Lighting ceremony.

“I want to thank Newport Harbor Corporation and Scott’s Wharf for making the return of the rink for this upcoming season a distinct possibility,” said Michele Maker Palmieri, President and CEO of Waterfront Productions, the parent company of Newport Waterfront Events, and former General Manager of the Newport Yachting Center. “It is both exciting and comforting to know that the winter wonderland could return along with the vibrancy to downtown that the rink helps to create.  However, the final, critical piece to make this a reality is to garner financial support from corporate partnerships and the community to help fund the rink’s operations.  The rink operates at a loss annually due to the extensive expenses to maintain it.  In order for Newport Waterfront Events to take this on as a new company we need extra help this year.”

Corporate sponsorships that have been secured to date for the Newport Skating Center include: Cox, Stop & Shop, Viti Automotive Group, Discover Newport, Rob Levine & Associates, Amica Mutual Insurance Company, KVH and Think Thin.  The Newport Waterfront Events team is also busy speaking with additional companies who have supported the rink over the last 14 years.

Palmieri added that she could not guarantee that the Newport Yachting Center location will be a long-term solution for the rink but said this would be a first step towards the goal of realizing a permanent home for the Newport Skating Center.

The Newport Skating Center, which first opened in 2000, features a 9,000 square foot skating surface large enough to accommodate up to 100 skaters at a time.  Skate rentals, hot beverages, comfort foods, lighting for night skating, regular admission discounts, FREE parking and viewing spaces for the public are also featured at the rink.

Waterfront Productions LLC, headquartered in Newport, Rhode Island, specializes in event management/production and venue operation and is the parent company of Newport Waterfront Events and Rhode Island Waterfront Events.  The events Waterfront Productions owns and manages include the Great Chowder Cook-Off at Fort Adams in Newport, Rhode Island and the Waterfront Reggae Festival and the International Oktoberfest at India Point Park in Providence, Rhode Island.  The Waterfront Productions team has co-produced a variety of other events, including the Newport Comedy Series, the WBRU Concert Series at Providence Piers, the Food Truck Festival, the Newport International Boat Show and the Newport Charter Yacht Show, and offers event management consulting services.

For more information on sponsorship and donation opportunities please visit skatenewport.com, or contact Michele Maker Palmieri, President and CEO of Waterfront Productions LLC via email at mmaker@newportwaterfrontevents.com or call (888) 900-8640, Ext. 709.  Those interested can also “like us” at facebook.com/skatenewport.  Also follow newportevents on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

UPDATED PRESS RELEASE:  NOVEMBER 17, 2015:

CLOSE TO FUNDRAISING GOAL, NEWPORT WATERFRONT EVENTS

MOVING FORWARD WITH RETURN OF NEWPORT SKATING CENTER

New presenting sponsor of the rink is ALEX AND ANI.

NEWPORT, RI, November 17, 2015 – Newport Waterfront Events, a division of Waterfront Productions LLC, announces that although the Newport Skating Center fundraising campaign has yet to completely meet its goal there is enough confidence that additional funds will be received over the next few weeks to move forward with the return of the rink to its former downtown location at the Newport Yachting Center this upcoming winter season.  Michele Maker Palmieri, President and CEO of Waterfront Productions, the parent company of Newport Waterfront Events, reports that the generous response over the last month by the corporate community and individuals is truly inspiring, led by new presenting sponsor ALEX AND ANI.  Historically, Newport Waterfront Events has needed to sell a minimum of $150,000 in sponsorships to finance the rink’s operation and maintenance over a full winter season.

“ALEX AND ANI, all our other corporate sponsors, local organizations and individuals really came through to save the Skating Center and we are looking forward to celebrating with the entire community at the rink’s grand opening and tree lighting ceremony on Friday, December 11th,” said Palmieri.  “In the meantime, there is still more work to be done as we are at 93% of our fundraising goal with more sponsorship and partnership opportunities available, including dasher board signage.”  Palmieri added that a crowd sourcing campaign set up so the community can pledge funds via a link to Indiegogo.com on the skatenewport.com website is scheduled to end this Thursday, November 19th but will stay up and keep accepting donations.

“ALEX AND ANI is a company dedicated to its customers, its employees and its communities,” said Carolyn Rafaelian, Founder, Creative Director & CEO of ALEX AND ANI.  “When there is an opportunity that creates a central place for people to enjoy our beautiful state, we are excited to commit our time and resources to the community to create unity for all to enjoy.”

Additional corporate sponsorships that have been secured to date for the Newport Skating Center presented by ALEX AND ANI include: Stop & Shop, Cox, People’s Credit Union, Viti Auto Group, Amica Insurance, Haven Brothers Concessions Food Truck, Discover Newport, Rob Levine & Associates, KVH, Think Thin, NAVSTA Newport Homes, BankNewport, Hyatt Regency Newport, AquaBall, Cumulus Media, William “Mr. Bill” Medeiros, Cappys Hillside Café, What’s Up Newp, Island Skating Academy, Peregrine Group/Scott’s Wharf, LLC, and Newport Harbor Corporation/Newport Restaurant Group,

Plans are to have a full schedule of activities this winter at the rink, including Family Fun Nights, Skates with Santa, Learn to Skate camp, community partnerships with non-profit groups including the Boys & Girls Club and the Martin Luther King Jr. Community Center and, of course, the grand opening and traditional tree lighting ceremony in early December.  In another exciting development, Haven Brothers Concessions Food Truck will handle the on-site concessions at the rink this season.  The Rhode Island icon has been serving Rhode Islanders from it downtown Providence location since 1893, making it the oldest diner on wheels.

The rink failed to open last winter due to the sale of the Newport Yachting Center by Newport Harbor Corporation to Scott’s Wharf.  In the spirit of cooperation, the Newport Harbor Corporation has agreed to donate the skating rink equipment and assets to Newport Waterfront Events while Scott’s Wharf is providing the Newport Skating Center’s former space at the Newport Yachting Center for the coming skating season.  Palmieri said she cannot guarantee that the Newport Yachting Center location will be a long-term solution for the rink but said it is a first step towards the goal of realizing a permanent home for the Newport Skating Center.

The Newport Skating Center, which first opened in 2000, features a 9,000 square foot skating surface large enough to accommodate up to 100 skaters at a time.  Skate rentals, hot beverages, comfort foods, lighting for night skating, regular admission discounts, FREE parking and viewing spaces for the public are also featured at the rink.

Waterfront Productions LLC, headquartered in Newport, Rhode Island, specializes in event management/production and venue operation and is the parent company of Newport Waterfront Events and Rhode Island Waterfront Events.  The events Waterfront Productions owns and manages include the Great Chowder Cook-Off at Fort Adams in Newport, Rhode Island and the Waterfront Reggae Festival and the International Oktoberfest at India Point Park in Providence, Rhode Island.  The Waterfront Productions team has co-produced a variety of other events, including the Newport Comedy Series, the WBRU Concert Series at Providence Piers, the Food Truck Festival, the Newport International Boat Show and the Newport Charter Yacht Show, and offers event management consulting services.

For more information on the Newport Skating Center and sponsorship and donation opportunities please visit skatenewport.com, or contact Michele Maker Palmieri, President and CEO of Waterfront Productions LLC via email at mmaker@newportwaterfrontevents.com or call (888) 900-8640, Ext. 709.  Those interested can also “like us” at facebook.com/skatenewport.  Also follow newportevents on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

story:
"The willingness with which our young people are likely to serve in any war, no matter how justified, shall be directly proportional to how they perceive the Veterans of earlier wars were treated and appreciated by their nation."

-President George Washington, Veteran

What You Need To Know

There are 21.8 million veterans in America.  There are tens of thousands of civilian resources, programs and benefits available exclusively to veterans at little or no cost and yet less than half of veterans ever use a single resource that's available to them.  That means they're missing out on services that can benefit them personally, professionally, financially and emotionally.  I've benefitted  of a free 5-day healing retreat, a free 1-Year LinkedIn Premium Job Seeker ($390 Value), a free Annual Pass to National Parks ($80 Value), and free mentoring, career counseling and networking opportunities.  DropZone's mission is to ensure that ALL veterans benefit.    

What Is DropZone And How Does It Work? 

                                                  

DropZone is a location based mobile app that presents veterans with relevant civilian resources, programs and benefits in their area, all of which have been rated and reviewed by fellow veterans.  The resources are presented one at a time with a one sentence summary of what the resource is, does or offers.  If the user is not interested they swipe left.  If they are interested they swipe right and get more information, real time veteran's reviews and the resource contact information. 

Can I See DropZone In Action?

I thought you'd never ask.  DropZone is presented from 1:00-1:03  https://babson.hosted.panopto.com/Panopto/Pages/Viewer.aspx?id=9d4bc3d0-76e0-484c-98ee-e3d242ac5f5a

Who Is Behind DropZone?

Courtney Wilson, former Army Engineer Captain, Combat Veteran and Bronze Star Medal Recipient.  I've been featured in the New York Times, CNN and NPR for my experience as a female in Afghanistan.  I have my Master's in Management and Leadership and am currently getting my MBA at Babson College in MA.  When I got out of the military, I realized that there was not currently a quick, simple way to find out what civilian resources, benefits and programs were available to veterans.  Fortunately, the Army taught me never to complain about something without proposing a solution as well, and so, I created DropZone.  

  


Is DropZone Really As Awesome As It Seems?

Yup.  Less than a month after it was created, DropZone placed 3rd at a Hackathon at Facebook:  https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/dropzone-places-3rd-vets-tech-hackathon-facebook-courtney-wilson


How Can I Help? 

  • Donate.  75% of all crowd funding campaigns that reach 30% of their fundraising goal within the first week end up achieving full funding.  Even small amounts like $5 make a difference.    
  • Spread the word.  Sharing the link on social media is helpful and it would be great if you did that.  Sending it directly to three people you know would be even better.  Since contributors who visit a campaign page from a link in an email tend to give 20% more than contributors sent by any other referral source, so that personal endorsement goes a long way.  
  • E-mail me with suggested resources, people to talk to, product tips, etc.  I welcome any and all help: Courtney@DropZoneForVeterans.com 
  • Do something nice for a veteran.  Bonus points if you send me pictures of you two together.  


Where Is My Money Going?

Your money will go directly to hiring a developer to finalize the prototype so the company can conduct beta testing and targeted market testing.  


What's In It For Me?

  • You get to smoke an Officer.  (For non-military folks, that means you get to make me work out, very, very hard)  On December 13, after all the donations are in, I will do a push up for every civilian who donated, a pull up for every veteran who donated, and I'll run a mile for every individual donation over $500, veteran or not.  Whoever donates the highest individual amount gets to pick what service's shirt I wear while doing all this.  (My dad is a Marine, so Army folks, you better step up!)     
  • Wall of Honor-Donate in honor or memory of a loved one
  • Customized DropZone Dog Tags 
  • Products from Veteran Owned Businesses
  • Personal Training Consultations from me  (Certified Personal trainer, CrossFit Level 1 Trainer, Owner of Bronze Star Fitness) 
  • Exclusive Advertising Spots


I Don't Have Money-Can I Still Help?

Absolutely.

  • Send the campaign link directly to five people you know.  Explain to them why DropZone needs their support.  Remember, contributors who visit a campaign page from a link in an e-mail tend to give 20% more than contributors sent by any other referral source.  
  • Do something nice for a veteran.  Bonus points if you send me pictures of you two together. 


Why Is The Campaign Ending December 12?

Because that's when Army is going to beat Navy.  Duh.

I thought you'd never ask.  DropZone is presented from 1:00-1:03  https://babson.hosted.panopto.com/Panopto/Pages/Viewer.aspx?id=9d4bc3d0-76e0-484c-98ee-e3d242ac5f5a


Who Is Behind DropZone?
Courtney Wilson, former Army Engineer Captain, Combat Veteran and Bronze Star Medal Recipient.  I've been featured in the New York Times, CNN and NPR for my experience as a female in Afghanistan.  I have my Master's in Management and Leadership and am currently getting my MBA at Babson College in MA.  When I got out of the military, I realized that there was not currently a quick, simple way to find out what civilian resources, benefits and programs were available to veterans.  Fortunately, the Army taught me never to complain about something without proposing a solution as well, and so, I created DropZone.  

  

Is DropZone Really As Awesome As It Seems?

Yup.  Less than a month after it was created, DropZone placed 3rd at a Hackathon at Facebook:  https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/dropzone-places-3rd-vets-tech-hackathon-facebook-courtney-wilson


How Can I Help? 


Donate.  75% of all crowd funding campaigns that reach 30% of their fundraising goal within the first week end up achieving full funding.  Even small amounts like $5 make a difference.    
Spread the word.  Sharing the link on social media is helpful and it would be great if you did that.  Sending it directly to three people you know would be even better.  Since contributors who visit a campaign page from a link in an email tend to give 20% more than contributors sent by any other referral source, so that personal endorsement goes a long way.  
E-mail me with suggested resources, people to talk to, product tips, etc.  I welcome any and all help: Courtney@DropZoneForVeterans.com 
Do something nice for a veteran.  Bonus points if you send me pictures of you two together.  

Where Is My Money Going?
Your money will go directly to hiring a developer to finalize the prototype so the company can conduct beta testing and targeted market testing.  

What's In It For Me?
  You get to smoke an Officer.  (For non-military folks, that means you get to make me work out, very, very hard)  On December 13, after all the donations are in, I will do a push up for every civilian who donated, a pull up for every veteran who donated, and I'll run a mile for every individual donation over $500, veteran or not.  Whoever donates the highest individual amount gets to pick what service's shirt I wear while doing all this.  (My dad is a Marine, so Army folks, you better step up!)     



Wall of Honor-Donate in honor or memory of a loved one
Customized DropZone Dog Tags 
Products from Veteran Owned Businesses
Personal Training Consultations from me  (Certified Personal trainer, CrossFit Level 1 Trainer, Owner of Bronze Star Fitness) 
Exclusive Advertising Spots    

I Don't Have Money-Can I Still Help?

Absolutely.

Send the campaign link directly to five people you know.  Explain to them why DropZone needs their support.  Remember, contributors who visit a campaign page from a link in an e-mail tend to give 20% more than contributors sent by any other referral source.  
Do something nice for a veteran.  Bonus points if you send me pictures of you two together. 


Why Is The Campaign Ending December 12?
Because that's when Army is going to beat Navy.  Duh.

story:
We want you to be part of the future and help us to produce the best cooking programs.  

Simply Good Food TV was created to show great cooking programmes. To do this, we need your help by becoming  a digital commissioner  Being a digital commissioner will allow you to be part of the team that decides what programs we make, each month for the next 12 months you will decide what we film.  You get to be the first to see new programs and exclusive content before anyone else

We are launching this funding campaign so that we can generate further income to develop and invest in new shows and to develop the app and add it to TV's so it is available on the big screen as well as tablet and mobile. The Simply Good Food TV team are all passionate foodies who want to encourage more people to cook at home, with wonderful ingredients from our foodie friends (online food market) and offer a platform for new and existing chefs to have a voice. 

There is so much talent out there, we are offering the food equivalent of Netflix. We are looking to create a minimum of 20% new content on the app, giving the 20 plus chefs we have a place to show it and share it. Giving our audience great new content and inspiring them to get into their kitchens.

See the app now CLICK HERE FOR APPLE and CLICK HERE FOR ANDROID


What We Need & What You Get

We wanted to offer something fun for your investment.  Life is all about experiences and having fun along the way. So we have created the following: 

Digital Commissioner

Digital Commissioner - be part of the future of food TV and get to decide what types of cooking programs we should be making. You will be part of an exclusive forum who will be asked to make decisions on what you would like to see in the future of cooking TV. We are looking for people from all over the world to be part of this. £25.00 for a years commissioner role. 

Executive Producer

Executive Producer - spend the day behind the scenes you will get to direct one of the episodes with one of the Simply Good Food TV chefs. The day will include lunch, a bag full of goodies including signed books from the Simply Good Food TV chefs, and the opportunity to chat cooking and pick up advice and tips. £250.00 

The Ultimate Dinner Party

The Ultimate Dinner Party - this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of this flagship programme. The series will see chefs and foodies go head to head cooking to win you over as they compete for dinner party chef. The added twist to this is that you as the guest  can bring a mystery ingredient that the chef/ foodie will have to try and include. The decision will be in the hands of the guest diners as to who wins the title. You are in for a great foodie experience for the day. You will be part of the show, get to see behind the scenes, and have the opportunity to chat to the chefs and foodies about your cooking questions. £125 

The Impact 

We are looking for funding for the development of the app to make it more efficient, quicker and easier to add content to. We are also looking to make it TV ready, so like Netflix you can have it on any device in your house. We are building Simply Good Food TV as a trusted brand and a household name, this funding will enable us to create that through increased marketing and PR and the technical behind the scenes elements. 

Risks & Challenges 

We launched the app in May 2015 with a very small and limited budget, and since then we have achieved a great deal, we have over 17,000 active users we have 20 new chefs including Will Torrent and Mich Turner we have filmed 30 programs and gained sponsorship from Renault and Filippo Berio. We can't wait to do so much more with a bigger budget. The app is so important to so many people. With the foodies and chefs it gives them a platform to have a voice and be seen giving them the opportunity to earn a living doing what they love. It offers small producers the opportunity to chat to the consumers direct and for the big brands they can create great new content for their customers. All in all lots of happy foodies. We look forward to you being part of this foodie journey. 

www.simplygoodfood.tv

story:
planting little roots in sonora, california

We are a small, brick and mortar storefront coming to downtown Sonora in spring of 2016. Help us to grow strong roots in our community by making a donation and receiving a gift certificate of equal value. Choose an offering amount on the righthand side, or enter your own. You'll receive your gift certificate via email within 24 hours. You can follow along with the construction & the story on both Facebook and Instagram.


what sort of toys will you carry?

We will be proud to offer earthen, handmade goods, crafted by members of both our community, and small communities around the world. The quality and compassionate sourcing of our products are both incredibly important to Little Roots. As a small business, we love to support other creators & crafters no matter how small. 


what will the funding support?

Primarily, stocking the shelves! 100% of all funds raised will be used for opening the shop & filling it with toys. Plus, the shop gnomes don't build toys for free!


if something falls through, will i be refunded?

Absolutely! If for any reason the storefront doesn't come to be, your offering will be immediately refunded.


what if i don't live locally, but want to support you? 

That's wonderful! We are grateful for your support. We can give your gift certificate to a local children's charity. Just write a quick note alongside your contribution.

We are so very grateful for you, our community! We can't wait to join the Washington Street family.
