story:
Help Marine, Air Force Veterans preserve historic property, launch winery

Hi, we are Andrew and Adelle Minerich.  We are asking for help to preserve a historic property and launch a winery in Beavercreek, OH.  We fell in love with this property and want to restore it. Then, we will create a winery and venue rental business that will sustain the property for years to come.  This business will become a valuable member of the community, hosting events, donating to charitable causes, and preserving the history of Beavercreek Township.

*All contributions $50 and above get vouchers for free wine (see under perks)!*

The property:

The 7-acre site includes a unique historical building, built in 1810 (http://beavercreekhistoricalsociety.org/wordpress/the-old-stage-coach-inn-beavercreek-ohio/). It was part of the Underground Railroad and still has a hidden door in the kitchen, leading to hiding spaces under the front porch.  Abraham Lincoln may have stayed here during his presidential campaign.  It was also used as a Beavercreek high school in the late 19th century.  As part of our business, we will hire a historian to better research this property.

This is a beautiful property. The home was well-cared for by the owners, but it has sat vacant and is need of some updates and restoration.  We want to bring back that old Ohio feel.  The barn needs a bit more work to restore it, but, is large and will provide an excellent venue for rental.  The 7-acre site has plenty of space and can accommodate an additional building for wine-making, as well as some vines, a water feature, parking, and numerous seating areas.

The business:

We plan to launch a winery and venue rental business at this site, once restorations are complete.  Some vines will be grown on site, but, the majority of grapes will be sourced from other vineyards (Ohio, California, Washington, Oregon).  The wine-making would take place in a new steel building; this will allow us to turn the barn and Inn into tasting rooms and venue rental. In addition, we will rent out the buildings and property for weddings, parties, and other events.  We will also host community events, small concerts, food trucks, and a host of other fun happenings. We want this to be a gathering place for Beavercreek and the surrounding areas!

Other community events may include festivals, concert series, bring your dog nights, outdoor movies, charity fundraisers, 5Ks, vendor shows, etc. We also welcome your ideas!

We will have both the tasting room (home) and barn available for rental.  There will also be a gazebo and open spaces available.  It will be the perfect location for corporate functions, birthday parties, and even weddings!  We will partner with local caterers and rental companies to offer anything you may need.

At this time, we do not plan to offer more than appetizers. We will encourage our customers to have food delivered by local restaurants or purchase food from food trucks that we will invite to our site.

We have been making homemade wine and we have two renowned winery consultants that have agreed to work with us to ensure that we produce excellent wines.  I am also pursuing a Certified Specialist in Wine (CSW) certification.  We plan to offer traditional red and white varieties of wine, as well as fruit wines (our green apple Riesling and blackberry Pinot Noir are excellent!).  We also have years of experience drinking wine, as well as friends and family dedicated to making this happen!

As for other Ohio wineries, there are a handful within Southwest Ohio, but none within the Dayton metro area.

About us:

Hailing from Everett, WA, Andrew served 9 years in the United States Marine Corps as a Russian Linguist and Intelligence Analyst.   He was stationed in California, Hawaii, and Texas, as well as serving overseas in Iraq, Japan, and at sea.  He is currently an Ohio Certified Public Accountant, Certified Management Accountant, and graduated with an MBA from St. Mary’s University in San Antonio, TX.  He has worked as an auditor, financial analyst with a Fortune 500 company, controller of a small company, and is currently a Department of the Air Force civilian on Wright-Patterson AFB. (No US Government endorsement is implied!)               

Adelle was born and raised in Northwest Ohio (Holgate / Napoleon area).  After graduating from the Medical College of Ohio / University of Toledo with a BS in Nursing, she joined the United States Air Force.  She served 7 years as a Labor & Delivery Nurse in San Antonio and Wright-Patterson AFB, leaving active duty as a Captain.  She currently teaches clinical education for Sinclair Community College and is a senior Trunk Keeper for Matilda Jane Clothing (https://www.facebook.com/groups/adellemj/). 

Above all else, we are blessed to be the proud parents of Layla (5), Julia (4), and Lucas (2).  Since 2017, we have also fostered a wonderful little boy (18 months).  We are fortunate to have these 4 beautiful children in our home. We are passionate about adoption/foster care and children-related charities.  To that end, we intend to donate a portion our of gross sales to our selected charities that support these causes.  We also plan on hosting charitable events, with or without serving alcohol, each month. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

We need to raise sufficient funding for equipment, legal/acquisition costs, and operating loans.  We have our own life savings going into this, but, we need more!

What you get:

  • Our gratitude!
  • Vouchers for free wine:
    • $50 - $99:  1 voucher for a free bottle of wine
    • $100 - $999: 3 vouchers for a free bottle of wine
    • $1,000 - $4,999: 1 voucher for a free case of wine
    • $5,000 - $24,999: 2 vouchers for a free case of wine
    • $25,000 and above: 5 vouchers for a free case of wine
    • All vouchers must be claimed in person or via a shipping service that can verify the age of the recipient.
  • All contributors at $100 and above become members of our Founders' Club, which will give you discounts on wine club membership, wine, venue rental, and invites to exclusive events.
  • All contributors at $1,000 and above will be invited to our pre-grand opening event, with catering, wine tasting, and exclusive gifts!
  • All contributors at $5,000 and above will be invited to take part in pre-release tasting panels. You can help us choose and refine our wines!
  • In addition to our gratitude, you can get some cool swag!
  • You can also have a brick (or two) engraved with your name, favorite cause or whatever you would like installed at our winery! We will install a brick pathway on the property and you can have your name placed there forever!
  • Want a table with your name on it? You can also have your name immortalized on one of the various benches, seating areas, and tables that will be placed throughout the property for seating. 
  • Do you have $25,000 just lying about? And, have you always wanted to name a wine? Well, you're in luck! We can solve both of those problems by gratefully accepting that contribution and letting you name one of our wines.
  • If you are very passionate about this project, you can have our planned gazebo or wine-making facility dedicated in your name!

Risks & Challenges

There are risks in any business venture, but, our combined experience in sales, marketing, accounting, and financial management have equipped us with the necessary skills to effectively manage this business.  We will utilize the skills of our winery consultants to create a great wine.

The most significant risk is that we will be unable to complete the purchase of the property due to financing, inspections, or unforeseen costs.  Should this occur, we are still dedicated to building a winery, though, it would have to be in a different location, perhaps without this rich history. Next, we will have to secure zoning permits and liquor licenses, which can take several months.  Developing excellent wine takes time and money.  Our life savings are invested in this business and we will do everything that we can to make this business a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with family, friends, and wine drinkers!

And that's all there is to it.

This is not an equity offering; no stake in ownership is being sold. If you have any questions, please emails us at creekwineryandrentals@gmail.com.

story:
FREE RANGE MINI GOLF

Free Range will be more than the typical roadside family fun center. We’ll offer miniature golf, an arcade, an indoor playground, three party rooms and generous seating to gather while kids play. In a beautiful, well thought out setting, Free Range will have a unique and locally-influenced approach: 


• Play experiences and décor featuring local artists
• Partnerships with local food trucks and food purveyors       
• Local craft beer, wine and non-alcoholic beverages
• Wifi will be available for folks that need to catch up on work or email
• Hosting community and non-profit events
• Free Range Fun for everyone

 

THE BACKSTORY

We met almost 20 years ago in California while working for the same company. After becoming a couple, we spent many summers in Kelly's hometown of Upstate New York and our favorite place to go was a charming family entertainment center that drew crowds daily from miles away. It was then that we realized how unique their concept was and how much enjoyment it brought to the community.

We chose Petaluma, close to Jeff's hometown, to start our family and as our son grew we realized how often we had to travel for amusement and how much Petaluma would benefit from a family fun center. Recreating the relaxed yet sophisticated vibe of the center that Kelly grew up with while adding our own spin was the goal when we began the search for a great spot.  Luck was on our side when the perfect location also happened to have the proper zoning for Free Range to work. 

Now, we’re close to turning Free Range Mini Golf into reality.  We have 90% of our starting budget funded and we are hoping the community can help get us over the finish line. We want to open our doors this Summer - 2019.   

 

 

SO WHAT'S THIS CAMPAIGN ALL ABOUT?

So, here's the thing: it's not easy to get this type of business off the ground (did you know that there are 6 different types of engineers?). In addition to refining our concept, creating the business plan, securing a location and all the associated permits, we've also spent the better part of this past year and a half raising funds to make Free Range the best it can be.  

This project is going to bring great things to the community and we are looking to the community to help us with the final push to bring it to life. Every dollar counts and any support you can provide is greatly appreciated. 

After our goal is reached any additional funds raised will be used to create interactive art projects. So, Tee it high and let it fly!

 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

We have put together several rewards packages to thank you for helping us make Free Range Mini Golf a reality. 

How do you claim one of the rewards listed?

1. Click on the reward(s) of your choice.

2. Please share. Share our project with all your friends, family and anyone who you think might be interested in supporting a big idea like this. $160k is a lot of money, but with many small donations...well, you know the drill.

3. Patiently await your rewards, which if all goes well will be available June, 2019.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
FREE RANGE MINI GOLF
Free Range will be more than the typical roadside family fun center. We’ll offer miniature golf, an arcade, an indoor playground, three party rooms and generous seating to gather while kids play. In a beautiful, well thought out setting, Free Range will have a unique and locally-influenced approach: 
• Play experiences and décor featuring local artists• Partnerships with local food trucks and food purveyors       • Local craft beer, wine and non-alcoholic beverages• Wifi will be available for folks that need to catch up on work or email• Hosting community and non-profit events• Free Range Fun for everyone

 
THE BACKSTORY
We met almost 20 years ago in California while working for the same company. After becoming a couple, we spent many summers in Kelly's hometown of Upstate New York and our favorite place to go was a charming family entertainment center that drew crowds daily from miles away. It was then that we realized how unique their concept was and how much enjoyment it brought to the community.
We chose Petaluma, close to Jeff's hometown, to start our family and as our son grew we realized how often we had to travel for amusement and how much Petaluma would benefit from a family fun center. Recreating the relaxed yet sophisticated vibe of the center that Kelly grew up with while adding our own spin was the goal when we began the search for a great spot.  Luck was on our side when the perfect location also happened to have the proper zoning for Free Range to work. 

Now, we’re close to turning Free Range Mini Golf into reality.  We have 90% of our starting budget funded and we are hoping the community can help get us over the finish line. We want to open our doors this Summer - 2019.   
 

 
SO WHAT'S THIS CAMPAIGN ALL ABOUT?
So, here's the thing: it's not easy to get this type of business off the ground (did you know that there are 6 different types of engineers?). In addition to refining our concept, creating the business plan, securing a location and all the associated permits, we've also spent the better part of this past year and a half raising funds to make Free Range the best it can be.  
This project is going to bring great things to the community and we are looking to the community to help us with the final push to bring it to life. Every dollar counts and any support you can provide is greatly appreciated. 
After our goal is reached any additional funds raised will be used to create interactive art projects. So, Tee it high and let it fly!

 
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
We have put together several rewards packages to thank you for helping us make Free Range Mini Golf a reality. 
How do you claim one of the rewards listed?
1. Click on the reward(s) of your choice.
2. Please share. Share our project with all your friends, family and anyone who you think might be interested in supporting a big idea like this. $160k is a lot of money, but with many small donations...well, you know the drill.
3. Patiently await your rewards, which if all goes well will be available June, 2019.
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is The Collab Spot?

The Collab Spot is Richmond’s new coworking space and social justice community hub. 

We are comprised of Black-centered organizations that are committed to racial justice and community through the provision of safe coworking and meeting space, resources, integrative wellness services, and community events. 

The first step is done: we’ve secured a space in Richmond’s Northside community. 

But the work is far from over. 

What We Need From You

Our building’s base rent (before utilities, insurance, and taxes) is $5,000. 

Most small businesses fail due to overhead, and we are committed to pushing through this hurdle, but we need your help. 

Our goal of raising $80,000 is to get us through the winter safely, and open our doors FULLY for coworking and events in the spring. This accounts for: 

  • Overhead for the building
  • Space renovation
  • Customizing for accessibility
  • Technology for community use
  • Offset of Indiegogo’s platform costs

Starting in early 2021, we will begin renting out office space to individual organizations that are aligned with our values. Due to COVID-19 we will be holding only virtual and small,  limited-capacity & socially-distanced events. We plan to open our coworking space when it is safe to do so, we are aiming for the spring of 2021 but will follow CDC, state, and local recommendations. 

While we’re excited to hit the ground running in ways that are safe and accessible, the pandemic creates real barriers for our sustainability. 

The Impact of a Black Centered Space in Richmond 

What A Successful Campaign Will Mean For Richmond

How many places can you name in Richmond that provide open, safe, and accessible space for Black and Queer folks to hang out? 

What about spaces that have reasonable pricing for event and office rentals? 

Or, coworking spaces run by and focused on the Black community offering reasonable rates?

Where can you find a variety of Black owned products in one central location, consistently? 

Yeah, we had a hard time creating a list too. 

For so long, we dreamed of curating a space for fellowship and to aid our community orgs and small businesses in their goals. We finally have that chance to realize those dreams, but we can only do it with your help!

Efforts and programming that your contribution will support: 

  • Safe and accessible space for QTPOC/BIPOC coworking and community
  • Social justice focused programming
  • Community resourcing needs
  • Black community centered social events
  • Writing workshops
  • Community gardening
  • Accessible arts & craft events
  • QTPOC music events
  • Community childcare
  • Collaborative mutual aid

And much more!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that funds may be a little tight right now. That doesn’t mean you can’t help! 

  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • Share our posts with your friends, and tell them how important a Black-centered community hub will be to Richmond! 
  • Sign up for our newsletter! 

A little about the partners: 

Taneasha & Brooke will serve as Co-Directors of Collaboration with TCS. Collectively, they have over 20 years of nonprofit and community-based experience. They will work together to manage the coworking and retail space, build community collaborations and programming, and oversee the needs of the building and tenants. They’ve seen firsthand the dire need for dedicated space for marginalized community members. 

Taneasha is the founder of UnSung Literary Magazine,  a flash fiction and poetry publication focused on offering artistic space for marginalized voices, and has a bevy of bylines from varied publications under her belt in addition to communications and organizing work, and has used her role within both literary and organizational spaces to make room for community. She is going to lead TCS’s internal and external communications, and is available to help collaborating and allied partners with theirs! 

Brooke is the founder of Catalysts for Change Consulting, a firm dedicated to providing innovative consultation for business professionals. They are passionate about facilitation and have extensive experience in varied settings, ranging from organizational strategic planning to higher education. Brooke will be leading the cultivation of partnerships and event facilitation. 

Korantema & Abena make up ConjureWorks, which has provided integrative health and wellness services to the DMV communities and parts of Ghana West Africa for over 25 years. They are a multidimensional wellness practice offering evidence-based mindfulness facilitation, wellness coaching, personalized consultation and individualized trainings.

story:
Hello, my name is Tristina, and I was born & raised in Easton, PA. I’m a Northampton Community College and Penn State grad. I’m a very hard worker. I’ve worked in healthcare most of my life, most recently in reproductive healthcare. Through my work in reproductive healthcare, I met so many different women. I would always find myself saying, “How you’re feeling is so common. We just never get to have these conversations.” I want to make those conversations more common, more affirming, and safe. I want to continue to be of help to the women in my community in a space where they can get the information they need, and perhaps from resources that aren’t easily found.

    My campaign is an effort to raise money to open a Black bookstore that centers the needs of Black women and women of color. By centering the most marginalized, the needs of everyone are addressed. Bliggity is built on a foundation of Reproductive Justice and Ethical Capitalism.

    According to SisterSong, Reproductive Justice is the theory that people have the human right " to maintain bodily autonomy, to have or not have children, and parent the children we have in sustainable communities". Goals of Bliggity, which are written into our business plan is to pay all employees a livable wage, use modified scheduling (ie. scheduling around school schedules, working from home) to maintain day-to-day operations, and create policies which respect the lived experiences of staff and customers.

    Ethical Capitalism is a framework in which Bliggity is also based. "Ethical Capitalism has at least two essential ingredients: A focus on creating long-term economic & social value, and a commitment by business to act as stewards of the full spectrum of its customers, employees, suppliers, investors and society. Ethical Capitalism seeks to build deep, trust-based relationships in the service of society as well as the bottom line. In other words, it is a business model with a 'higher purpose.' " (Huffington Post, 2014)
    Bliggity will contribute a percentage of monthly revenue to such organizations at The Free Black Woman's Library which is "an interactive Black Feminist mobile trading library and interactive biblio installation that features a collection of 2000 books written by Black women. The library is committed to centering and celebrating the voices of Black Women in literature."

    Contributors to this campaign will help our whole community. Representation matters in society, and the local business community should be representative of the demographics of the city. Many Black people and people of color miss out on great local businesses, and the local business community misses out on revenue and feedback because residents don’t feel as though the area is for them. An increase in Black-owned businesses shows all residents that the community belongs to everyone.

    I am seeking $25,000 to lease a retail space in Downtown Easton, create a beautiful, workable environment that functions well for patrons, and purchase a point of sale system. Independent bookstores are showing record turnarounds in sales and support compared to just 10 years ago. I am hoping to fund this project using crowdfunding as many others have done. I am asking my community to support me in my efforts to be a Black woman-owned bookstore.

    In return for your investment in Bliggity, I am offering a variety of perks and packages ranging from $10 to $500. Please choose what makes you most comfortable.

    In the event that the entire goal is not met, all funds raised will be put toward completing an online Bliggity bookstore.

    Bliggity will be a space for everyone to enjoy. That is one of the reasons why I feel it is important that I find a retail space in Downtown Easton. I would like to make the store easily accessible for as many people as possible. The Downtown area is walkable, has easy access to public transportation, and plenty of parking. The space will feature work by Black writers and writers of color. I want to provide feature sections that uplift Black scientists, thriller writers, LGBTQ+ writers, etc.

    There are several Black bookstores all across the United States, but none within a 50 mile radius of the Lehigh Valley. Marc Lamont Hill opened a Black bookstore in Philadelphia in November 2017. The Lit Bar of Bronx, NY and Source of Knowledge Book Store of Newark, NJ are two more examples of successful Black bookstores. All of these stores have received tremendous support from and have been a great resource for their communities. La Casa Azul Bookstore in East Harlem, NY was able to raise $35,000 in just 40 days using this very platform in order to open their first store in 2012.

    According to the Small Business Administration, most new businesses fail in the first year. I have a SCORE Mentor through Lehigh Valley SCORE. I’ve already been in contact with the Easton Main Street Initiative, and I joined the Easton Business Association. I have also taken courses available through the SBDC at Lehigh University. I’m confident in my abilities to help my business succeed and grow, and I know who to reach out to for help if I need it.

    As a director in a healthcare facility I learned that diversifying income streams is essential to the success of businesses. Bliggity will be a bookstore, and we will also have apparel and jewelry for sale, handmade crafts; and select teas and tea accessories. Once per month we will have an open mic night where readers can read from their favorite books. And with being in such a college rich area, I’m hoping that we can host visiting creatives of color.
     

    If you can’t spare any money, I completely understand. Please share my Indiegogo page and/or like & share from our Facebook and Instagram pages. Thank you so much for all of your support- Tristina

La Casa Azul Bookstore in East Harlem, NY was able to raise $35,000 in just 40 days using this very platform in order to open their first store in 2012.

I’m confident in my abilities to help my business succeed and grow, and I know who to reach out to for help if I need it.
As a director in a healthcare facility I learned that diversifying income streams is essential to the success of businesses. Bliggity will be a bookstore, and we will also have apparel and jewelry for sale, handmade crafts; and select teas and tea accessories. Once per month we will have an open mic night where readers can read from their favorite books. And with being in such a college rich area, I’m hoping that we can host visiting creatives of color.

story:
Jungle House Story

Hello! We're Rachel and Jhami Guffey.  We own Jungle House, 924 Delaware Street, in Lawrence, Kansas. 

Jungle House was born out of our two greatest passions in life: running a small business and growing houseplants. We started with a vision: to build a special place for our community. Our door are open to anyone who wants to learn about growing, pick up plants for their space, or a relaxing green space where they can hang out and enjoy "Lawrence's cleanest air." 

Turns out, the community has embraced us much more quickly than we anticipated and now we need more space for plants and to host workshops and special events.

But we’re in luck! Our current shop has an unfinished back room that we would like to remodel- we just need some SEED money to help build our additional room.

We're asking for $12,000 to help us remodel. You'll get rewards and prizes based on donations, so check out that list below! And most of all, you’ll help make this community space even better for anyone who comes through our doors.

Please share this campaign to help us spread the word. 

Thank you!
-The Jungle House Family

story:
Short Summary

  • Owner - Cayla Broughton, Senior Accountant at an American energy company based in Tulsa, OK. I received my Bachelors in Business Administration with a concentration in Accounting from Langston University and a Masters in Business Administration from Northeastern State University.
  • I've always loved the experience of getting pampered and my nails done with my girlfriends and family since the age of 15. When I moved to the Tulsa area, it was hard to find a consistent salon that valued its customers, maintained consistent and affordable pricing, and could duplicate the picture/example of what I brought to them for my nails. With Nails by Noelle, I want to create a space where anyone can come to get nails and waxing services all in one place while in a comfortable, relaxing, and fun environment.
  • Your contribution will help support our mission to provide high-quality customer, nails, and waxing services at affordable prices and convenient hours.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Due to high start-up costs, 40% of the total startup amount will be funded with contributions from the Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign, 28% with our business credit and the remaining 32% will be funded from a small business loan. Funding will be used on items such as the business location, salon equipment, supplies, inventory, insurance, building improvements, marketing, a POS system, signage, and a responsive website.
  • I am asking backers to give $10 or more if they are able to, if not anything is greatly appreciated! Some of the perks we have included with your contribution of $20 or more are a digital thank you, a loyalty card with your 1st purchase stamp included, a Nails by Noelle T-Shirt, and the opportunity to host your own salon party! With the digital thank you, we will personally shout you out on our social media and website pages, or of course, you can opt-out of a public shout out. The way our loyalty cards work is on your 11th visit, you can receive your services FREE after filling your card. Each space can be filled by purchasing $25 or more in services on each visit. The T-shirt is an exclusive Nails by Noelle T-Shirt with our logo on a black tee.  Lastly, you will get the opportunity to host your own private, salon party which includes mani/pedi services for up to 10 guests!
  • Don't fret, if we don't reach our campaign goal we will shift our ratio of mixed funding amounts (crowd-funding to small business loan to credit) as necessary, however, our ultimate goal is to exceed our crowdfunding goal and have to decrease the asking amount for our small business loan, or not even need a small business loan at all! 

 

The Impact

  • Our values are 1) Safety - by providing the safest products along with maintaining the best sanitary practices, 2) Quality - we provide top quality products, as well as employees who have gone through professional development and taken the time to continuously perfect their craft, 3) Service -  by providing not only quality customer service but unique services designed with our guests in mind, 4) Community - we plan to serve our community once established with volunteer days and complimentary services, and 5) Culture - Nails by Noelle is a whole vibe, y'all!
  • For measurement purposes, there are approximately 994,000 people in the Tulsa Metro area (this includes Broken Arrow, Owasso, Jenks, and other surrounding areas) based on the latest Census Reporter information available. Of the 994,000, 51% are women. Also, based on the 2017 "Black Women Business Startups Report" (https://www.kansascityfed.org/~/media/files/community/blackwomenbusinessesreport.pdf?la=en) which consisted of focus groups conducted by the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, "the growth rate of business ownership by black women has been faster than any other group in the nation." The report summarizes the startup motivation, challenges, support, and recommendations from black women business owners. An impactful takeaway from the study is that 6% of black women business owners utilized external financing to startup, of the amount of business financing received based on the amount requested - 40% received none of the amount requested, 37% received some of the amount requested, and 22% received all of the amount requested. Another thing to note for startup support, many black women business owners credit their friends and family, social network, and mentors as key individuals in their success. I truly believe THIS is how your contribution to the “Help Support Nails by Noelle LLC” campaign will make a difference, I thank you in advance for your support!  

 

Risks & Challenges

  • The major risk we will overcome is the lack of financing and funding available. By contributing to our campaign you will help us overcome this obstacle! You can also show your support once we are up and running, by becoming one of our loyal guests!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay! That doesn't mean you can't help, other ways you can help are:

  • By sharing our campaign link via FaceBook, Instagram, email, and text to friends and family.
  • You can also share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

The way our loyalty cards work is on your 11th visit, you can receive your services FREE after filling your card. Each space can be filled by purchasing $25 or more in services on each visit. The T-shirt is an exclusive Nails by Noelle T-Shirt with our logo on a black tee.  Lastly, you will get the opportunity to host your own private, salon party which includes mani/pedi services for up to 10 guests!
Don't fret, if we don't reach our campaign goal we will shift our ratio of mixed funding amounts (crowd-funding to small business loan to credit) as necessary, however, our ultimate goal is to exceed our crowdfunding goal and have to decrease the asking amount for our small business loan, or not even need a small business loan at all! 

 

The Impact

Our values are 1) Safety - by providing the safest products along with maintaining the best sanitary practices, 2) Quality - we provide top quality products, as well as employees who have gone through professional development and taken the time to continuously perfect their craft, 3) Service -  by providing not only quality customer service but unique services designed with our guests in mind, 4) Community - we plan to serve our community once established with volunteer days and complimentary services, and 5) Culture - Nails by Noelle is a whole vibe, y'all!
For measurement purposes, there are approximately 994,000 people in the Tulsa Metro area (this includes Broken Arrow, Owasso, Jenks, and other surrounding areas) based on the latest Census Reporter information available. Of the 994,000, 51% are women. Also, based on the 2017 "Black Women Business Startups Report" (https://www.kansascityfed.org/~/media/files/community/blackwomenbusinessesreport.pdf?la=en) which consisted of focus groups conducted by the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, "the growth rate of business ownership by black women has been faster than any other group in the nation." The report summarizes the startup motivation, challenges, support, and recommendations from black women business owners. An impactful takeaway from the study is that 6% of black women business owners utilized external financing to startup, of the amount of business financing received based on the amount requested - 40% received none of the amount requested, 37% received some of the amount requested, and 22% received all of the amount requested. Another thing to note for startup support, many black women business owners credit their friends and family, social network, and mentors as key individuals in their success. I truly believe THIS is how your contribution to the “Help Support Nails by Noelle LLC” campaign will make a difference, I thank you in advance for your support!  

 

Risks & Challenges
The major risk we will overcome is the lack of financing and funding available. By contributing to our campaign you will help us overcome this obstacle! You can also show your support once we are up and running, by becoming one of our loyal guests!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay! That doesn't mean you can't help, other ways you can help are:

By sharing our campaign link via FaceBook, Instagram, email, and text to friends and family.
You can also share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Cat Lady & Proud of it!!

I have had a long-term loving relationship with rescue cats.  I adopted my first rescue cat, Hannibal, not long after I moved to Phoenix in 1990.  Over the years since then, I have provided a loving home to a total of 11 cats.  I now have a kitty family of seven cats including one special needs kitty, Harley.

In 2017 I was gifted with a visit to Kit Tea Cat Café in San Francisco.  I came away thinking, “I could do that!  What a wonderful way to bring people and adoptable cats together!”

In 2019, I retired from my fulltime position to develop and launch Kitty Pause Kitty Café. 

What is Kitty Pause Kitty Café?

Kitty Pause will be a hub for cat-centered activities designed to create a sense of joyfulness for both the visitors and the cats.  It is planned as a cat and people friendly space where you can meet, play, and cuddle with the cats who reside at Kitty Pause while looking for their fur-ever homes.

Kitty Pause will be an adoption center for Saving One Life, our rescue partner.  You can get to know a potential new kitty member for your family in a great open setting. You also can engage in activities such as Yoga with Cats, Bingo with Cats and many more.

 

Come join the Kitty Pause family!  Let’s make it happen together!

COVID Created Circumstances. . .

Due to the COVID situation and the newness of cat cafes in the U.S. in general, it has been a challenge to obtain the funds needed to renovate and build out the space that I leased back in February for Kitty Pause in the Pavilions Shopping Center in Mesa, AZ. 

Where things stand. . .

I have obtained a commitment for a $75,000 SBA loan to help cover a portion of the renovation expenses that include construction of a needed wall to separate the cat lounge space from the welcome entry and boutique, furnishings for the lounge to include cat and people furniture, and outside signage for the suite.  The total estimated expenses to open Kitty Pause are $150,000. 

The SBA is requiring that I have the additional needed $75,000 to cover the balance of the renovations.  To date I have already invested $30,000 in startup expenses since February.  I plan to invest an additional $25,000 from my retirement funds to make Kitty Pause happen. 

My goal is to open in March 2021. For that to happen, I need to raise the additional $50,000.

That’s where you can help to make Kitty Pause a reality!

Join the Kitty Pause Kitty Krew by donating to the renovation fund!  Kitty Pause will be a great community resource and a hub for feline fun and activity.

Please share the campaign with friends and family who are also cat lovers.  Let’s grow a ground swell of support for Kitty Pause Kitty Café and raise the needed funds so we are ready to welcome you and your friends when you come to visit!

Check out the list of perks I am offering to thank you for your donation as you decide the amount of your donation.  A number of the items are from my personal art collection that I thought you might enjoy.

Thank you for sharing my vision for Kitty Pause Kitty Café, for spreading the word about the campaign and for helping to create of a wonderful space where you and your friends can come visit and play with friendly felines looking for fur-ever homes!

Check out the Kitty Pause Kitty Café website or join us on Facebook.

I am very grateful for your support as are the kitties who will make Kitty Pause their home while they await adoption.

Thank you!

Marsha

story:
The Comet Strikes Against COVID-19

As you already know, The Comet Pub and Lanes closed it’s doors on Monday, March 16th to protect you, our staff and the greater population from COVID-19. This was the most difficult decision we have ever made, but it is one that we felt was necessary for the common good, and to ensure our ability to eat, drink, bowl and laugh about it in the future at The Comet.

Since opening in July of 2016, we have felt blessed to be a part of the greater Decatur community, and we plan on being part of it for many years to come.   

We hope that this crisis is shortened to a minimum and that is why we are doing this.

Thank you for all of your support. 

ABOVE ALL…please stay healthy…listen to the experts and stay home. The welfare of our community is at stake.  Be well, and take care of each other (at a safe distance). It will take many more sacrifices by each of us to get to the end of this crisis safely.  We look forward to raising a glass at that time.

Thank you again.

Ethan, Uri and Ben

story:
One Food Hall To Rule Them All

We all love food. We all love choices. Fork Forty Food Hall is about to bring the best of both worlds to Downtown Salem (and we're not talking Hannah Montana):

  • 6 independent micro restaurants and a full bar, all under one roof
  • UNDER ONE ROOF - the food truck experience without the inconvenience
  • Eat, work and be inspired in a revitalized and redesigned historic building

You Can Get Our Back Without Greenbacks

We recognize it is gifting season and funds are tight. You can help us just as much without dipping into your stash:

  • Tell your family you only want Fork Forty perks for New Year's gifts!
  • Tell your friends to consider joining the fun by sharing this page (tools above)
  • Follow us on Instagram @forkfortyfoodhall and encourage others to do the same

Thanks for your time and consideration, we really appreciate you helping make this place the one-of-a-kind hang out destination that Salem deserves!

story:
Hello there Earthlinks!!

For years now I've been catering and teaching people about health and wellness, always structured and restricted. But now I think that it's time to break free. And I need your help.

Making dishes look similar to sight and taste similar (Vegan/Vegetarian) can be rather eventful and expense if using seasonal  veggies or fruit. I'm taking part of growing and producing farm to table or providing what's in season with each dish. 

I have specialties from Vegan Hotdogs. Spaghetti, Veggies Burgers, to Fried Avocado Kale Wraps, Soups, and Salads all homemade.

The goal is for next year is to bring to life Vegan / Vegetarian food because any people that stray away from it, says its nasty and untasteful. I believe that I can change your mind earth links! 

So help me to help others believe eating good can taste good. 

Bad Vegans, Good Vegans, Atliens, Earthlinks!!

story:
Ladle Facial Makeup

MISSION

Welcome, thank you to our community！

We are a social startup business to change the status quo and to let more marginalized women folk art craftsmen obtain income. We hope that the fossils art spread to all over the world and will enable them to pick up tools, will enable art to shining victory.

Basing on previous experience, we hope that by doing the Internet promotion, cultural exhibition, and the professional training of the artist to make China Shaanxi Ladle Facial Makeup craftsman to raise income. We hope that you and more people love and support of the folk artwork.

CURRENT SITUATION

Feel sad is that current Ladle Facial Makeup craftsman income is very low. Because of the lack of promotion and sales channels in the local, many marginalized women and the old craftsmen have no source of income, part of the craftsman has given up the inheritance of workmanship, and plow land to survive.

 

OUR PLANS

A good vintage car, if it did not have the opportunity to become the exhibits, If there is no favorite people to collect it, it will become a scrap iron. Also, we plan to let Ladle Facial Makeup shine brilliantly in our way. Setting up the Internet community interaction, cooperating with the restaurant to chain sales and opening city art exhibition will be able to let more people love and support it. We will help more marginalized women and the old craftsmen to obtain income. By establishing a production center and completing professional training, they will be reflected to advantage.

We will feel more confident, if you can become part of the story of our Ladle Facial Makeup.

 

 

 

Click Here to go back to the top to support us!

story:
I would like firstly to introduce myself and highlight some of the reasons i have taken the decision to stand for Carmarthenshire County Council.

I am hard working professional who has lived in Llanelli all his life. Troy is a loving father of 4 and has been married to his wife Bethany Tiencken for 7 years.

My recent work included being a supervisor at the charity bowling alley in Carmarthen (Xcel Bowl) which was greatly satisfying to me, as it included events for family's who had used the attached food bank who were invited to events at Christmas where they could bowl for free, food was provided free and Christmas presents given to the children in these family's.

I took the decision to stand for one of the county council seats in the Bigyn Ward of Llanelli as i feel the current Councillor's are not giving the current ward the attention it deserves as does Mike Burns who is running alongside me.

I feel like many others that we only see our current Councillors around local election time when they want something from you and if elected i will be available and here when you need something or have a issue you need dealing with.

I have been active in reporting fly tipping in recent months and reported all instances where bins have not been collected in the Bigyn area. If i see it or it gets reported to me i will act as i believe our area has lacked representation and our current Councillors have not done what they have been elected to do.

I will be approaching every household in the Bigyn area over the coming months to find out what issues are important to you with my local area survey.

I am hoping to be running for Plaid Cymru and either way we don't have big business backers and we don't have unions giving us money.  Our money comes from us the members and activists which is why i am asking for your help in my campaign.

Any and all help provided will go to producing leaflets and letters to distribute to the community to help get me elected and be the voice that Bigyn needs.

It really is all about you.

story:
Short Summary

At 2Fer Fun we are a small group of friends who have a dream. Our dream is to see the 2Fer Fun App used worldwide. We believe that, together, we have what it takes to get this project off of the ground. 

So what is 2Fer Fun App? It's an app that turns any 2 for 1 coupon into a social experience. A person who has a 2 for 1 coupon can build a profile and list what experience they have to share and who they want to share it with, a new friend or date or even a local dog walker. The shared experience could be a movie, dinner, bowling, rides at a theme park, skydiving, coffee, getting their nails done, lazer tag, literally anything that has a 2 for 1 coupon. Anyone who downloads the free app version would be able to see what is on offer in their area. The two would then contact each other privately to arrange when to meet. Businesses could also buy an upgrade to have their coupons listed in the app. We think that it is a pretty great idea, but so do others who have more resources than us. We need your help.

The big guys over at Ideaapps, Inc have offered to buy 49% of our app, which we originally thought was pretty great. We decided not to move forward because they wanted to make 2Fer Fun a publically traded company. We declinded because we don't ever want to lose sight of what's important, and that is you and your experience. Now, the clock is ticking to get 2Fer Fun App to market before Ideaapps steals the idea and creates something similar. The agreements we have with them allow us six months to bring our technology to market before they can use the idea. 

That is why we need your help today. We have been working hard to see how we can get a quality app to market before Ideaapps contract a company out of India build a similar app. If we get an additional $5k from funding of some sort, whether it be with Indiegogo or orther outside sources, we will have enough funding to get the app to market. We would use any additional monies earned to market the app in other countries, until we have reached the dream of worldwide downloads. 

So please, pretty please, help us out by getting your download code today. It costs $1 to get the code to download the App on the day it launches. That small amount will be used to launch our dream. It takes less than two minutes and it could literally help shape the world. Please click the link below and go to the $1 Perk.

 We Thank you in advance!

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/2fer-Fun-App...

About Us

Our founders come from the Seattle, Washington area, which is a hub for technology. Seattle, Washington is home to businesses such as Google, Microsoft and Amazon just to name a few. Over the years our members have seen first hand how technology can literally shape the world we live in. As we have seen, the idea of saving money with coupons has grown into a multimillion industry with apps like Groupon boasting over 115 million subscribers. We have also seen social media grow beyond possible count with sites like Facebook, Instagram and Twitter literally becoming a part of each of our daily lives. 

The 2Fer Fun App combines these two phenomenon by allowing anyone that has a 2 for 1 coupon to create a profile, list what experience they have to share and who they want to share it with. This could be a new friend, a potential love interest or even a local dog walker. They can then be contacted by anyone who would like to share the experience with them whether it be a movie, dinner, bowling, rides at a theme park, skydiving, coffee, or really anything at all.

We think the only thing better than having a social experience is getting to have a social experience for free. That is why we will put the 2Fer Fun App in the world's back pocket for free!

The team at 2Fer Fun are professionals that each bring their own talent to the table. Our backgrounds are diverse, from customer service, to hands on production, to owning their own business. We are a well rounded and resourceful group who don't mind working hard to meet our goal of bringing the 2Fer Fun App to the world.

App Overview

2Fer Fun is an application that turns any 2 for 1 coupon into a social experience. People can get together for a meal, a movie, bowling, rides at a theme park, almost anything that has been offered by a business on a 2 for 1 basis. Best of all they get to do it at half of the normal cost! People can meet a new date, a new friend or even a local dog walker. The options are endless. 

How it works 
A user who has a 2 for 1 coupon can build a small profile about who they are. They will then be able to list what experience they have on offer and who they would like to share the experience with, a new friend, a new date, or even someone who likes sunsets. It is completely up to them. Their profile would then be open to see for free by any user who downloads the app. If someone wants to share the experience they would contact the person directly to determine when they would like to meet. This part of the app would be free, as would all "social type" experiences such as a Broadway show, ride on a tour bus, get dinner, see a movie, go bowling, play golf, go scuba diving, whale watching, etc.

For a fee of 99 cents a user will be able to participate in largerscale and higher value 2 for 1 offers such as T-Mobiles 2 for 1 phone service, a 2 for 1 vacation package and other similar deals. Likewise if they would like to list some type of "hard item" (like 2 for 1 clothings offers, school supplies, buy one pair of shoes get 1 free pair, etc.) they will be able to with the upgrade.
In app ads will support the app. A user can remove the ads by purchasing an upgrade for 99 cents.
Any business that would like to increase their reach using the app, on their terms, will be offered the ability to do so. For a one time fee of $21 a business would have the ability to create a landing page that includes their offers, their information, a link to their website, a link to their social media pages, and their logo. They would have the ability to pay a monthly fee of  $11 to change the coupon as many times as they would like during a 30 day period. This can help substantially increase their business, and business awareness, by staying active with the app. They will also have the ability to increase business on the days and at the times they want based on the way they structure their offer.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $25,000 USD to continue branding, developing and marketing the technology that we've got. The 2Fer Fun App will continue to evolve in this direction and we will use the funds to get our app into the pockets of millions of people worldwide. That is why we give everyone the initial version of 2Fer Fun App for free- we are looking to create a global movement of people sharing experiences while saving money AND giving businesses an opportunity to boost their customer reach in the process. We see this as a win-win for everyone.

2Fer Fun operates on a digital medium so we thought that offering digital perks is the best way to get you involved!

Our rewards and incentives are as diverse as our investors. They inculde:

》Shout outs on our social media pages

》 Thank yous on our website 

》 Free app upgrade

》 The opportunity to meet the 2Fer Fun App board to share your insights on building the 2Fer Fun app and expansion 

》Two tickets to our exclusive launch party in Seattle 

If our funding goal isn't met we will reorganize our launch strategy and find a to persevere. We want the world to have 2Fer Fun App in their pockets and to use it everyday.

The Impact

Although everyone has their own way to have fun, they will have more while sharing that experience with someone new for free. Our app helps people to connect AND it helps businesses to connect with new customers. The benefits to users is that they get the opportunity to meet someone new without financial risk- if the connection just isn’t there no one is out too much cash. The benefits to a businesse is that they can expand their reach and on their terms. If a restaurant needs to sell more meals on Tuesday nights then they can create a coupon tailored for our users to get them in to their business on Tuesday nights. Our unique team to build an app like something not yet seen in the app world. We  believe that 2Fer Fun has the ability to shape the world. 

Risks & Challenges

Although the area of app development is nothing new, this concept of combing social media with the group of people using apps like Groupon is. With that comes risks and new challenges to be faced. There is no template for what we are creating. We also have major brands and corporations that have seen the value of our idea and who will try to reach the market before we do and with far more resources. Already, Ideaapps has offered to buy 49% of 2Fer Fun with the goal of making it a publically traded company. The agreements we have with them allow us six months to bring our technology to market before they can use the idea behind the 2Fer Fun App. We are a small group of friends and not a big company like ideaapps. We NEED your support to see our dream come true. 

We realize that these are significant challenges but our team is ready to face them and bring 2Fer Fun App to market successfully. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing financially is not possible for you but you still believe in our project and want to make a difference, please share this with as many people as you can by email or on your social media feeds. We want the world to know about 2Fer Fun App and we need your help to get there!

For more information about 2Fer Fun App check us out and please like our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/2Fer-Fun-App-219776038... 

We look forward to sharing our journey with you,

The 2Fer Fun App Team

So what is 2Fer Fun App? It's an app that turns any 2 for 1 coupon into a social experience. A person who has a 2 for 1 coupon can build a profile and list what experience they have to share and who they want to share it with, a new friend or date or even a local dog walker. The shared experience could be a movie, dinner, bowling, rides at a theme park, skydiving, coffee, getting their nails done, lazer tag, literally anything that has a 2 for 1 coupon. Anyone who downloads the free app version would be able to see what is on offer in their area. The two would then contact each other privately to arrange when to meet. Businesses could also buy an upgrade to have their coupons listed in the app. We think that it is a pretty great idea, but so do others who have more resources than us. We need your help.
The big guys over at Ideaapps, Inc have offered to buy 49% of our app, which we originally thought was pretty great. We decided not to move forward because they wanted to make 2Fer Fun a publically traded company. We declinded because we don't ever want to lose sight of what's important, and that is you and your experience. Now, the clock is ticking to get 2Fer Fun App to market before Ideaapps steals the idea and creates something similar. The agreements we have with them allow us six months to bring our technology to market before they can use the idea. 
That is why we need your help today. We have been working hard to see how we can get a quality app to market before Ideaapps contract a company out of India build a similar app. If we get an additional $5k from funding of some sort, whether it be with Indiegogo or orther outside sources, we will have enough funding to get the app to market. We would use any additional monies earned to market the app in other countries, until we have reached the dream of worldwide downloads. 
So please, pretty please, help us out by getting your download code today. It costs $1 to get the code to download the App on the day it launches. That small amount will be used to launch our dream. It takes less than two minutes and it could literally help shape the world. Please click the link below and go to the $1 Perk.
 We Thank you in advance!
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/2fer-Fun-App...
About Us
Our founders come from the Seattle, Washington area, which is a hub for technology. Seattle, Washington is home to businesses such as Google, Microsoft and Amazon just to name a few. Over the years our members have seen first hand how technology can literally shape the world we live in. As we have seen, the idea of saving money with coupons has grown into a multimillion industry with apps like Groupon boasting over 115 million subscribers. We have also seen social media grow beyond possible count with sites like Facebook, Instagram and Twitter literally becoming a part of each of our daily lives. 
The 2Fer Fun App combines these two phenomenon by allowing anyone that has a 2 for 1 coupon to create a profile, list what experience they have to share and who they want to share it with. This could be a new friend, a potential love interest or even a local dog walker. They can then be contacted by anyone who would like to share the experience with them whether it be a movie, dinner, bowling, rides at a theme park, skydiving, coffee, or really anything at all.
We think the only thing better than having a social experience is getting to have a social experience for free. That is why we will put the 2Fer Fun App in the world's back pocket for free!
The team at 2Fer Fun are professionals that each bring their own talent to the table. Our backgrounds are diverse, from customer service, to hands on production, to owning their own business. We are a well rounded and resourceful group who don't mind working hard to meet our goal of bringing the 2Fer Fun App to the world.
App Overview
2Fer Fun is an application that turns any 2 for 1 coupon into a social experience. People can get together for a meal, a movie, bowling, rides at a theme park, almost anything that has been offered by a business on a 2 for 1 basis. Best of all they get to do it at half of the normal cost! People can meet a new date, a new friend or even a local dog walker. The options are endless. 
How it works A user who has a 2 for 1 coupon can build a small profile about who they are. They will then be able to list what experience they have on offer and who they would like to share the experience with, a new friend, a new date, or even someone who likes sunsets. It is completely up to them. Their profile would then be open to see for free by any user who downloads the app. If someone wants to share the experience they would contact the person directly to determine when they would like to meet. This part of the app would be free, as would all "social type" experiences such as a Broadway show, ride on a tour bus, get dinner, see a movie, go bowling, play golf, go scuba diving, whale watching, etc.
For a fee of 99 cents a user will be able to participate in largerscale and higher value 2 for 1 offers such as T-Mobiles 2 for 1 phone service, a 2 for 1 vacation package and other similar deals. Likewise if they would like to list some type of "hard item" (like 2 for 1 clothings offers, school supplies, buy one pair of shoes get 1 free pair, etc.) they will be able to with the upgrade.In app ads will support the app. A user can remove the ads by purchasing an upgrade for 99 cents.Any business that would like to increase their reach using the app, on their terms, will be offered the ability to do so. For a one time fee of $21 a business would have the ability to create a landing page that includes their offers, their information, a link to their website, a link to their social media pages, and their logo. They would have the ability to pay a monthly fee of  $11 to change the coupon as many times as they would like during a 30 day period. This can help substantially increase their business, and business awareness, by staying active with the app. They will also have the ability to increase business on the days and at the times they want based on the way they structure their offer.

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $25,000 USD to continue branding, developing and marketing the technology that we've got. The 2Fer Fun App will continue to evolve in this direction and we will use the funds to get our app into the pockets of millions of people worldwide. That is why we give everyone the initial version of 2Fer Fun App for free- we are looking to create a global movement of people sharing experiences while saving money AND giving businesses an opportunity to boost their customer reach in the process. We see this as a win-win for everyone.
2Fer Fun operates on a digital medium so we thought that offering digital perks is the best way to get you involved!
Our rewards and incentives are as diverse as our investors. They inculde:
》Shout outs on our social media pages
》 Thank yous on our website 
》 Free app upgrade
》 The opportunity to meet the 2Fer Fun App board to share your insights on building the 2Fer Fun app and expansion 
》Two tickets to our exclusive launch party in Seattle 
If our funding goal isn't met we will reorganize our launch strategy and find a to persevere. We want the world to have 2Fer Fun App in their pockets and to use it everyday.

The Impact
Although everyone has their own way to have fun, they will have more while sharing that experience with someone new for free. Our app helps people to connect AND it helps businesses to connect with new customers. The benefits to users is that they get the opportunity to meet someone new without financial risk- if the connection just isn’t there no one is out too much cash. The benefits to a businesse is that they can expand their reach and on their terms. If a restaurant needs to sell more meals on Tuesday nights then they can create a coupon tailored for our users to get them in to their business on Tuesday nights. Our unique team to build an app like something not yet seen in the app world. We  believe that 2Fer Fun has the ability to shape the world. 

Risks & Challenges
Although the area of app development is nothing new, this concept of combing social media with the group of people using apps like Groupon is. With that comes risks and new challenges to be faced. There is no template for what we are creating. We also have major brands and corporations that have seen the value of our idea and who will try to reach the market before we do and with far more resources. Already, Ideaapps has offered to buy 49% of 2Fer Fun with the goal of making it a publically traded company. The agreements we have with them allow us six months to bring our technology to market before they can use the idea behind the 2Fer Fun App. We are a small group of friends and not a big company like ideaapps. We NEED your support to see our dream come true. 
We realize that these are significant challenges but our team is ready to face them and bring 2Fer Fun App to market successfully. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If contributing financially is not possible for you but you still believe in our project and want to make a difference, please share this with as many people as you can by email or on your social media feeds. We want the world to know about 2Fer Fun App and we need your help to get there!
For more information about 2Fer Fun App check us out and please like our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/2Fer-Fun-App-219776038... 
We look forward to sharing our journey with you,
The 2Fer Fun App Team

story:
We have an over 300 women strong waitlist for our next workshop series.  We need your help now to fund these workshops so that we can continue to provide this most necessary service to the community and continue fighting for gender equality!

 

OUR STORY

Frailty Myths is a dream that began as a group of friends imagining a space for women that was as powerful and supportive as that friendship.

Frailty Myths is a non-profit that offers an array of workshops that train women in traditionally male-dominated activities like welding, construction, climbing, art, and sailing. Each workshop offers hands-on skill building as well as facilitated discussions that examine the learning experience and how societal myths have kept women from actively participating in these spaces. Frailty Myths workshops aim to empower women to recognize and dispel the myths of frailty through dialogue and exploration of our physical capabilities.

This October, our dream became a reality when we launched the first Frailty Myths workshop series. Within days, over 300 women registered for our first workshop through our website and over 1500 women expressed interest. We have hosted 5 successful woodworking workshops that over 75 women attended and left with not only a step stool they'd made themselves, but also feeling empowered and supported.

So far we’ve done this entire process on our own. Everything that we have created, from the 501(c)(3), to the website and the workshops, has been self-created and self-funded by our leadership team.

We are ready to take the next step and provide these workshops to women across the country-- but we need your help. Please donate now. We can't get there without your help and support and every little bit gets us closer to the world we're working to build.

 

OUR IDEA

“By developing her power to the fullest, any woman, from Olympics star to the weekend tennis player, can be a match for any man she chooses to take on. More importantly, she will inherit the essential source of human self-confidence – pride and control over a finely tuned body. That alone would be a revolution.” (“Closing the Gap”, Ms. Magazine 1973)

We believe through our own experiences that when women discover and re-discover their physical capabilities, our bodies and minds become stronger. When we realize we are strong and capable, we also embrace our independence, our leadership capabilities, and our ability to stand up for ourselves and for others.

Our project seeks to outreach and hold space for those who do not identify as men. We hope to create a community and network including members of the trans and gender non-conforming communities. 

Caption: The Frailty Myths Woodworking Workshop: Our workshops have allowed women the space to explore an introduction into power tools and construction materials, take home something that they have constructed during our afternoon together, and have a group conversation about the societal myths surrounding femininity, frailty, strength, and power.

 

OUR GOAL

FUNDRAISER GOAL: $20,000

This fundraiser will fund the first three months of Frailty Myths by providing seven workshops, one full time Frailty Myths staffer, and over 200 women exploring their strength and smashing the myths of frailty together.

Our goal for 2017 is to do even more and reach over 700 women by hosting 24 workshops and community events that are accessible to all women, with a focus on low-income and marginalized communities.  

ALL OF OUR COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS ARE DONATION-BASED. NO ONE WILL EVER BE TURNED AWAY FROM A FRAILTY MYTHS WORKSHOP FOR A LACK OF FUNDS.

COST FOR A FRAILTY MYTHS WORKSHOP (WOODWORKING; 30 PEOPLE): $3000

$625 – Frailty Myths Staff (2 Staff for 10 hours)

$575 – Trainers (3 trainers for 6 hours)

$500 – Wood and Raw Materials

$300 – Tools, Parts, and Wear and Tear on Equipment

$300 – Venue

$250 – Merchandise (T-Shirts, Stickers, Instructional Packet)

$100 – Advertising

$100 – Safety Equipment

$100 – Food, Drinks, and Sunscreen

$50 – Printing Costs

This will only be possible with the generous funding of people like you. Together we can smash the myth of frailty.

2017 Goals:

  • Reach 700 women through 24 free workshops and three (3) community events
  • Two (2) workshops per month. Workshops TBA will be located in either Oakland, New York, or Washington D.C.
  • Three (3) Frailty Myths community events held in either Oakland, New York, or Washington D.C.
  • Tool/Material library for Frailty Myths workshops
  • One full-time Frailty Myths staff member

Your donation goes directly to funding these workshops and allowing women to participate in spaces that they have been traditionally kept out of. 

 

OUR IMPACT

REVIEWS OF FRAILTY MYTHS WORKSHOPS:

  • “I loved the talk at the beginning! The entire environment, including the whole point of the workshop.”
  • “I <3 the sense of comradery and the instructors were well-informed and good teachers.”
  • “I liked being able to use a wide range of tools – I never knew about an impact driver before!”
  • “I love how open everyone was and willing to teach.”
  • “I feel fantastic! Beyond the workshop, just meeting women from such diverse fields was amazing.”
  • “Thank you so much! I had an amazing time and feel more technically skilled and mentally empowered.”

 

OUR TEAM

Here are the four women that make up the leadership of Frailty Myths:

Georgia Faye Hirsty works in the environmental justice movement with a focus on the use of non-violent direct action as a tactic for change. Her work is deeply rooted in the understanding that the fight for justice necessarily includes solidarity with every fight for justice, and that exploring the intersections of oppression is a necessary part of dismantling it.

Erinn Carter has worked in progressive politics for more than 15 years. Her work has encompassed everything from the theory of political science through her PhD work at UCLA, which specialized in Race and Ethnicity in the American political context, to her real-life political experience, including work with labor unions, community organizations, and activism across the United States. As a black woman, her primary professional and personal focus has been in the fight for justice for communities of color.

Susan Goodwillie is a co-founder of SPACE on Ryder Farm, a nonprofit residency program housed on a working organic farm. She is also a social worker at the Mental Health Project at the Urban Justice Center-- a nonprofit that provides free legal and advocacy services to low-income New Yorkers living with mental illness.

Pearl Robinson was born in Florida, raised in New Jersey, and tells people that she’s from Brooklyn. She attended CUNY Medgar Evers in Brooklyn, New York and studied Journalism there, which comes in handy because the justice organizations she has worked for actually break the big stories and are true watchdogs of democracy. In her spare time, she enjoys singing karaoke, speaking loudly in inappropriate spaces, riding her bike, and watching funny YouTube videos.
