story:
WHO WE ARE
Seven years ago, Chris May started roasting coffee in a popcorn popper. While the machinery we use to roast our beans has changed, our persistence to produce the perfect tasting cup of coffee hasn’t. After a successful DIY Coffee Supply company revealed an enthusiasm for specialty coffee within the community, we decided it was time to open a proper boutique coffee café in our beloved town. We believe our café should be a common ground, a sort of third space. There can be stress at work and there can be stress at home, but not here. Here is a space where a vibrant community can come together to rest and to laugh and to work. A space specifically cultivated and lovingly crafted to serve and bless our community, just like our coffee. Contributions will help us bring an experience of specialty coffee to our city, as well as realize a vision of creating a space for peace, art, and culture within our community.

WHAT WE NEED
ESPRESSO
A coffee shop isn’t complete without an espresso machine. We believe that quality requires focus and attention to the smallest details. That’s why when we begin to serve espresso drinks, they will be drinks made to the highest standard of quality.

JUICE BAR
We want to continue bringing fresh juices made from organic fruits and vegetables to our customers. We’d like to begin including things like protein, essential oils, and probiotics in our juices. We’d even like to begin bottling our beverages. For this, we need a juicer with bottling capability and an industrial blender.

ROASTER
Thankfully, our coffee is in high demand. Our current roaster is unable to keep up with our production requirements, so we need a bigger one. This will allow us to produce and sell more bagged coffee beans, eventually online, and have an enticing variety available to our in-store customers.


 

These are our three primary needs. If we make our goal, we’ll be able purchase these needed supplies immediately and completely. If we don’t make our goal, we’ll use the funds to expand our espresso bar, and then invest in the expansion of our juice bar and roasting capabilities respectively.

 

WHAT YOU GET
Some of the exciting perks we’ve lined up for this campaign include a Professional Brew Kit, a Custom Leather Bag (designed here in Goshen by Janus Motorcycles), Coffee for Life, Artisan-made Mugs and other apparel.

THE IMPACT WE’LL MAKE
We love coffee and we love people, and after experiencing the enthusiasm of our community during our successful DIY Coffee Supply venture, we are passionate about maintaining a place of culture and coffee for our city. Goshen is an amazing town full of art, life, and incredible people. We want to bring all of that together into one space. Over a cup of coffee.

THE CHALLENGES WE FACE
Our venture is unique for a town of this size, both in the degree of craftsmanship and communal focus we are attempting. We then have the task of not just supporting the coffee enthusiasts in our neighborhood, but also familiarizing a portion of the population with an experience of coffee that may be new and foreign to them, all while maintaining a clear view of our desire to deliver the highest standard of quality and the utmost degree of hospitality to our community.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Come by the shop. Experience the coffee and enjoy the community. And tell people about it. Leave a review on Yelp. Follow us on Instagram. Better yet, invite your friends to the shop. Also, feel free to share this campaign with anyone you think might like to get involved.

story:
Let's Get Gardening!

The money you donate will go towards paying off debts incurred by a client who failed to pay their bill. We're new at this and our contract with the client isn't strong enough to take them to court, but we've learned from our mistake and are ready to come back better than ever with a little help!

Let's Get Down To The Dirt

We're looking to raise $3000  by the end of July to pay off the cost incurred through buying plants, supplies and labor costs when a client failed to pay us. My crew did a wonderful job and they deserve to be paid!

If we don't reach our goal whatever we do receive will go towards paying down the debt. So, give us a hand and get something in return! 

What You Do

Help a small, female-owned local company thrive.

What You Get

  • $10 Donation: Your choice of a pack of Greeting Cards or a sticker displaying the business owner's garden-centered work. Take a look at the work on Redbubble at this link and note which design you'd like!
  • $20 Donation: Cards And Stickers Both! 
  • $30 Donation: Two weeks (14 days)  of free, custom gardening advice and research. You can email me as much as you like during your weeks of choice, and I will respond with detailed, research based answers such as those I write for the Denver Master Gardeners.
  • $40 Donation: Three weeks of custom gardening advice and an artistic garden journal
  • $60 Donation: 1 Month (60 Days) Custom Gardening Advice
  • $80 Donation: 2 Months of Custom Gardening advice AND 3 hours Custom Design Work. Send me pictures and dimensions for your property, and I'll have a garden design ready for you to install by next March!
  • $100 Donation: 2 Months Custom Gardening Advice, 5 Hours Custom Garden Design Work And Consultation, Gardening Journal Of Your Choice
  • $150 Donation: 2 Months Custom Gardening Advice, 6 Hours Custom Garden Design Work And Consultation, Gardening Journal And Greeting Cards Of Your Choice
  • $200 Donation: 2 Months Custom Gardening Advice, 8 Hours Custom Garden Design Work And Consultation, Mug, Gardening Journal And Greeting Cards Of Your Choice

They Tried To Bury Us. They Did Not Know We Were Seeds

Women in the horticultural industry, especially young women, are regularly taken advantage of by clients for a simple fact: they think we're afraid. And sometimes we are. I have made the choice not to fight in court with a client who screamed in my face and called me a b*tch. The stress involved is gut-wrenchingly overwhelming. I belong out in the gardens, taking care of the green world, not in a courtroom fight.
So I choose to fight this debt and this fear with better tools: the community of wonderful people around Colorado and the state who love gardens, growing things, and helping one another out.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise about this campaign wherever you know gardeners and green folk hang out!
  • Tell a friend there's a gardener who needs a hand!
  • Vote and support Colorado Contractor Laws!

story:
Welcome to Bookish: An Indie Shop for Folks Who Read!

 

We are a pair high school English teachers who have spent the 15 and 14 years of our careers putting good books into kids' hands, preaching the value of independent reading and choice to our peers and administrators, and dreaming about the day that we would move beyond our classrooms to share our love of literature with a broader audience. This May we will say goodbye to that part of our lives and step into the next part of our professional adventure as independent bookstore owners! 

We want to promote literacy all over the River Valley. But we can’t wait until the summer to start this process!  There is so much to do to get ready for our brick and mortar opening next fall!  Between the two of us, we have enough funds to cover ⅔ of our anticipated start-up budget and those funds are tied up until next July. We want to begin building a relationship with the community that is going to support our store, so we have decided to use crowdfunding as a means to raise the other ⅓ of our start-up costs. 

Bookish: will be, first and foremost,  a bookstore.  We will carry a well-curated selection of new books and some amazing sideline items that readers will love.  Our expertise will make our bookstore different from the big box booksellers.  We are readers and have spent our careers connecting people to books they might like to read.  Building those relationships isn’t something a big box store has the time or expertise to do.  

We also want to be a hub for the community.  My (Jen's) sweet mother, who was also an educator for 42 years, will be our children’s area expert.  Research tells us that children who live in print-rich environments and who are read to daily will meet reading milestones on time and even exceed them. In addition to hosting story times at the store, we want to partner with schools, preschools, and homeschoolers to have weekly events for children and young adults. Mom has already begun planning the fun!

We hope it’s obvious to you that we are excited! We want you to be excited, too! We’ve spent a lot of time designing the perfect perks to offer our backers. We also realize that some of you who are looking at our campaign because you know us personally may not be familiar with crowdfunding, so feel free to reach out to us with any questions. In a nutshell, we opted to utilize IndieGogo because every dollar we raise from our community of backers is one less dollar that we potentially have to borrow from a bank. We want Bookish: to be in the best possible position to succeed, and we know your support will make that happen.

The Details!

  • We need to raise an additional $30,000 to complete our start-up budget. We have designed a selection of perks to fit all budgets from a simple "Good Luck" contribution to a variety of Bookish: merchandise to actually reserving our space your own private event among the stacks! 

 

  • Our priority expenditures for the campaign funds are:
    • Membership in the American Booksellers Association and attendance at Winter Institute 
    • An initial inventory for our subscription service, bookclub, and spring/summer pop-up shops
    • Logo design
    • Merchandise 
    • And...securing our brick and mortar space and beginning any remodeling/renovation so we can move in next fall!

But aren't independent bookstores closing?

The short answer -- not any more! Since the 1990s more than 2/3 of the independent bookstore in the U.S. have closed, but thanks to the shop local movement and the committed work of the American Booksellers Association, small independent stores are opening again in areas that are missing this cultural staple in their community. Consumers are finding that there is no replacement for the personal relationships that are forged with real, live booksellers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share our campaign! We know that everyone's budget may not allow them to back us financially. We still need your help! You can help us be talking us up and by letting folks know about our crowdfunding efforts. 

Thank you so much for reading about Bookish: and for sharing in our excitement! In the spirit of the holiday season and, at the risk of sounding cliche' even though we mean this sincerely, we are THANKFUL, GRATEFUL, and BLESSED to bring our dream to life!

story:
Amina's Naturals is an all natural Mango & Shea Moisturizer that helps to Repair, Strengthen & Grow your Natural Hair, Beard, Skin & Nails the way nature intended it to be.

 

All Ingredients come straight from Mother Earth! 

 

7 Benefits of using Amina's Naturals: 

  1. Improves Hair Texture.
  2. Thickens Hair & Stimulates Hair Growth. 
  3. Helps prevent Razor Bumps after shaving (For Men's Beards.)
  4. Seals in moisture, helping to repair split ends.
  5. Anti-Aging, Anti-Fungal, Non-pore clogging Formula.
  6. Fights Frizz, while leaving hair,skin,beard & even nails Shiny & healthy.
  7. Treats Itchy, dry, scalp & heals scalp inflammation. 

A great Hair Moisturizer for the Summer!

Improves Hair Texture.
Thickens Hair & Stimulates Hair Growth. 
Helps prevent Razor Bumps after shaving (For Men's Beards.)
Seals in moisture, helping to repair split ends.
Anti-Aging, Anti-Fungal, Non-pore clogging Formula.
Fights Frizz, while leaving hair,skin,beard & even nails Shiny & healthy.
Treats Itchy, dry, scalp & heals scalp inflammation. 
A great Hair Moisturizer for the Summer!

story:
My name is Bobby Price, and I am a professional barber and artist. I am married with three sons and reside on the west side of Chicago. I currently work at Sohohouse Chicago as a barber and have had the pleasure of working in some of the best barbershops in Chicago. I have been cutting hair since I was 15 and have now been cutting hair professionally for the past six years. My early interests in barbering were nurtured on the west side of Chicago, where I was born and raised in the North Lawndale community. Due to my reputation amongst peers as an artist, I was asked to create  graphic designs in haircuts. Those haircuts would be the beginning of work as a community barber. Though there was a natural ability, I didn't seriously pursue the profession until many years later. I currently service a wide ranging clientele representing many different textures and personal and professional tastes.

 

 

I am a professionally trained barber who uses traditional barbering techniques to create an extensive range of styles for a diverse clientele. I am also a visual artist whose work in artistic expression influences my creativity in creating styles. Over time, I started to appreciate the profession of barbering and created a vision that has empowered me to do what I love today.

 I’ve been featured for barbering in magazines such as Chicago Social, Men’s book, Haberdash Clothing blog and Sohohouse’s House Four magazine.

My Areas of Expertise are

hot towel straight razor shaves

shear/scissor styling

grooming consultation

style consultation

    My Education & Training consist of

Professional barber's training from Success Barber School (Chicago, IL), state licensed 2012

1000 medical floor hours

Trained as barber stylist, experienced in clippers, shears, and straight razors

Completed in the top 5% of cohort

 

 

I have been blessed with the opportunity to open the barbershop of my dreams with the help of some angel investors that will allow me to raise a portion of my needs to fully open the barber shop. This campaign will help me raise a small portion of the large amount to open. It is so important that I raise the funds to hecreate the vision I have for Principle Barbers and the Principle brand.

Principle Barbershop will be a place for straight razorshaves, haircuts for men, women and children, a place for shop talks and creative events, lovers of art and music, performances with live bands, DJs and a platform and meeting place for the community. It is important to me to offer other barbers the opportunity to join me in being an influence and mentor. It will be a shop that is built on principles of professionalism, proper quality service, client relationships, freedom and creativity.

 

 

By helping me and contributing to my fund, you will allow me to create a pivot in my life, myfamily, community, clients and friends. You will be helping me build a dream, a barbershop and brand that has the potential to change the barbering industry as a whole. Principle Barbers will provide professional and proper men's grooming services in a healthy, creative atmosphere. The Principle Barbershop will be an amazing place with 1100 sf of attractive retro, minimal, mid century modern furniture. It has wood floors, 15 ft ceiling, ceiling fans, exposed brick, a DJ booth and a 10x10 platform stage. It will be a place for people inside and outside of my community.

 

I need to raise a minimum of $12,000 which is 15% of a $70,000 budget to open.

It is my responsibility to raise the first 15% so that my investors will provide the other 85%.

 

Any donations over my goal will go towards promotion and marketing, a billboard, restoration of the storefront, and the return of money to my investors.

 

This is a breakdown of the funds needed to open the barbershop:

$22,000

Barber chairs

Shampoo bowl 

Credenza 

Wooden barber station and mirrors 

 

$15,000

Interior painting 

Wood floor restoration 

Ceiling light and barber lamps

Product shelving 

 

$10,000

Windows installed 

Security system 

Exterior barber pole

Customer WiFi 

 

$18,000

Lounge Furnature 

Coffee table and small furniture 

Pool/ping pong table

Music system

POS system

 

In the raw...

 

 

S

 

The build out

  •  My campaign will run from October 23rd to December 2nd
  • I will receive my funds two weeks after my campaign ends
  • I will order and receive all of the gift perks and immediately mail them out (Everyone should receive their gifts before mid January)
  •  I will start construction and build out with the hopes of finishing mid -to- late January 

 I  Will plan to have a soft opening first week of February and I could possibly open second week of February, which is right at my birthday, February 10!

 

 

Please enjoy and purchase the great selection of perks I have created! 

I am grateful to have the opportunity to work with other local and small businesses such as Chicago candle co. and Chicago Comb co., which is located in our sister neighborhoods, Garfield park and Pilsen. They have committed to helping me build a place where I can stand amongst other great barbershops and businesses in the neighborhood.

 

 The hurtles I may have could be not reaching my goal and having to start another campaign again and the timing of construction and build out. I will need help from friends family and neighbors to literally put their hands in this place and help me work. I also believe with all the support I’ve had so far, this all could be easily jumped over.

 

I know some of you would love to contribute but you just can't, yet that doesn't mean you can't help!

Ask your friends and other folks to get the word out for me and send them my indiegogo page!

Just use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Story So Far

Lucky Goblin Games is a real place today. The lease is signed, the building is being renovated as we speak, and product is on the way. We are excitedly planning our grand opening.

This brand new store is the passion project of Charlotte and Seamus, and the culmination of a dream we've fostered since long before we even met. (On a gaming forum, of course.) We are a husband and wife team of geeks who have been stomping around the Friendly Local Gaming Scene for combined decades. And we've noticed something.

The wife part of the team was not always made to feel comfortable.

In fact, now that we're paying attention, a lot of people aren't feeling entirely comfortable. While the pull of the sheer joy and magic of hobby gaming is as strong as ever, a lot of people feel that the scene is not for them. This makes us mad.

Lucky Goblin Games was founded for them. For us. For everyone.

 

The Next Few Weeks

We are raising funds to make the space we have accessible and (arguably more importantly) comfortable for everyone. While this is mostly done through consistently cultivating a culture of friendliness and inclusiveness, extra funds will allow us the following:

  • we will hire an accessibility expert to advise us on ways to make sure we aren't just legally ACA-compliant, but rather truly accessible and aware
  • we will create a "quiet space" in the store where those of us who do not deal well with crowds can decompress, recollect and regroup between intense games or on busier evenings
  • while we are fully set to have aids and products for disabled gamers available free of charge (colored stickers, braille dice, etc) extra funds would help us keep a larger selection of these wonderful products on hand. This would include a 3D printer to help us create gaming aids on demand.
  • gaming spaces in the past have been unkind to gamers of heavier body types. Wobbly card tables and plastic folding chairs do not pair well with any derriere, let alone the heftier one. Our insistence on having sturdy, wide and comfortable chairs and tables with lots of elbow room (not to mention pathways for people using mobility devices) is the reason we have leased a space that is a lot roomier than most stores. Your contribution would help alleviate the cost of this extra space in these delicate start-up months.

 

How You Can Help

Fostering a friendly culture costs nothing but a few moments of conviction. Not a cent is required for us to learn about the hurdles some gamers face and open our doors to everyone who wants to share in the joy of gaming.

Your contribution will help us with the parts that aren't free: an environment that is extra comfortable and cozy as well as functional, more space for specialty product, more funds to reach a wider audience and keep our mission of gaming inclusiveness going.

Lucky Goblin Games, LLC does not have debt with any lending institutions and we desperately want to keep it that way. So far this adventure has been made possible by personal funds from ourselves and private investors who have faith in our mission and plans and are providing ongoing professional support.

 

Risks & Challenges

Lucky Goblin Games is already a reality. We have leased a pricier space on a main street for the sole purpose of backing up our mission of accessibility. While our private investors have great faith in our business plan and have contributed generously, our store is vulnerable to the same type of risk any physical store is subject to. Rent and utilities need to be paid, storms may temporarily close our doors, rent prices may change. We have done all we can to fully guard ourselves from these problems.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would like to thank you so much for considering our campaign and wanting to be part of our mission. Every dollar helps, but so does every tweet, like and share! 

Happy gaming,

Charlotte and Seamus

story:
Hello! We are Chris and Erica (and Winnie) Williams. We've lived in Lilburn for 4 years and LOVE it here. We love the parks, the local summer concerts, farmers markets, being a short distance from ATL, and most of all, the people.

Our journey has led us to the desire to build community where we live. And what better way for community to gather than over awesome coffee and food in a relaxing space? That is what we want to create for you.

Life Stream Coffee House - why this name? Pretty simple, coffee is the stream that gives life. Also we plan to have a worship time together on Sundays where we talk about the One who streams eternal life into us daily.

Our location at 1180 Old Tucker Road is a residential home zoned commercial with a huge wrap-around deck and a beautiful backyard with a lovely accessible nature walk through a serene wooded area where birds sing and squirrels frolick.  With seating available indoors, on the deck, and scattered throughout the yard in patio areas, we will be able to accommodate all sizes and types of groups.

Why do we need help funding?

We have chosen a location, but as new business owners, loans are unfortunately difficult to obtain. Banks are a bummer sometimes. Soooo, that's where you come in!

Giving to this campaign is basically a coffee pre-order. Whatever you give up front, we will return to you in coffee and food and swag! It's a win-win! PLUS you'll get invited to pre-opening VIP events like coffee tastings PLUS you may get the chance to name a menu item!

We truly want Life Stream to be your favorite hang out, the place you come to "get away," where you can enjoy the company of friends and family, meet a client, find a casual co-working space, or just enjoy an evening out.

We will be open early to late, so we can get you that jolt you need in the morning, offering curbside service so you don't even have to step out of your vehicle! And we will be that spot in the evenings for fun family-friendly events.

And you can have a part in making this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

So let's break this down:

  • Like I said, being first time business owners, we can't get traditional bank funding. We are investing some of our own savings, but we need an additional $75,000 to fund the startup costs. 
  • These costs include the kitchen renovation, some electrical and plumbing work, kitchen equipment purchases, outdoor signage, inventory, and furniture. 
  • Perks: now the good stuff - this will be fleshed out more in the next section, but perks for giving will include coffee drinks, food, t-shirts, travel mugs, hats, invitations to VIP events, special recognition, and the chance to name your own menu item (maybe even a piece of equipment, can you imagine everyone calling the espresso machine by YOUR name!?)
  • The way Indiegogo is set up is we can still get the funds even if we don't reach the goal, we just pay an extra percentage. So if the goal is not reached, that's what we will do, but we KNOW we can reach this goal!

The Impact

In addition to the coffee house being a gathering place during the week, Chris will also host a worship gathering on Sundays. Everyone is welcome! If the weather permits, you will probably find us worshiping outside on the deck or patio area.

We also plan to employ single moms and people with special needs and offer space for not-for-profit groups to gather at no charge.

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenges will be with the construction process and the county legalities. We plan to overcome these hurdles through a careful selection process of our contractors and working with the county to pass the required inspections.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people are unable to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, sharing through your social media pages, e-mail, and just by telling everyone you know in person!
  • If you are handy with tools, painting, lawn equipment, design, and gardening, we would treasure your help on some work days! Really the whole reason we want to open a coffee house is to meet all of you and get to know you all better. We need you as much as we need coffee!

story:
So, What Exactly Is Cali Green Life?

Cali Green Life is essentially a movement toward sustainability and eco-friendly living, fueled as a contracting business. We are a small, but mighty, team of dedicated people who believe in living with purpose, at work and at home.

Our vision is a world where every person's first instinct is to choose sustainability, and a market where that instinct is affordable to all.

That can be achieved through education, through inspiration, through partnership, through hard work and dedication, and by making eco-friendly contracting options available for people to start going green where they spend most of their time: at home, and in the office.

A Brief History of Cali Green Life

Cali Green Life opened its doors as Cali Green Turf in August of 2015 with one simple mission: Help Californians make it through one of the most severe droughts in modern history, while allowing them to maintain the allure and beauty of a lush, green yard.

The So Cal sun drives our outdoor lifestyle, and people like to have fun! So we wanted people to stop using water to keep grass alive (and stop releasing harmful fumes into the air from lawn mowers and leaf blowers), but we wanted them to still enjoy their lawns. 

Artificial turf was a great way to do that. It looks pretty. It's fun—and safe—for kids and pets. It's low maintenance. And it gives people the same outdoor playtime opportunities as grass did. In fact, in some cases, there are even more chances to play. Nothing like a year-round putting green right at home!

Rather than measuring success through profitability—which is absolutely important for a business to last!—we opted to measure success through gallons of water saved. By switching to American-made, lead-free, high-quality artificial turf, people could 

In 2016, the first full year in business, Cali Green Turf saved nearly 8 million gallons of water, diverted from watering lawns. That's something we're really proud of. In 2017, the goal is another 10 million gallons.

In mid-2016, Cali Green Paint was added to the Cali Green Life family, offering VOC-free indoor painting services and energy-saving COOLWALL exterior coatings.

Through partnerships with highly qualified and trusted experts, Cali Green Life also offers solar panels, installed 

Smart Employees: Minority + Veteran Owned and Operated

Cali Green Life is made up of motivated, driven, bright individuals, from diverse backgrounds—women and men of different ethnicities. A real hodgepodge of Southern California goodness.

The founder, Edi Santos, is a U.S. Marine Corps Combat Veteran who grew up in poverty, born to a 16-year-old single mother, and worked his way up to purposeful entrepreneurship through education (ultimately earning an MBA) and the military. He left a successful career in banking to start the business. He wants to help people save money, build community and save the planet at the same time.

His brother, George Cisneros, is an Army Veteran. George is the Director of Sales, making it a family business. Clients love his excellent customer service, his can-do attitude, and his design aesthetic.

Every person who works for the company, from office staff to installer, has that same commitment to service and environmental responsibility.

That Sweet Sense of Contributing to Community

What you see on the right is what you get, materially speaking. We've set up some awesome perks that we think you'll be excited about!

But we hope you're even more interested in what you'll get as one of the early supporters of Cali Green Life—that feeling of having supported a start-up business creating job opportunity, one with purpose and a sense of service and a commitment to honesty and integrity.

What we sincerely hope you'll receive the moment you choose your contribution level and perk is a feeling of complete satisfaction, knowing that your money will be used to make the world a better place to live.

What Will My Money Do?

In a nutshell: Give Cali Green Life the longevity and flexibility to make a deeper impact.

Cali Green Life is operational. Our sales are keeping the doors open the jobs churning. The doors are open; our employees are paid; the lights are on. But, because we're such a new company, we are living the life of a start-up each and every day. That means money goes directly into the next gig, and costs are kept as tight as can be.

What we'd really love is to be able to grow, so that we can reach more people and expand the movement and messaging. We want to tell our employees to spend time on messaging, on relationship building, on digging into sustainable news and research, on creating events that bring the community together, on educating our children and our neighbors about how to lead a greener life. Those are priorities that we'd like to foster and give attention to, just as we put an emphasis on sales.

We're already doing some of that. Already this year, we've:

  • donated excess turf to Trash for Teaching, a nonprofit organization that supports STEAM education in the local schools,
  • scheduled a beach cleanup,
  • signed a letter in support of the Paris Climate Agreement,
  • started talks with the local school district to give back a percentage of local sales, 
  • committed funds to Giveback Homes, a nonprofit organization building homes for those in need here and abroad. 

We are committed to doing our part to make the earth a better place to live, for generations to come, starting with our little corner of it.

But in order to grow, we need to raise a little bit of a cushion to make those types of things happen.

Your support will mean that we can give our employees the latitude to express environmental leadership and delve into education, without worrying about a time crunch or how it will impact sales.

What Else?

In addition to expanded messaging and service, money from this growth campaign will allow us to:

  • invest in new equipment,
  • join local organizations such as the Chamber of Commerce,
  • increase advertising efforts in print and digital marketing,
  • ride out the slow times when rain prevents our painters from climbing ladders and our installers from nailing in turf,
  • take on an intern interested in learning the ropes of green business,
  • attend conferences and trade shows,
  • invest in employee education.

We have an awesome team. Help us keep them busy!

How Else Can I Help?

Great question! We've tried to make it easy to contribute, with our $10 contribution level, all the way up to our money-saving Cali Green Superstar for Life perk, but... even if you're not able to support us financially today, we'd love to invite you to join the movement.

So whether you contribute or not, here are some ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Indiegogo makes it super easy to share a campaign. Use the share tools and tell your friends.
  • Check us out on social media! We're on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube... we've made it pretty easy to find us. Just look for Cali Green Life, and you'll find us. Se love to hang out. So come on over, give us a follow, tag us, talk with us, and let's go green together!
  • Visit our website! We've got a lot of information about the company and our services on our website. We also have photos to inspire you, and blogs about eco news and how we can all care for the environment and one another.
  • Join our mailing list! Sign up at the bottom of our website for access to our monthly newsletter, full of photos, company news, and tips on design and sustainability.
  • Get a Free Quote! If you're local, and you're interested in turf, paint or solar, give us a call. We're always happy to come out and get you a free quote to help your home or business go green.
  • Think about us the next time you're making a purchase or using a natural resource! Is there a way you can conserve? Is it possible to choose a sustainable product? Every day, you have a choice. 
  • Honor Planet Earth by keeping it clean! The next time you take a walk, carry a small trash bag with you and pick up the litter. Schedule a clean-up day at the local park or beach with your neighbors. Be aware of the impact you have on the earth each and every day, and make it a good one.

That's it! Reach out if you have any questions, or if you'd like to find ways to partner up and talk sustainability, growth and responsibility!
story_txt:
So, What Exactly Is Cali Green Life?
Cali Green Life is essentially a movement toward sustainability and eco-friendly living, fueled as a contracting business. We are a small, but mighty, team of dedicated people who believe in living with purpose, at work and at home.
Our vision is a world where every person's first instinct is to choose sustainability, and a market where that instinct is affordable to all.
That can be achieved through education, through inspiration, through partnership, through hard work and dedication, and by making eco-friendly contracting options available for people to start going green where they spend most of their time: at home, and in the office.
A Brief History of Cali Green Life
Cali Green Life opened its doors as Cali Green Turf in August of 2015 with one simple mission: Help Californians make it through one of the most severe droughts in modern history, while allowing them to maintain the allure and beauty of a lush, green yard.
The So Cal sun drives our outdoor lifestyle, and people like to have fun! So we wanted people to stop using water to keep grass alive (and stop releasing harmful fumes into the air from lawn mowers and leaf blowers), but we wanted them to still enjoy their lawns. 
Artificial turf was a great way to do that. It looks pretty. It's fun—and safe—for kids and pets. It's low maintenance. And it gives people the same outdoor playtime opportunities as grass did. In fact, in some cases, there are even more chances to play. Nothing like a year-round putting green right at home!
Rather than measuring success through profitability—which is absolutely important for a business to last!—we opted to measure success through gallons of water saved. By switching to American-made, lead-free, high-quality artificial turf, people could 
In 2016, the first full year in business, Cali Green Turf saved nearly 8 million gallons of water, diverted from watering lawns. That's something we're really proud of. In 2017, the goal is another 10 million gallons.
In mid-2016, Cali Green Paint was added to the Cali Green Life family, offering VOC-free indoor painting services and energy-saving COOLWALL exterior coatings.
Through partnerships with highly qualified and trusted experts, Cali Green Life also offers solar panels, installed 
Smart Employees: Minority + Veteran Owned and Operated
Cali Green Life is made up of motivated, driven, bright individuals, from diverse backgrounds—women and men of different ethnicities. A real hodgepodge of Southern California goodness.
The founder, Edi Santos, is a U.S. Marine Corps Combat Veteran who grew up in poverty, born to a 16-year-old single mother, and worked his way up to purposeful entrepreneurship through education (ultimately earning an MBA) and the military. He left a successful career in banking to start the business. He wants to help people save money, build community and save the planet at the same time.
His brother, George Cisneros, is an Army Veteran. George is the Director of Sales, making it a family business. Clients love his excellent customer service, his can-do attitude, and his design aesthetic.
Every person who works for the company, from office staff to installer, has that same commitment to service and environmental responsibility.
That Sweet Sense of Contributing to Community

What you see on the right is what you get, materially speaking. We've set up some awesome perks that we think you'll be excited about!
But we hope you're even more interested in what you'll get as one of the early supporters of Cali Green Life—that feeling of having supported a start-up business creating job opportunity, one with purpose and a sense of service and a commitment to honesty and integrity.
What we sincerely hope you'll receive the moment you choose your contribution level and perk is a feeling of complete satisfaction, knowing that your money will be used to make the world a better place to live.
What Will My Money Do?
In a nutshell: Give Cali Green Life the longevity and flexibility to make a deeper impact.
Cali Green Life is operational. Our sales are keeping the doors open the jobs churning. The doors are open; our employees are paid; the lights are on. But, because we're such a new company, we are living the life of a start-up each and every day. That means money goes directly into the next gig, and costs are kept as tight as can be.
What we'd really love is to be able to grow, so that we can reach more people and expand the movement and messaging. We want to tell our employees to spend time on messaging, on relationship building, on digging into sustainable news and research, on creating events that bring the community together, on educating our children and our neighbors about how to lead a greener life. Those are priorities that we'd like to foster and give attention to, just as we put an emphasis on sales.
We're already doing some of that. Already this year, we've:

donated excess turf to Trash for Teaching, a nonprofit organization that supports STEAM education in the local schools,
scheduled a beach cleanup,
signed a letter in support of the Paris Climate Agreement,
started talks with the local school district to give back a percentage of local sales, 
committed funds to Giveback Homes, a nonprofit organization building homes for those in need here and abroad. 

We are committed to doing our part to make the earth a better place to live, for generations to come, starting with our little corner of it.
But in order to grow, we need to raise a little bit of a cushion to make those types of things happen.
Your support will mean that we can give our employees the latitude to express environmental leadership and delve into education, without worrying about a time crunch or how it will impact sales.
What Else?
In addition to expanded messaging and service, money from this growth campaign will allow us to:

invest in new equipment,
join local organizations such as the Chamber of Commerce,
increase advertising efforts in print and digital marketing,
ride out the slow times when rain prevents our painters from climbing ladders and our installers from nailing in turf,
take on an intern interested in learning the ropes of green business,
attend conferences and trade shows,
invest in employee education.

We have an awesome team. Help us keep them busy!

How Else Can I Help?
Great question! We've tried to make it easy to contribute, with our $10 contribution level, all the way up to our money-saving Cali Green Superstar for Life perk, but... even if you're not able to support us financially today, we'd love to invite you to join the movement.
So whether you contribute or not, here are some ways you can help:

Spread the word! Indiegogo makes it super easy to share a campaign. Use the share tools and tell your friends.
Check us out on social media! We're on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube... we've made it pretty easy to find us. Just look for Cali Green Life, and you'll find us. Se love to hang out. So come on over, give us a follow, tag us, talk with us, and let's go green together!
Visit our website! We've got a lot of information about the company and our services on our website. We also have photos to inspire you, and blogs about eco news and how we can all care for the environment and one another.
Join our mailing list! Sign up at the bottom of our website for access to our monthly newsletter, full of photos, company news, and tips on design and sustainability.
Get a Free Quote! If you're local, and you're interested in turf, paint or solar, give us a call. We're always happy to come out and get you a free quote to help your home or business go green.
Think about us the next time you're making a purchase or using a natural resource! Is there a way you can conserve? Is it possible to choose a sustainable product? Every day, you have a choice. 
Honor Planet Earth by keeping it clean! The next time you take a walk, carry a small trash bag with you and pick up the litter. Schedule a clean-up day at the local park or beach with your neighbors. Be aware of the impact you have on the earth each and every day, and make it a good one.

That's it! Reach out if you have any questions, or if you'd like to find ways to partner up and talk sustainability, growth and responsibility!

story:
Groove Summary

PLEASE MAKE SURE TO VIEW THE ATTACHED VIDEO! And thank you for coming to check us out! Help us make a difference!

A Social Enterprise is defined as: An organization that applies commercial strategies to maximize improvements in human and environmental well-being.

One Big Collaboration for Peace.Justice.Humanity and the pursuit of Grooviness!

As mobile DJ's in Southern California, we have hosted or helped organize numerous charity events over the years, raising thousands of dollars for those in need. From homeless shelters and food banks to recovery and addiction groups, we have been an integral part of almost 30 charity events. Inspired by the "Axis of Justice" tour, that brought together musicians, fans, and grassroots activism to fight for social justice together.  We are looking to take this work to the next level, and do it on a daily basis from the coolest boutique/co.op/workshop ever! #shopchillcreate

The purpose of the proposed boutique, along with the Revolution Groove clothing line, is to create revenue and create a social impact. Creating locally owned businesses makes the way for the people to control the economy and the push toward living wages for all. Revolution Groove plans to use a portion of the profit to support local and global community efforts toward self-sustainablilty and for giving to charities, meanwhile becoming a place that will cultivate the arts and education. #respectart

As we hear daily how programs for the poor and under privileged are being cut or completely eliminated, now is the time to stand up for those in need. We are looking for a lot of help from what we like to call "co-conspirators in the evil plot to make the world a better place."

Your contributions will go to help us secure the first of many permanent locations. This space will be an open venue for musicians to play, teachers to teach, artists to create, and the community to organize. From these locations we will create unique shopping experiences that involve art, music, decor, accessories, hand crafted artisan wares from around the world and around the corner. Worldly and eclectic ...this space will "propagate RAD". All things in the store will support someone, somewhere, fairly. The largest collective on the planet is an amazing goal to have! #propagaterad

 

What We Need & What You Get

Initially we are looking for $50k. This includes;

  • $10k Lease 
  • $15k Build Out ( includes; coffee bar, stage, screen printing and shipping areas)
  • $5k Equipment (printing press and embroidery machine)
  • $5k Inventory
  • $5k Employee Support (during build out) 
  • $10k Marketing and Hiring 

We can't wait to establish a stylish, inviting, funky, and tolerant space to educate and strategize, socialize and organize.

We plan to use this seed money to establish a foundation to create more revenue by immediately producing and selling the Revolution Groove brand clothing and swag. The perks offered in exchange for your contributions will help launch this important aspect of this operation, from edgy stickers and cut vinyl to apparel items, designed to get the point across. Always utilizing fairly traded, eco friendly materials, the gear is designed to engage and inspire.

A random sampling of just a few designs...one stolen! (thanks Street Sweeper Social Club)

If this project falls short in initial seed money, we will continue with at least the first stage of the project. We will purchase needed screen printing and embroidery equipment so that we can continue to grow the Revolution Groove brand clothing line, and operate in an online store format. While growing the Revolution Groove brand, we will build the online version of our fair-trade, local and global boutique. The online store will help us continually work toward raising funds for the brick and mortar storefront, along with work toward the ability to support charities and activities.

The Impact

Supporting those "around the world and around the corner" is our philosophy. Generous contributions made by our co-conspirators will support a wide variety of projects and people, through our online and in-store sales and activities. Every purchase will be supporting someone, somewhere, fairly! From Ugandan and Darfur genocide survivors, displaced Syrian artisans, and local homeless shelter populations, to local artists and environmental organizations.  Our daily work will be about supporting those in need, as well as those trying to change the world. Organizations like the ACLU, Southern Poverty Law Center, Sea Shepard, FreeSET, and International Worldwide Workers are examples of who we will seek to support.  We will also cultivate a 'give where you live' mantra. This project is ALL about the outcome, by creating income and supporting those in need!

An example of the impact of your contribution is illustrated in a personal story of our support of YouthHope. As mobile DJs in Redlands, California we were able to connect with an amazing group of individuals who helped homeless teens find the help they needed. This means the most basic of needs; food, suicide counseling, clothing, transportation, skill building, schooling, and literally anything else the kids may need. 

Our story starts with an afternoon helping repair bicycles that had been donated but were still inoperable. As we spent the day trying to collect working parts off the donated bicycles, to repair anything we could, we were only able to get one up and running. We were hoping to have had more complete bicycles but one was all that could be done. The goal of these bicycles were to provide transportation for the kids so they could get to school and work. We were happy to at least have one to give. This bike went to a young man who had to go get his license the following day for a job interview. The look on his face when told he had his ride was unforgettable, and left an everlasting impression on our hearts. This changed his life and gives us purpose daily! You can support them  too at youthhope.org

Risks & Challenges

Some risks and challenges involved in creating a startup venture with a storefront are the time and money it takes in building awareness, and maintaining overhead costs.

To take on these challenges we have a combined;

  • 30 plus years of retail and customer service experience
  • A decade of fundraising and event organization experience
  • 20 plus years of business management
  • BA with a minor in Human Resource Management
  • MA in Organizational Development and Leadership with a specialization in Social Media and Technology 

All of this experience and our passion for Social Enterprise provides us with the tools and knowledge we need to overcome any challenges. 

Our team understands what our challenges are with creating a start up venture and we are committed to overcoming them. Your support will help provide a solid foundation for this business and help fuel our determination for success!

Our plan to solve challenges is to be prepared financially and to be aware. Our team has a business plan that covers the needs to begin operations of this store. We will begin online if financially it makes sense, depending on the success of this campaign. We will continue to grow the business until we are able to open a brick and mortar storefront. We plan to take each step with concise thought and value to our contributors. 

Other Ways You Can Get in the Groove!

Other ways you can help are...help us promote the campaign online. IndieGoGo has awesome share tools. Help us spread the love! And spread it everywhere!

Futuristically, If you are local to a physical location we would love to have you help out with workshops, teach ins, community organization and fund raising efforts in those areas.

Thank you for your time, consideration, and contribution!

Join the Revolution! Get in the Groove!

Follow us everywhere!!!  

twitter.com/revolutiongruv

facebook.com/revolutiongroove

instagram.com/revolutiongroove

#shopchillcreate

#respectart

#propagaterad

story:
Did you ever see a tattoo and think "I need something like that!" Have you ever walked down the street seeing people with tattoos and wondered where they got them?

Do you want to show of your beautiful ink to the world? Or do you want to find tattooed models for your advertising campaign or promotion?

Do you just love ink and do you want to find new ideas and inspiration for your own collection?

Then look no further! 
Discover: INKbase, The Tattoo Social Network!

Short Summary

INKbase is the first social media network that is centered solely around tattoos and everything surrounding it. INKbase will allow like-minded people and businesses to connect with each other for:

Photo and video sharing

Sharing current and upcoming events

Business endeavours

Dating

Educational purposes

And much more...

INKbase was conceived by instagram users who wanted a clear and orderly website/app to showcase their pride and joy: Tattoos! 

Whether you are a person who loves tattoos, a tattooed model, a tattooer or a tattoo ink salesman, INKbase is the place for you. 

What We Need & What You Get

The website is currently in development, and the funding here will help us to cover the costs of development partners, marketing, promotion, merchandising etc... 

The INKbase website will become reality whether we reach our funding or not, but the funding here will give us the opportunity to launch this project with a BANG! Every dollar will make INKbase bigger, bolder, more awesome, more famous and more beautiful!

And you can be a part of it! There are lots of great perks for those who contribute to this ground breaking website!

The Impact

Imagine having a social media profile where every single visitor is interested in your niche. Imagine having a tattoo shop and being able to promote yourself easily to all tattooed persons in your local area.
Imagine being a tattooed model and being able to connect with pages, websites, photographers, producers, magazines and much more. All of them interested in tattoos and tattooed models!
Imagine being a tattoo aftercare company and connecting easily with all local, national or international tattoo shops.
Imagine loving tattoos, and being able to see lots of them, every day. Getting inspiration, ideas, new friends and in the end... New ink!

Risks & Challenges

The only challenges we face are:

-Getting the word out there;

-Building a user friendly website;

-Putting the INKbase brand on the map;

-Totally owning this thing!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, it's no problem at all, you can still help us by:

-Telling your friends about this campaign;

-Leaving comments or interesting ideas

Following us on Instagram: @inkbase.official or twitter: @INKbase92

Sharing our campaign to your friends and networks! (Tip: check out the Indiegogo share tools!)

Together we can make this work!

story:
Now imagine what it’s like to be a teenager in foster care. As these young people approach legal adulthood, they face tremendous obstacles, including the unrealistic expectation that they will be able to succeed on their own when they turn 18. (Some states have raised the age to up to 21)

In fact, over the past decade, more than 200,000 teenagers have aged out of foster care at 18 - often without achieving permanent family connections or those critical building blocks of support. Consequently, too many of them face challenges immediately upon leaving foster care - challenges that don’t just affect this cohort of young people, but that affect us all.

A study issued in May 2013 by the Jim Casey Youth Opportunities Initiative — and illustrated in a new infographic — shows that, on average, for every young person who ages out of foster care, taxpayers and communities pay $300,000 in social costs like public assistance, incarceration, and lost wages to a community over that person’s lifetime. Do the math and you can conservatively estimate that this problem incurs almost $8 billion in social costs to the United States every year.

It’s time to do something. The case for investing in youth aging out of foster care is a powerful one. Major savings are not only possible, but they are achievable in the relatively near term. The most costly outcomes — and the ones that hurt young people the most — come as a result of events, decisions, and behaviors that occur within a few years or even within days of leaving foster care, like becoming homeless or dropping out of school. For many of these youth, the challenges that start in their teen years and early 20s, such as academic failure or unplanned pregnancies, continue throughout the rest of their lives.

So what can we do? Like many social problems, the answer lies in prevention.

I personally feel the need to do my part, as I understand better than anyone the struggles and obstacles they truly face.

This is where you come in!

I want to open a bakery…..not just any bakery. I have been baking my entire life. It was my therapy while in the foster care system. I have managed and worked at many bakeries and it has always been my passion and calling.  I want to employ children getting ready to age out of the system. I want to teach them skills required in everyday life. For example, customer service skills, cooking, budgeting and monetary responsibility. But also include skills they can take to their future employers such as, marketing, inventory, following direction and working with a team.

 But most importantly, give them a place they can call home. A place they can come to for compassion and understanding when no one else understands.

A portion of the bakery’s profits will go towards scholarships for these kids! After successfully completing a year paid internship, they will be eligible for scholarships.Whether they want to attend college, or attend a trade school, we want to be able to give them that option.

We will also have a General Fund they can borrow from at a 0% interest and paid back in manageable low monthly paycheck deductions, not only to teach responsibility but to have a sense of accomplishment. This fund will be used to purchase furniture for their first apartment, pay deposits for utility services, purchase interview attire, or other expenses that they require that so many of us that have parents or a support unit take for granted.  With little or no family, many of these kids have no one to assist them with the everyday costs associated with adult life.

How Can You Help?!

The money raised through this campaign would go toward:

Space: We found the space, but it needs work..we will do most of the remodel...and a hood exhaust! (tad expensive)

Ingredients: Inventory...Flour Sugar, Eggs, Butter, etc...you know, the yummy stuff! (which can definitely come at a cost!)

Equipment: We need ovens, mixers, tools, display cases, bakeware….everything associated with opening a bakery.

Packaging: I'm looking into streamlining the packaging to create a unique brand identity. Our boxes and packaging will tie into the Yeasty Boyz name... Our boxes will be 80's Boom boxes!! (If youre a child of the 80's...you will totally relate. Like Totally!)

Seating: Tables, chairs....we want to teach baking classes as well to get the community more involved!

 Please, not only help me open a bakery, but help me raise these kids up to their highest potential....it takes a village, or maybe a bakery!
story_txt:
Now imagine what it’s like to be a teenager in foster care. As these young people approach legal adulthood, they face tremendous obstacles, including the unrealistic expectation that they will be able to succeed on their own when they turn 18. (Some states have raised the age to up to 21)

In fact, over the past decade, more than 200,000 teenagers have aged out of foster care at 18 - often without achieving permanent family connections or those critical building blocks of support. Consequently, too many of them face challenges immediately upon leaving foster care - challenges that don’t just affect this cohort of young people, but that affect us all.
A study issued in May 2013 by the Jim Casey Youth Opportunities Initiative — and illustrated in a new infographic — shows that, on average, for every young person who ages out of foster care, taxpayers and communities pay $300,000 in social costs like public assistance, incarceration, and lost wages to a community over that person’s lifetime. Do the math and you can conservatively estimate that this problem incurs almost $8 billion in social costs to the United States every year.
It’s time to do something. The case for investing in youth aging out of foster care is a powerful one. Major savings are not only possible, but they are achievable in the relatively near term. The most costly outcomes — and the ones that hurt young people the most — come as a result of events, decisions, and behaviors that occur within a few years or even within days of leaving foster care, like becoming homeless or dropping out of school. For many of these youth, the challenges that start in their teen years and early 20s, such as academic failure or unplanned pregnancies, continue throughout the rest of their lives.
So what can we do? Like many social problems, the answer lies in prevention.
I personally feel the need to do my part, as I understand better than anyone the struggles and obstacles they truly face.
This is where you come in!

I want to open a bakery…..not just any bakery. I have been baking my entire life. It was my therapy while in the foster care system. I have managed and worked at many bakeries and it has always been my passion and calling.  I want to employ children getting ready to age out of the system. I want to teach them skills required in everyday life. For example, customer service skills, cooking, budgeting and monetary responsibility. But also include skills they can take to their future employers such as, marketing, inventory, following direction and working with a team.
 But most importantly, give them a place they can call home. A place they can come to for compassion and understanding when no one else understands.
A portion of the bakery’s profits will go towards scholarships for these kids! After successfully completing a year paid internship, they will be eligible for scholarships.Whether they want to attend college, or attend a trade school, we want to be able to give them that option.
We will also have a General Fund they can borrow from at a 0% interest and paid back in manageable low monthly paycheck deductions, not only to teach responsibility but to have a sense of accomplishment. This fund will be used to purchase furniture for their first apartment, pay deposits for utility services, purchase interview attire, or other expenses that they require that so many of us that have parents or a support unit take for granted.  With little or no family, many of these kids have no one to assist them with the everyday costs associated with adult life.
How Can You Help?!
The money raised through this campaign would go toward:
Space: We found the space, but it needs work..we will do most of the remodel...and a hood exhaust! (tad expensive)
Ingredients: Inventory...Flour Sugar, Eggs, Butter, etc...you know, the yummy stuff! (which can definitely come at a cost!)
Equipment: We need ovens, mixers, tools, display cases, bakeware….everything associated with opening a bakery.
Packaging: I'm looking into streamlining the packaging to create a unique brand identity. Our boxes and packaging will tie into the Yeasty Boyz name... Our boxes will be 80's Boom boxes!! (If youre a child of the 80's...you will totally relate. Like Totally!)
Seating: Tables, chairs....we want to teach baking classes as well to get the community more involved!
 Please, not only help me open a bakery, but help me raise these kids up to their highest potential....it takes a village, or maybe a bakery!
